fields.en_description: Ginkaku (銀角) was one of Kumogakure's Gold and Silver Brothers alongside Kinkaku, who were the most notorious criminals in the history of their village. During the First Raikage's reign, the Gold and Silver Brothers were part of a team that was assigned to capture the Nine-Tailed Demon Fox, but the two were swallowed during the confrontation. However, they survived by eating the flesh of the beast, and thrashed inside the tailed beast's stomach for two weeks, eventually forcing the Nine-Tails to

Giichi (ギイチ) is a construction worker and an old friend of Tazuna. At some point in the past, he met Agari and married her. Giichi used to be cowardly as seen when he refused to help build the bridge anymore because of Gatō. Later, after he saw how brave Inari was, he overcame his cowardly self and rallied others to attack Gatō's men. His wife, Agari also had some influence over his decision to help Inari. Giichi is an older man with black eyes and shaggy grey hair. He wears a greenish-coloured

Ginji (ギンジ) is the banker of Kakuzu, a member of the Akatsuki. As a banker, he managed Kakuzu's extensive wealth that was obtained through collecting the bounty on ninja. Ginji has a crop of short, dull, black hair and dark eyes. He wears a simple blue suit along with a pair of shoes. He's also seen with a cigar in his mouth. Main article: Itachi Pursuit Mission After Kakuzu's death, Hebi sought him out to learn about Akatsuki's whereabouts. After hearing a disturbance outside, he sends Kyōya to
Gojō (ゴジョウ) is an inhabitant of the Land of Wind and the father of Isago.

Goji is a Sunagakure genin and a member of Team Goji. Goji is a proud individual, as is evident from the fact that he doesn't like the idea of being ordered around by Shira. He refuses to accept hand-outs. At the same time, he is willing to admit defeat gracefully and push on soon afterwards to accomplish his goals. He is also rather perceptive, as seen during his battle with Sen where he quickly analysed her abilities and deduced an exploitable weakness. Goji has orange hair, yellow eyes with b

Gokai (ゴカイ) is a pirate from the Funato Clan. Gokai was already part of the Funato clan when Araumi Funato returned from one of his raids with an orphan named Tenma, who he would take in as his son. Gokai is a rational man who tries to cool off the short-tempered Funamushi, but due to his lower rank in the team, he has to obey his leader, who does not listen to Gokai's ideas. Like all other soldiers, Gokai is loyal to the clan and respects Funamushi, despite his attempts to strangle Gokai and, i

Gonbee (権兵衛) is a Kirigakure jōnin. At some point, Gonbee became Chōjūrō's superior and taught him with strictness and love. He also became a close associate of Genji, the village's elder. Although he appears to be a stern person, Gonbee also has a caring side to him, seen in how affectionately he taught Chōjūrō over the years. Gonbee has a short crop of light brown hair and dark eyes. He wears a blue-clothed Kirigakure forehead protector and a long-sleeved brown zip-up shirt. Before the Mizukag

Gongorō Kamakura (鎌倉ゴンゴロウ, Kamakura Gongorō) is a retired shinobi, who went on to become a famous actor. Gongorō takes great pride in his work as an actor. He is famed for his quote of proving with actions rather than words. However, he seems to easily get stressed out, as he began eating too much until the point of gaining weight. His enjoyment for food began to affect his work. However, after heeding Boruto's advice to live by his own quote, Gongorō finally stopped over-eating and began exerci

Gosunkugi (五寸釘) is a thief who operates in and out of the Land of Stone. On one occasion, he murdered a family of three and left the blame on another man that he briefly fought upon departure. That man was the local blacksmith Tokichi (who became Sazanami) who fled from the vengeful villagers and became a bounty hunter to hunt down Gosunkugi. Over the years he has accumulated a bounty of three million ryō. He would kill anyone that stood in the way of what he wanted to steal. Gosunkugi specialis

Goshiki (ゴシキ) is a tour guide at Tanzaku Castle. Goshiki has short spiky brown hair and black eyes. He wears a green long-sleeved shirt and a light green-coloured collared shirt underneath it. Main article: Search for Tsunade Goshiki is seen fleeing the seen after Orochimaru attacks and destroys Tanzaku Castle. He warns Naruto and Jiraiya about what happened. "Goshiki" (五色) describes "five colours" as a group, for example the colours of the Chinese Five Elements (white, black, red, green, yellow

Gotta (ゴッタ) was a member, and seemingly the leader of the Iburi clan. As a member of the Iburi clan, Gotta lived in hiding with the rest of his clan until Orochimaru discovered them. Using the cursed seal to stabilise their abilities, he manipulated the clan into giving him their children for the purposes of his experiments. Gotta seemingly led the clan in the absence of either Orochimaru or Danzō. Eventually, Orochimaru's experiments were discovered by Konohagakure, forcing him to abandon the v

Gozu (牛頭) is a shinobi from Otogakure and a member of Team Guren. At some point in the past, Gozu was dying from thirst and food deprivation. Guren saved his life by giving him a ladle of water. Whilst not enough to sate his thirst, it was enough to keep him alive. He is unsociable and quiet, making people unable to figure out what he is thinking, but his battle skills are without a doubt very dexterous. He relies on taijutsu and brute strength and prefers fighting alone. He holds a special, fon

fields.en_description: Gozu (ゴズ, Gozu) was a member of Konohagakure's Anbu faction Root led by Danzō Shimura. Gozu and his younger twin brother, Mezu, were surgically altered to look like Kagen Uchiha, allowing them to take turns spying on the Uchiha clan by impersonating Kagen. When not in the village impersonating Kagen, Gozu wore a red marked mask resembling a monkey. Both reported directly to Danzō about their findings for several years, but in the year leading up to the Uchiha Clan Downfall, they also helped Itac

Guren (紅蓮) is a kunoichi from Otogakure and the leader of a group of Orochimaru's subordinates, possessing the unique Crystal Release kekkei genkai. As a child, Guren came from a small village where she was shunned by others because she had unique powers. Later, Orochimaru appeared and destroyed the entire village single-handedly. He was intrigued by Guren's powers and offered for her to come with him. Guren chose to follow him because she envied his power. At some point, Orochimaru sent her to

fields.en_description: Guruko (グルコ) is a ninken and a personal summon of Kakashi Hatake. In the anime, after they made a contract with Kakashi, Guruko and the other ninken aided him to search the abducted Rin Nohara by the Kirigakure shinobi and acted as a diversion in order to allow them to flee. They also helped searching for the fleeing Orochimaru. He has tan fur, a white snout, long ears that have a dark brown colour and noticeably more pronounced whiskers than the other ninken. He wears the standard outfit of Kak

Gyūki (牛鬼), more commonly known as the Eight-Tails (八尾, Hachibi), is one of the nine tailed beasts. It has been in the possession of Kumogakure for decades, where it has been sealed into many jinchūriki. Its most recent jinchūriki, and the first to have any success in cooperating with it, is Killer B. Gyūki and the tailed beasts first came into being in the waning days of Hagoromo Ōtsutsuki, who used his Creation of All Things Technique to divide the Ten-Tails' chakra into nine separate bodies a

en_general_infos.Jinchūriki: Blue b killer b obito uchiha naruto uzumaki

fields.en_description: Guren (グレン, Guren) was a prisoner at Orochimaru's Northern Hideout. At some point in the past he received a cursed seal in the course of Orochimaru's experiments. He is extremely violent and cruel; he is also unable to control his lust for battle. Guren has long shaggy orange hair. When activated, the cursed seal he possesses resembles vines as it spreads across his body. In its level two state he grew wing-like protrusions from his forearms and a broad flat tail. While in his second state he ha

Gyokurō Chabashira (茶柱ギョクロウ, Chabashira Gyokurō) is a genin of Konohagakure. He seems to enjoy watching battles. Gyokurō is a stocky guy with blue eyes, thin eyebrows, and dark hair, one strand of which hangs over his forehead on the right. He wears a blue tank top over which he wears a brown jacket and a blue scarf. Main article: Ao Arc At the Training Hall, Gyokurō watched Boruto Uzumaki fight the Seventh Hokage alongside other genin. Gyokurō's full name roughly translates to "clear jewel, tea

Gōshō (豪焼) was the leader of Ceramic Village. Gōshō was the son of Mashō, the leader of Ceramic Village. Mashō, the creator of the Hanasaki style of ceramics, had strong artistic sensibilities. When the clay used in Hanasaki began to run out, Mashō refused to compromise his standards, in turn threatening to ruin the village once the clay inevitably ran out. To stop this from happening, Gōshō secretly killed his father and all the other Hanasaki practitioners, telling everyone they'd abandoned th

Gōza (ゴウザ) is a Senior from Sunagakure. He has been described as a rational, level-headed, and calm individual. Gōza has dark eyes and brown hair which is obscured by the ghutrah he wears. He has a full beard and wears the standard attire of the Sunagakure Senior which consists of a dark kimono under a light-coloured haori and a poncho. As a member of the advisory council, he is most likely one of Sunagakure's wisest shinobi. During Gaara's abduction, his foremost concern was the dignity of the

Gōzu (業頭) and his twin brother Meizu were chūnin of Kirigakure before defecting and becoming mercenaries alongside Zabuza Momochi. He and his brother fled the village with Zabuza when they failed in their attempt to kill the Mizukage, and thereafter began working for him as assassins. In sharp contrast to his brother, Gōzu is described as being rational, level-headed and calm. Gōzu had shoulder-length, wild dark-brown hair and dark eyes. He wears a rebreather that covers the lower half of his fa

fields.en_description: Hagoromo Ōtsutsuki (大筒木ハゴロモ, Ōtsutsuki Hagoromo), known to Earth's population at large as the Sage of Six Paths (六道仙人, Rikudō Sennin, English TV: The Sage of the Six Paths), was a legendary godlike figure who is regarded as the ancestor of shinobi, for his act of founding ninshū which led to the creation of the ninja world. He was the son of Princess Kaguya‎‎ and alongside his fraternal twin brother, Hamura, were the first to be born with the same powerful chakra as their mother. Together, he an

fields.en_description: Haido (ハイド) was a warlord searching for the Stone of Gelel. Haido had bought the Book of Gelel from a merchant overseas (as he claimed, though Kahiko doubted to be so simple), and used it to look for the Gelel vein for powers to rule the world, which led him and his knights to where the vein rests. He and his subordinates, Fugai, Kamira, and Ranke, attacked Temujin's village (although Temujin didn't know about it at the time). The reason Haido attacked Temujin's village was to obtain the stone o

Haguruma (ハグルマ) is a programmer, working for the Kaminarimon Company. Haguruma was a game programmer. After having to deal with an unforgiving schedule to release a game on time, he and his colleagues decided to file a complaint against their boss. The boss somehow discovered it, and faked evidence of Haguruma selling company secrets, which resulted on him being fired, making him an example for his colleagues. No other company would hire him, and his debts pilled up enough for him to rob a bank.

Hachidai (ハチダイ) is a miner from the Land of Rivers. Hachidai is a bald headed man with black eyes. He has a black beard and wears a simple outfit with a blue-coloured cloth tied around his shoulders and a white twisted cloth wrapped around his head tied on the right side. He and his friends leave the village after Raiga Kurosuki overthrows the village's government. They get caught in a storm after leaving and eventually wind up in the Land of Fire, where they meet Naruto Uzumaki. Hachidai return

Hagiri (ハギリ) was a friend of Tenma Izumo during their time in Konohagakure's Academy. Hagiri's mother and sister died during the Nine-Tailed Demon Fox's Attack while he watched helplessly. Because many believed the attack to have been the doing of an Uchiha, Hagiri joined Tenma and Katsura in bullying Itachi Uchiha. Despite being much younger than all of them, Itachi easily defeated them once a fight broke out.

Haie (ハイエ) is a guard at Hōzuki Castle. Haie is a corrupt individual, partaking in bribes with his superior, Benga, and acting as an in-between between him and other prisoners. Main article: Mujina Bandits Arc When Benga left a meeting with Mūjo, he complained to Haie that Mūjo was only a figurehead, and that he was the true power in the prison because he actually ran the place. Later, Haie informed Benga that Tsukiyo wanted a meeting, and accompanied him to it. Later, when prisoners got agitate

Haku (白) was an orphan from the Land of Water, and a descendant of the Yuki clan. He later became a shinobi under Zabuza Momochi's tutelage whom he later partnered with, ultimately becoming a Mercenary Ninja. Haku was born in a small, snowy village in the Land of Water, a land that had suffered from war not long before. In this war, different sides battled each other using ninja, some of whom possessed kekkei genkai. After the war ended, memories of the horrific battles still lingered in the min

Hakkaku (ハッカク) is a cooking-nin from the Land of Lightning. He went to the same cooking academy as Teuchi. Many years after attending the academy, Hakkaku had become a succesful cooking-nin. His food made everyone who ate it keep on eating it, eventually making them fat. However, he became jealous of Teuchi, who had a fabled "Phantom" Recipe, which was highly acclaimed. He visited Teuchi and wanted to know the recipe only to be denied. In an attempt to know the recipe, Hakkaku and his fellow coo

Hainosuke is a pet cat from Kumogakure that appears in Naruto Shippūden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 4. Hainosuke is referred to as being a troublemaker. Hainosuke is a grey cat with black stripes. Hainosuke runs away from his owner, a young boy. The boy asks Naruto Uzumaki if he happened to see Hainosuke and says that he ran towards the village's entrance, which is his favourite spot. Naruto finds Hainosuke near the entrance and has him return to his owner. Naruto returns to verify Hainosuke's return,

Hako Kuroi (黒衣ハコ, Kuroi Hako) is a genin from Team 25, that has joined Konohagakure's Anbu. Hako is a very straight-forward person with a melancholic demeanour. She is very free and open with her opinions and likewise can be very blunt. Along with this direct nature, she is extremely perceptive, able to notice the smallest of details from a quick observation. From this, she can quickly discern the nature of person and their life to make correct conclusions on situations at hand. She seems to be

This woman was a member of the Yuki clan as well as Haku's mother. Due to the kekkei genkai wielding ninja being hated by Kirigakure because of the tragedies they had brought in the war, Haku's mother had to hide her heritage in order to live a peaceful life. She eventually married a local farmer and had a son, whom they named Haku. The couple lived happily and loved their child. However, Haku inherited the Ice Release from his mother, and upon discovering this, he showed it to her proudly. In r

He was a simple farmer and the father of Haku. Haku's father was a simple farmer. He eventually married a seemingly normal woman, and the two had a son whom they named Haku. The family lived happily and peacefully for many years. However, this changed when Haku discovered he inherited Ice Release kekkei genkai and showed it to his mother. The father saw this from the shadows, realising that his wife was a member of the Yuki clan. The clan carried the kekkei genkai that the villagers of the Land

Hakuhyō (薄氷) was the son of Kahyō. His death instigated the formation of the Ryūha Armament Alliance. At some point in time, Hakuhyō and his mother, Kahyō, left Kirigakure in the hope that Hakuhyō would not suffer because of how he was born and be corrupted by the village's dark practices. They would come to settle in the Land of Waves and enjoyed happiness for a time. During an attempt to protect his friend from hornets using his Ice Release, Hakuhyō was stung. Despite saving his friend from th

Hakui (白医) was a missing-nin of the "Leaf's Anbu" who appeared in Naruto Shippūden: Ultimate Ninja Heroes 3 that served under Shinga. He was Shinga's loyal servant, and he referred to him as Lord Shinga (真牙さま, Shinga-sama). He thought very highly of him, killing others simply because they were "his Lord's enemy", and shared his goals. Out of battle, he appeared to be very calm and collected, being a lot more reasonable and detached than his comrade, Dōshin. Hakui had long, light blonde hair that

Hakuto (ハクト) was a genin-level kunoichi of Sunagakure and the head of the Hōki Family. After an elaborate act was performed, Hakuto moved to Konohagakure with Shigezane to live with the Nara clan. Hakuto was raised by other members of her family, including her elder sister and bodyguard Shijima, due to her parents passing away in the war. Eventually, she began a romantic relationship with Shigezane. At some point, Suna Council member Tōjūrō came to Hakuto with a plan to have her wed Fifth Kazeka

Hakubi Shin (清ハクビ, Shin Hakubi) is a missing-nin originally from Konohagakure. During his time as a Konoha-nin, Hakubi gained recognition as a "special" ninja with decent skills. However, he had the bad habit of stealing while on missions, for which reason he was expelled from the village. Afterwards, he started taking contract work from whoever would hire him. At some point, he heard that Kakashi Hatake lost his Sharingan. Hakubi's specialty is coating shuriken with lightning chakra, making the

Hakui (ハクイ, Hakui) is a medical-nin of Konohagakure. Hakui has a strong sense of responsibility, and as such, she became a medical-nin to further support her comrades. Hakui has long brown hair that is cut in a hime-cut style and is divided over her forehead, where she wears her Allied Shinobi Forces' forehead protector. She also wears a white coat over her Konoha flak jacket. As a medical-nin, Hakui is very skilled at chakra control which she uses to perform medical ninjutsu. After the murders

Han (ハン) was a shinobi from Iwagakure and the jinchūriki of the Five-Tails, Kokuō. During the Third Shinobi World War, Han became known worldwide for his prowess with steam ninjutsu. At some unspecified time in between the Third Shinobi World War and the capture of Yugito Nii by Kakuzu and Hidan, Han was captured by the Akatsuki, as by the time Yugito was sealed, according to Pain only three tailed beasts remained uncaptured, and he thus died from having the Five-Tails extracted from his body. H

Hamaki Mimura (美村ハマキ, Mimura Hamaki) is a jōnin of Konohagakure. During the Third Shinobi World War, Hamaki's battalion was reduced to a mere four shinobi by their Iwagakure opponents; however, when all apparent hope was seemingly lost, Minato Namikaze arrived. He briefed Minato on the situation and then he, and the other three shinobi, subsequently helped Minato wipe out about fifty opposing Iwa-nin by throwing his Flying Thunder God Kunai behind enemy lines. Hamaki has short dark hair and a be

Hamura Ōtsutsuki (大筒木ハムラ, Ōtsutsuki Hamura) was the son of Princess Kaguya‎‎, the fraternal twin brother of Hagoromo; both of whom were the first people born with the ability to wield chakra. Hamura was the ancestor of the Hyūga clan and the founder of the shinobi of the Moon. Hamura was born as the younger of Kaguya Ōtsutsuki's twin sons, the first people to be born with chakra. When Kaguya realised both Hamura and Hagoromo also had the ability to wield chakra, Kaguya — as the Ten-Tails — tried

fields.en_description: The giant golem was a creature that resided on the moon alongside Toneri Ōtsutsuki. Prior to being animated, it was a stone monument made in Hamura Ōtsutsuki's image. The golem's body was originally a stone monument to Hamura carved into a rock wall over a shrine, but was transformed into a living entity by Toneri Ōtsutsuki using his Tenseigan, allowing it to separate itself from the cliff's side and to crawl using primitive stone arms. As such its appearance resembles that of Hamura's, complete

Hana Inuzuka (犬塚ハナ, Inuzuka Hana) is a chūnin from Konohagakure's Inuzuka clan, as well as an excellent and respected veterinary medical-nin. Her canine companions are ninken triplets: the Three Haimaru Brothers. In the anime, Hana entered the Academy at the same time and shared a class with Izumi, Itachi, Saisu Kamano, and Maruten, under the tutelage of Daikoku Funeno. She was not yet accompanied by her ninken at that time. Hana is quite affectionate to her little brother as well as her dogs. C

Hana is an academy student of Konohagakure who appears in Naruto Shippūden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 4. Hana is a kind, young girl who takes a liking to Shino Aburame. While practising jutsu with Yuki, Mabo and Toshi, Hana loses track of time while practising her Cloak of Invisibility Technique. Naruto Uzumaki and Shino Aburame find her and have her return to Yuki. Naruto and Shino soon return to Hana, who is now with Yuki and Toshi. They ask about Mabo's secret code, but the children don't recall a

Hanabi Hyūga (日向ハナビ, Hyūga Hanabi) is a kunoichi from Konohagakure and the heiress of the Hyūga clan. Hanabi is the younger daughter of the Hyūga clan's head, Hiashi Hyūga. In the anime, while always looking up to her older sister Hinata and wanting to spend more time with her, Hinata's duties as the future heiress of their clan made it hard for the two sisters to have any quality time together. Watching Hinata and seeing her as strong yet so kind, Hanabi aspired to be more like Hinata. Later, H

fields.en_description: Hana Kaka (華々ハナ, Kaka Hana) is a former assassin from the Land of Bamboo, working undercover as an Academy teacher in Konohagakure. Following her experiences in the village, she relinquished her ties to the Land of Bamboo to truly live as a teacher in Konohagakure. Hana was among 50 orphans that were taken in by the minister from the Land of Bamboo. She was trained to be a skilled ninja and assassin. Despite this, Hana could never bring herself to kill anyone. Ultimately, as her gentle nature ca

Hanare (ハナレ) is a kunoichi from the Jōmae Village. As a young child, Hanare was said to be very lonely since she had never known her family or seen her own village. She was trained from an early age in the art of espionage. One day, she was found crying in a place near her village by the young Kakashi, who spotted her and carried her on his back. He then explained to her that she can look up to the clouds above and find her way. They both were then seen by a ninja from Hanare's village and Kakas

Haori (ハオリ) was a resident of the Land of Ancestors during the reign of Kaguya Ōtsutsuki. During Kaguya's reign, Haori appeared to Hagoromo and Hamura Ōtsutsuki to request their assistance with a dispute in the village. In the village, the local farmers were fighting over a shortage of water, which Hagoromo offered to solve. Haori told him to be careful. Later, Hagoromo spotted Haori whilst she was on her way to the God Tree as part of a ritual established by Kaguya. Hagoromo attempted to make h

Hanuma is a monkey who made his debut in Naruto Shippūden: Legends: Akatsuki Rising. Hanuma has blank white fur and long dark blue spiky hair as a Mohawk going down his back. Hanuma is able to call in his monkey troops as helping aid against his enemies. Hanuma made an attempt to get revenge of the endless sets of violence against his species towards the humans, who he thinks as a total threat to his species.

Hanzaki (ハンザキ) is the leader of the Fūma clan. He was one of the members of the Fūma clan who was not seduced by Orochimaru's promise of power. As the leader of his clan, Hanzaki participated in and led most of the clan's activities, including the robbing of random people, in these instances he proves to be willing to kill and steal in order to survive. He did however show some respect for his fellow shinobi, offering to let Jiraiya live in exchange for his money. This respect however turned to

Hanzō (半蔵), feared as Hanzō of the Salamander (山椒魚の半蔵, Sanshōuo no Hanzō), was a legendary shinobi, and the leader of Amegakure during his lifetime. At some point during Hanzō's childhood, he found a black salamander with deadly venom residing in his village. When it died, its venom sac was embedded into his body in the hopes of creating a venomous ninja who himself was immune to toxins. This required him to wear a mask constantly, in order to protect others from his venom-laced breath. At some

fields.en_description: Harine (ハリネ) was one of the orphans at the Konoha Orphanage. Harine was seen with the other children at the Konoha orphanage. He was present when Nonō Yakushi was thinking of a name for Kabuto. Harine wasn't impressed by Nonō Yakushi's idea to name Kabuto after a helmet. Harine is proud of how thick his hair is, so thick that one cannot comb it. Harine has tall, thick spiky blue hair resembeling a hedgehog. He has black-coloured eyes. He wore a grey shirt with three blue coloured stripes. Masash

Harika Aburame (油女ハリカ, Aburame Harika) is an Academy student from the Aburame clan in Konohagakure. She is quite curious and discussed Kawaki's behaviour with her classmate. Like Soul, Harika is a rather simple girl who can happily pat her on the shoulder when her comrade succeeds, and maybe hit her in case of failure. She is easily surprised, and can be aggressive if ignored. Harika becomes happy when someone praises the dish she has prepared. While carefree normally, she has a very assertive a

Haruna (ハルナ) is the daimyō of the Land of Vegetables, who replaced her father after he was assassinated. She had been kept as a hostage for much of her childhood, isolated and under constant surveillance. Her father had done this in order to secure the welfare of the Land of Vegetables, but later came to regret sacrificing Haruna for this purpose. As a result of her isolation and sense of betrayal, Haruna came to see sacrifice as inevitable, and believed that even if many of her subjects were sa

Harusame (ハルサメ) was a Kirigakure shinobi and the former master of Utakata. Harusame was a powerful shinobi of Kirigakure, who at some point became the master of the jinchūriki of the Six-Tails, Utakata. At one point on a mission for Harusame, Utakata had returned with a scroll, saying a shinobi should carry out and complete his mission swiftly. Frustrated at his student, Harusame angrily said that Utakata's job was to track and locate the scroll; not return it. He would go on to say Utakata's li

Hassaku Onomichi (尾道八朔, Onomichi Hassaku) is a shinobi from Kirigakure. Hassaku is a brash individual who dislikes outsiders and is quick to start a fight. Like his allies, Hasasuku has a great hatred for the peaceful era of the Sixth Mizukage, viewing it as an insult to their heritage as they calmly allow tourists to visit the village. Joining Shizuma Hoshigaki, he seeks to restore the "Bloody Mist" era and usurp Chōjūrō. His commitment to this goal is so consuming that he feels he has nothing

Hayate Gekkō (月光 ハヤテ, Gekkō Hayate) was a tokubetsu jōnin of Konohagakure. As a genin, he was placed in a team with Ibiki Morino and Tokara. During the Chūnin Exams, Hayate and his team confronted Team Orochimaru. In the anime, at some point, Hayate was chosen to be Yūgao Uzuki's instructor in kenjutsu; the time the two spent training together eventually led to them falling in love with each other. Hayate seemed to be a calm and composed individual. He was also described as being an individualis

Hashirama Senju (千手柱間, Senju Hashirama) was a member of the famed Senju clan. He himself was hailed as the "God of Shinobi" for his unmatched ninja prowess. Hashirama sought peace for the shinobi world, and to that end founded Konohagakure with his clan, his childhood friend and rival: Madara Uchiha and the Uchiha clan. He would later become the First Hokage (初代火影, Shodai Hokage, literally meaning: First or Founding Fire Shadow) of Konohagakure. Although he was not able to achieve peace during h

Hayama Shirakumo (白雲ハヤマ, Shirakumo Hayama) is a jōnin of Konohagakure. He was assigned to patrol the northern borders along with Tekuno Kanden, Naruto Uzumaki, and Kosuke Maruboshi after the Konoha Crush. Not long after they were ambushed by a battalion of ninja from Iwagakure. Hayama stayed behind to allow the other members of the squad time to escape and report to the village. Along with Tekuno, he wiped out the majority of the ninja. Hayama is a very quiet, calm and collected individual able

Hayase (ハヤセ) is a chūnin of Konohagakure. Hayase has black hair that spikes outward and upward and tends to squint. His attire consists of a forehead protector and a grey jacket that has a hood and a pair of pants. Hayase along with Ōkei were inserted into the first phase of the Chūnin Exams so that other examinees could cheat off of them. "Hayase" means "rapids" or "swift currents" (早瀬).

Hazuki Uchiha (うちはハヅキ, Uchiha Hazuki) was a member of Konohagakure's Uchiha clan. About two years younger than Fugaku, Hazuki left the clan when she married her husband - a non-Uchiha - and with him had a daughter, Izumi. After her husband died defending their daughter during the Nine-Tailed Demon Fox's Attack, she returned to the Uchiha's compound with Izumi. She was the second to die during the Uchiha Clan Downfall, killed by Itachi Uchiha shortly after Izumi.

He was the Head ninja (忍頭, shinobigashira) of Kumogakure at the time of the Hyūga Affair. As the head ninja of Kumogakure at the time, he was sent with an envoy to sign a peace treaty with Konohagakure. However, the treaty was nothing more than a means to gain free entry into the village with the covert purpose of abducting a member of the Hyūga clan in order to obtain the Byakugan. During the middle of the night, he snuck onto the Hyūga clan's estate and abducted young Hinata while she slept. H

She is the granddaughter of the Village Headman. She has black hair and black eyes. She wore a white top over a loose fitting garment with an orange, sleeveless kimono and sandals. After she was kidnapped by Baji and his gang, her grandfather called in the help of Konohagakure's Team 7 and Team 10. She was then later safely rescued by the combined efforts of the two teams. She bears a striking resemblance to Kaede Yoshino.

Hebihime is a shinobi of Otogakure, and one of the recruitable characters in Naruto: Ultimate Ninja Online. Hebihime is notably confident, while she was surprised at the player's ability to break out of her genjutsu, she was still sure of her ability to eliminate them. She is shown to be somewhat delusional, upon meeting her a second time, she states that her enemy ran away last time despite having actually defeated her in their previous encounter. A woman with long black hair, wearing a formal

Hebiichigo (蛇苺) was a kunoichi from Kirigakure. Hebiichigo was an orphan with no memories of her family. She grew up on a trash heap outside of Kirigakure. She would scrounge the area for anything of remote value. During this time, she learned to sew, finding a real pleasure in it even when others found it a waste of time and resources. One day, a missing-nin chanced on the area and attacked her. Desperate to live, she used a pole to kill them. Being praised for her efforts by a Kiri-nin, Hebiic

Heiji (ヘイジ), also known as Heiji of the Rain Shelter (雨宿りのヘイジ, Amayadori no Heiji), was a shinobi from Amegakure as well as the right-hand man of Kandachi. Heiji was a subordinate in Hanzō's regime and the right hand of Kandachi who in turn was the right hand of Hanzō. At some point he was killed within the walls of Amegakure. Some time later, he was accidentally reincarnated by Kabuto Yakushi who was looking for Hanzō instead. Heiji seemed to be a relatively quiet man. He was prideful enough to

Hibachi (ヒバチ) is a former academy student of Konohagakure, assigned to Iruka Umino's class. Hibachi was one of the children that took part in Kiba's race for candy. Hibachi picked on Naruto Uzumaki when he failed to perform the Clone Technique but was stopped by Iruka, saying not to bother with a kid like him. Later, he and his friends refused to let Naruto go with them to perform a test of courage in the Konoha Cemetery. As a payback, Naruto scared him, wearing a mask and cloak pretending to be

Hiashi Hyūga (日向ヒアシ, Hyūga Hiashi) is a shinobi from Konohagakure, as well as the current head of the Hyūga clan. Hiashi was born only seconds before his twin brother Hizashi, making Hiashi the head of the Hyūga clan and Hizashi a member of the branch house, whose only purpose in life would be to protect members of the main house. Years later, when Neji was born, Hizashi became bitter that his son would never be able to reach his full potential like a member of the main house, causing him to be

fields.en_description: Heki (碧) is a jōnin of Kirigakure. Heki was once Ao's partner and experienced many battles alongside him. At some point, he chose to support the village from the foundation by becoming a close associate of Genji, Kirigakure's elder. Heki wears a brown haori, one attire of a Kirigakure shinobi. He has black eyes and wears a hat styled grey Kirigakure forehead protector. After fighting many battles in his life, Heki is an experienced shinobi. By supporting the politics of the village, it stands to

Hibari (ひばり) is a former academy student of Konohagakure. Hibari has brown hair which was drawn into a bun with a bang covering her right eye. She wore a multi-coloured yellow blouse along with pair of shorts and sandals. She also has big black eyes. She was a classmate of Konohamaru Sarutobi's in the Academy. She asked Iruka who the Fifth Hokage was, only to find out that at the time, there wasn't one. "Hibari" (火針) describes a "heated acupuncture needle". When written as "雲雀", it is the Japane

Hibari Kamakura (鎌倉ヒバリ, Kamakura Hibari) is an actress in Konohagakure. Hibari is an old friend of Neon's mother, leading Neon and Osuka to being friends. When Hibari became busier with work, she asked Neon to keep Osuka company. At times, Hibari can come off as a workaholic, often doing projects to the point of not spending enough time with her family. Despite this, Hibari loves and cherishes her family, caring for their happiness and safety. She will even exhaust herself with projects to ensur

Hibiki (ヒビキ) is the sister of Kodama. After her father's murder and the investigation going nowhere over lack of evidence, Hibiki and Kodama became dedicated to avenging their father by finding the killer, who was a proficient Wind Release user and was left with a cross shaped scar after the encounter with their father. They would go from village to village attacking ex-shinobi who were Wind Release users, though they never killed any of their victims, leaving only cross shaped tears on their cl

Hidan (飛段) is an S-rank missing-nin who defected from Yugakure and later joined the Akatsuki, and a worshipper of Jashin. There, he was partnered with Kakuzu, despite the two's somewhat mutual dislike of each other. He was also the second newest member of Akatsuki at the time of Tobi's introduction. Kisame Hoshigaki laughingly referred to Hidan and Kakuzu as the Zombie Combo (ゾンビコンビ, Zonbi Konbi, English TV: Zombie Pair). During his childhood, after hearing rumours about the Valley of Hell, Hida

Hidari (ヒダリ) is a former shinobi turned mercenary alongside his partner Ashimaru. After the Fourth Shinobi World War ended, Hidari and Ashimaru lost their jobs, leading to them taking missions directly. Fifteen years later, the pair was hired by Iori, with the objective to retrieve the deed to the Green Banks bridge. Providing Iori with poison, he used it to kill the village head of Green Banks. For three months, the two assaulted the village in an attempt to force the new village head Kiri into

Hidero (日出郎) appears in Naruto the Movie: Ninja Clash in the Land of Snow. He is a popular actor in the movie "Princess Gale", where he plays the character Shishimaru. In the movie, Hidero, Kin, and Michy summoned their rainbow chakra to defeat the Armoured Warriors and their boss. Hidero is a relaxed individual and has a strong dislike towards cold weather. He is a tall man with dark spiky hair and small eyes. He wears a dark sleeveless-kimono. Despite the fact that he is an actor and, in fact,

Hikaku Uchiha (うちはヒカク, Uchiha Hikaku) was a member of the Uchiha clan before the founding of Konohagakure. He had shoulder-length brown hair that framed his face and the rest of which he tied into a high ponytail. He wore a high-collared purple shirt that had a chain of sorts draped around the right shoulder. Despite his young age, he was one of the clan's most powerful shinobi and was also endowed with great leadership skills. He possessed the clan's kekkei genkai, the Sharingan. "Hikaku" can m

Hikaru (ヒカル) is a shinobi from Kumogakure and captain of the ship which escorted the Konohagakure delegation to the island. Hikaru is a calm person and he seems to normally forget things that he was supposed to mention to others a lot. Hikaru is also referred to as being a show-off and is often blamed for being showy. Despite this, he is a hard worker. Hikaru has brown spiky hair, a small goatee, and dark eyes. Hikaru wears the standard Kumogakure shinobi outfit inclusive of flak jacket and fore

Hikaru Tsuki (ツキヒカル, Tsuki Hikaru) is the son of the king of the Land of the Moon, Michiru, who appears in Naruto the Movie: Guardians of the Crescent Moon Kingdom. When Amayo divorced with Michiru over the latter's money-minded personality, Michiru got custody of Hikaru due to the wedding contract Amayo signed. When Kakeru Tsuki, grandfather of Hikaru and king of the Land of the Moon, decided to deal with the corrupt minister Shabadaba, he sent Hikaru and Michiru overseas under the guise of vac

Himeno is a princess of a sick-bedded father that needed to be protected from shinobi bandits during the Swelling Mushroom Mission. Himeno is a princess that is out looking for a mushroom called the "swelling mushroom". Later on, she wants to protect herself whenever fighting against shinobi bandits and wants to make herself stronger. Himeno is a somewhat royal type of princess that is a daughter of a sick bed ridden daimyō. She has her protectors call her, Your Highness Himeno whenever speaking

Himatsu (ヒマツ) is a citizen from Takigakure. Himatsu has been shown to have great faith in Shibuki no matter what happens. Himatsu has a large crop of spiky black hair and big black eyes. He wears a blue long-sleeved jacket and tannish-coloured pants. He and his sister, Shizuku, are kidnapped by Suien to force Shibuki to give up the Hero Water. Despite Shibuki's well-known cowardice, Himatsu and Shizuku do not lose faith in him and hold out until they are saved by Naruto and Sasuke. Himatsu (ヒマツ)

Himeyuri (ヒメユリ) was a wealthy businesswoman and the president of the Himeyuri Company. She was a patron at the Coliseum. Himeyuri indulged in a wealthy lifestyle and had a short temper, scolding the shinobi she contracted after they lose a fight. Himeyuri was a fair-skinned woman with a rotund build. She had long blonde hair held back with a red hairband and turquoise-coloured eyes. She wore red lipstick and light purple eye shadow. She wore a large pink dress with white gloves and purple earrin

fields.en_description: Himawari Uzumaki (うずまきヒマワリ, Uzumaki Himawari) is a citizen of Konohagakure, a member of the Uzumaki clan, as well as a direct descendant of the Hyūga clan. Himawari is the second and youngest child of Naruto and Hinata Uzumaki, born two years after her brother, Boruto. On the day that Naruto was to be inaugurated as the Seventh Hokage, Himawari wanted to bring her panda toy to the ceremony, but Boruto, fearing that he would end up carrying it, tried to take it away from her. When the toy's head

Himuka Suzukaze (涼風ヒムカ, Suzukaze Himuka) was a genin of Konohagakure. After graduating from the Academy, she was added to Team 2 under the leadership of Yūki Minazuki. Her teammates were Yōji Aburame, a fellow graduate, and Itachi Uchiha, who graduated the year before her. Although he was much younger than her, Himuka called Itachi "master" because of how skilled he was. Itachi left the team only a few months after she joined, but Himuka continued to admire him throughout his career. Years later

Hinata Uzumaki (うずまきヒナタ, Uzumaki Hinata, née Hyūga (日向)) is a kunoichi of Konohagakure. Formerly the heiress of the Hyūga clan, she lost the position upon being deemed unsuited for the responsibilities of leading the clan. Nonetheless, Hinata persevered and from her observation of Naruto Uzumaki especially, Hinata found an example to follow. Through her membership with Team 8, she sought to become strong enough to change herself, if even a little at a time. A few years after the Fourth Shinobi W

fields.en_description: She is the wife of Hiashi Hyūga, the head of Konohagakure's Hyūga clan. While not much is known about her, she bore two daughters with Hiashi — Hinata and Hanabi Hyūga. She is a kindly woman, so much so that her eldest daughter, Hinata, aspired to be kind like her, while also strong like her father. She possesses fair skin and long, dark-purple hair slightly past her waist and side bangs framing her face down to her shoulders. She was seen wearing a purple, long-sleeved kimono. Overall, her elde

Himushi (ヒムシ) is a mercenary ninja and the leader of the Nokizaru Group. Himushi and the Nokizaru were hired by the Sugi Village to hunt down the Fourth Raikage and his men after they stole a scroll detailing their employer's hidden techniques. While on their tail, the Nokizaru unleashed a blinding light which dispersed microscopic Exploding Insects which the Kumogakure shinobi inhaled. After killing Nigai with this method, A escaped with his ill subordinate. Tracking them down, Himushi spied on

Hina (ヒナ) is a ninneko that lives with Nekobaa at an Uchiha supply base. Hina has a very calm and almost pleasant disposition most of the time, even after being called talking tanuki by Suigetsu Hōzuki, she seemed unperturbed, unlike her partner Denka, who was seemingly outraged. Hina is predominantly a light-coloured brown with darker markings on her cheeks. Suigetsu, when he first met them, mistook the two for talking tanuki. She wears a simple red kimono with mesh armour underneath, held clos

Hinoe (丙) is a former member of Konohagakure's Anbu faction Root. In the events to follow the Third Great Shinobi War, Hinoe accompanied Danzō Shimura to a meeting with Orochimaru after the latter had been passed over for the position as Hokage. With nine other Root members, Hinoe received a mission to assassinate Hiruzen Sarutobi before he could be reinstated as Hokage. Disguised as a foreign shinobi, he fought the Anbu accompanying his target, who turned out to be a disguised Kakashi. Years la

Hinoki (ヒノキ) is the village head of the valley of Great Evil and the grandfather of Nazuna in Naruto: Path of the Ninja 2. Hinoki is an elderly man with creases under his eyes and prominent cheekbones. He had white hair similar to cat ears, pointy eyebrows that reached to his chin, a long goatee and a short moustache. He wears a black kimono, with a red haori covering his kimono, a comb on his hair and red traditional Japanese geta. Hinoki's name is derived from the cypress tree native to Japan,

fields.en_description: Hinoko (ヒノコ) is a Konohagakure Anbu. She strongly prefers to go by her codename: Soku (鏃, Soku). While she was a student at the Academy, Hinoko invented her own signature technique: the Chakra Needle. Because of this accomplishment, she was scouted by the Anbu and upon graduating from the Academy, was immediately recruited as a member. Hinoko has a tomboyish personality, liking cooler things and how their names sound over the girly ones, like her own name, going as far as preferring her Anbu cod

Hinoto (丁) is a former member of Konohagakure's Anbu faction Root. To prevent Hiruzen from being reinstated as Hokage, Danzō gave Hinoto and nine other Root members a mission to assassinate him. Disguised as a foreign kunoichi, she fought the Anbu accompanying her target, who turned out to be a disguised Kakashi, resulting in the mission's failure. Three years later, Hinoto and Hinoe were guarding the entrance to the Root chambers when the two Anbu members Yūgao Uzuki and Kakashi Hatake appeared

Hippo Boss (カバ組長, Kaba Kumichō) is a giant hippopotamus that resides on the Island Turtle. He is noted to be one of the four fiercest animals to reside there. According to Condor, Hippo Boss is trapped in a four-way lovers spat with King, Chūji and Don over the affections of Armadiko. Whenever the four are together, they immediately start fighting believing themselves to be the most suitable partner for Armadiko. Hippo Boss is a very hard-headed individual who will not back down from a challenge

Hiruko (卑留呼, Hiruko) was the main antagonist of Naruto Shippūden the Movie: The Will of Fire. He was a missing-nin of Konohagakure who wished to plunge the world into a Fourth Shinobi World War, and then conquer it. A contemporary and former friend of the Sannin, Hiruko wished to become a strong shinobi, yet was born with no natural special abilities. To overcome this disadvantage, he developed the Chimera Technique, a kinjutsu which would allow him to obtain the kekkei genkai of other ninja by

fields.en_description: Hiruga (ヒルガ) was a shinobi from the Land of Haze. Hiruga and his brothers were orphans who found a home in the Land of Haze's orphanage. Despite it being a smaller and impoverished country, they enjoyed having decent meals. They would also often spend their time playing under a large peach tree. Like his brothers, Hiruga was an extremely committed man. He would willingly sacrifice himself for his brothers and his mission. At the same time, he was at times torn between his loyalty to his mission

fields.en_description: Hiruko (ヒルコ, Hiruko) was once a great shinobi, but upon his death, he became Sasori's favourite human puppet. He was said to have been a great shinobi while alive. He was powerful enough that Sasori chose to make a human puppet out of him. "Hiruko" (蛭子) can be translated to "leech child". Hiruko is a Japanese fisherman god. It can also be translated into "Ebisu". In the manga, Hiruko was just a normal puppet, not a human one. His height given through a settei, is him when he's on all fours.

fields.en_description: Hisame (ヒサメ) is a missing-nin from Amegakure. Hisame left her village behind to help Suien seek the Hero Water in Takigakure. Hisame is a young, quite tall, and slim kunoichi with fair skin, short light brown unkempt spiky hair, azure blue earrings, red lipstick, pupil-less black eye irises, short thin light brown eyebrows and wears a white hairband over her head, holding the hair out of the way from her eyes. She wore a pink tube top that has a dark red linen along with a open, light blue shirt

Hisen (ヒゼン) was the former leader of Takigakure, who sacrificed his life protecting the village. Hisen led Takigakure well for many years until his death after drinking the hero water, trying to protect his village when it came under attack by foreign powers; the water granted him temporary strength enhancements, but shortened his life that led to a rather premature demise. His position as leader was passed onto his son, Shibuki. From all indications, Hisen was a very loyal person and devoted le

Hitode (ヒトデ) is in charge of protecting the shipments of gold that the Land of the Sea sends to Kirigakure as payment to protect its many islands. Hitode is a balding man with black hair and dark-coloured eyes. His sideburns connect to his moustache, beard, and eyebrows. He has large lips and wears the Land of Seas boat guard uniform. He keeps a sword strapped to his left leg. Hitode carries a sword with him which points to Hitode having some skill in kenjutsu. He's seen guarding the shipments o

Hishaku (ヒシャク) was a young sailor who dreamed of becoming a captain of his own ship one day. During his time as a sailor, he, along with his captain and other ship members were killed by the Giant Corpse Crab. Hishaku was an honourable and devoted person, never resting until he had avenged his fallen crew-mates by killing the Skeleton Crab that wiped them out. His spirit also kept the ship he once served on in good condition while he was waiting to kill the crab. He also thought very highly of h

Hizashi Hyūga (日向ヒザシ, Hyūga Hizashi) was a jōnin of Konohagakure's Hyūga clan. Hizashi was born mere seconds after his twin brother, Hiashi. For this reason only however, Hiashi was made the successor to the Hyūga clan, whereas Hizashi was made a member of a branch house. At some point in Hizashi's life, he was branded with the clan's curse seal that would ensure his lifelong service to the main branch and that would seal his Byakugan when he died. Hizashi was unhappy with this fate but felt tha

fields.en_description: Hiruzen Sarutobi (猿飛ヒルゼン, Sarutobi Hiruzen) was the Third Hokage (三代目火影, Sandaime Hokage, literally meaning: Third Fire Shadow) of Konohagakure. A disciple of the village's two previous Hokage, Hiruzen was a powerful ninja, hailed as a "God of Shinobi". Though he was only ever directly the teacher of the Sannin, generations of Konoha shinobi benefited from his wisdom during his lifetime. Hiruzen was born the son of Sasuke Sarutobi. The Sarutobi clan was one of the first clans to settle in the ne

fields.en_description: Hohozuki (歩々月) was a friend of Ameyuki. Hohozuki was born in the same village as Ameyuki. Unlike all of the other villagers, Hohozuki did not hate Ameyuki and in fact was his only friend. One day slavers attacked their village and kidnapped the women and children - Hohozuki included. Ameyuki rescued them, using his Mud Release to kill the slavers. Rather than thank Ameyuki for his help, the villagers now feared Ameyuki and tried to kill him. When Hohozuki found out about this, he convinced Ameyu

Hokushin (ホクシン) is a shinobi from the Land of Birds and a member of the Watari Ninja. Hokushin has long sky blue hair with his bangs going over the right side of his face down to his chest area. He also has big black-coloured eyes. He wears a white very thin headband covered by his hair. He wears a beige-coloured vest-like shirt that goes down to his knees. He wears a purple-coloured shirt underneath it. He also has a black lower arm sleeve on each lower arm area and a thick black belt around hi

Hoheto Hyūga (日向ホヘト, Hyūga Hoheto) is a shinobi from Konohagakure's Hyūga clan. Hoheto is very calm and composed person who is also very focused during combat. Like all members of the Hyūga clan, he possesses featureless white eyes. He has brown hair which he styles in a top-knot, and wears the standard Konoha-nin uniform, with the Allied Shinobi Forces' forehead protector. He also has very prominent creases under his eyes. As a member of the Hyūga clan, Hoheto possesses the Byakugan, which gran

Homura Mitokado (水戸門ホムラ, Mitokado Homura) is a former member of the dissolved Team Tobirama. He and his team-mate Koharu Utatane now serve as members of the Konoha Council. In the anime, shortly after the foundation of the village, he was shown to be part of a class alongside Koharu Utatane and Torifu Akimichi. fields.en_description: Hokuto (ホクト) is a young kunoichi from Hoshigakure. Hokuto proved to be a caring individual, watching over and protecting Mizura while he was bedridden. She was also an open individual, as she freely spoke of sensitive information with outsiders, such as the "star" of Hoshigakure and Sumaru's parents. He is the daimyō of the Land of Hot Water. He has black eyes and grey hair most prominently shown from his moustache. He wears a long-sleeved shirt under a yellow, sleeveless jacket with red trimmings. He also carried a fan and wears a headdress with the symbol of his village on it. Honoka (ホノカ) was a kunoichi working with the researchers on a remote island. While researchers worked on the Ultimate Summoning Beast, Honoka was assigned to restrain the beast using her sealing techniques. However, at some point in time the beast got too powerful for her technique to restrain and it got loose. The researchers called for her to do something as the beast began to kill them. This man was a shinobi of Takigakure. Following his death, he became the Human Path of the Six Paths of Pain. On the verge of the Second Shinobi World War, he encountered Jiraiya during his journey to find his disciple. After dying years later, his corpse was used by Nagato to channel the power of the Human Path in his Six Paths of Pain. fields.en_description: Hotarubi (ホタルビ) was a jōnin from Hoshigakure. Both he and his wife had completed the star training. They both stole the star after seeing the side effects of the training, but were later caught by the Third Hoshikage and his Anbu. The Hoshikage acknowledged their concerns in regards to the star training and had long considered discontinuing it. However, the more militaristic shinobi of the village were likely to reinstate the star training if ever given the chance. The Hoshikage promised to halt

Hotaru (ホタル) is a kunoichi from the Tsuchigumo Village and a member of the Tsuchigumo clan. She is also the granddaughter of the former leader of the Tsuchigumo clan, En no Gyōja. Hotaru met Utakata after he saved her from a group of ninja who were actually after him. After the battle, Utakata was wounded and collapsed after it and Hotaru ran to her fort to get help to save him. After Utakata was healed, Hotaru asked him to become her teacher, much to his dismay. fields.en_description: Hyō (ヒョウ) is a former member of Konohagakure's Anbu faction Root. Like most Root members, he was still loyal to Root's founder Danzō Shimura and is apparently trustworthy enough to be given the task of delivering top-secret information for him. Hyō wears a white Anbu mask with a red marking near each eye hole. He has dark-coloured hair that he keeps held in a ponytail. He carries a tantō and wears a beige cloak that keeps his body hidden. Although Hyō hasn't displayed any techniques, he is able

Hyōgo (ヒョウゴ) is a Kusagakure missing-nin. Hyōgo was once a famed shinobi from Kusagakure. Eventually, he abandoned his village to start his own crime syndicate. He took great effort to keep his activities hidden from the rest of the world, rarely showing his face in public. Hyōgo is a very composed and indifferent man, rarely getting worked up. He is shown to be cautious, believing in keeping to himself so as to not draw attention. He is very shameless, taking over an entire village by force to

Hyōi Yorishiro (依代ヒヨウイ, Yorishiro Hyōi) is a infamous thief listed in the Bingo Book. He would regularly infiltrate villages and steal their valuables or information to sell to others. As a longstanding thief, Hyōi is immoral by nature. He cares not how his actions can affect others, only on the prize and how he will prosper from it. He is also very arrogant, constantly assuming that he will not be caught and as such gets careless. Hyōi is a below-average man in height with fair skin and a skinn

Hāto (ハート) was a former student of En no Gyōja and the father of Shiranami. He passed on the teachings from his sensei to his son, who was even more skilled than Hāto. Shiranami killed his father during the Third Shinobi World War trying to obtain the Tsuchigumo clan kinjutsu, which Hāto was protecting. Hāto had short spiked up black hair. He wore a grey outfit with a silver sleeveless haori which had grey trimmings and a leaf symbol that showed his worthiness to wield to the clan's kinjutsu, a

This Konohagakure citizen is the former head of the Hyūga clan. It was apparently his idea to have his son Hizashi act as Hiashi's body double after the incident with the Head Ninja of Kumogakure. Even though his elder son struggled with the decision, he told him that at some point in time, each head of the clan has had to protect it in some way or the other and that this was why the branch family existed. In the anime, he and Hiashi watched Hinata and Neji sparring each other during training. H

Hōki (ホウキ, Hōki) is a genin from Takigakure. Hoki has brown curly hair (spiky in the manga) and black eyes. He wears a grey shirt over a blue jacket. He also wears a blue Takigakure forehead protector. Hoki was a genin who took part in the Chūnin Exams. After listening to Naruto's speech, he and all the remaining genin passed the first phase of the Chūnin Exams. "Hōki" has various meanings, for example "abandonment" (放棄), "laws and regulations" (法規), "uprising"/"revolting" (蜂起) or "broom" (箒).

Hōichi (ホウイチ) is a shinobi from Sunagakure. When he was a child, Hōichi studied Bunpuku's fūinjutsu and power to mould currents. Two years after Gaara, the current host of Shukaku, was made Kazekage, he met with Fugi. The two discussed their plan to seal Shukaku. Hōichi is a bald young man with brown eyes and a long, horizontal scar from his left ear across to his face. He wears what appears to be a dark blue monk attire, albeit without sleeves, with a white collar and garb at the end. He also d

Hōki Taketori (竹取ホウキ, Taketori Hōki) is a chūnin of Team 25, that has joined Konohagakure's Anbu. Hōki is a zealous individual who admires Kakashi Hatake greatly, and wishes to follow in his footsteps. While extremely dedicated to his missions, Hōki can be overconfident and irritable when in command. At the same time, he is not without insecurities, showing noticeable stress at failing. He is also shown to be a good sport in competition, not bragging or mocking his defeated opponent upon winning

Hōki (ホウキ, Hōki) was a missing-nin and leader of the Watari Ninja. He masqueraded as Mōsō (孟宗) in the Land of Birds and served as Chief Advisor to the daimyō, Ōwashi. After years of being renegade, Hōki decided to settle down in the Land of Birds. He gained favour by disguising himself as the high priest Mōsō, using genjutsu to show an illusion of swallowing a sword to fake his loyalty and powers. He was granted the position as Chief Advisor, and used this opportunity to secretly poison Ōwashi,

Hōki (宝亀, Hōki) was a shinobi from the Takumi Village and the leader of the Four Celestial Symbols Men. Hōki was very confident in his abilities and he also got easily annoyed. Hōki had a slim face with a prominent jawline with a visible black line around the lower area of his eyes and brown hair that was swept to the back. He wore a light beige-coloured forehead protector with the Takumi Village insignia printed on, he also sported a purple jacket of sorts along with the rest of the Four Celest

Hōsei (ホウセイ) is a genin of Konohagakure. Hōsei seemed to be afraid of challenges as seen when he chose to drop out of the Chūnin Exams knowing full well that him doing so would also cause his teammates to be disqualified as well. He has short, spiky, black hair and wears a simple black attire with mesh armour underneath. Along with this he wears his blue forehead protector in the traditional manner but with an extra strap going under his jaw. Hōsei enters the Chūnin Exams, but, afraid of never a

Hōshō (ホウショウ) is a medical-nin from Konohagakure. He was noted to be a kind-hearted person who desires nothing more than peace for Konohagakure. He wears the standard high collared, full body uniform of the Konoha medical ninja. He also has black hair and big black eyes. As a medical-nin, Hōshō presumably has a high level of intellect, is well-versed in medical ninjutsu, and has excellent chakra control to perform medical procedures. Hōshō was assigned to one of the two medical units that was de

This dog is the personal summon of the prison master of Hōzuki Castle. The guard dog is very obedient to whomever is official sanctioned as the prison master. It is a massive dog with brown fur and yellow eyes, it has two independently acting heads. Belying its massive size, it is very fast and agile. It is also able to produce powerful flames from its mouths. It is also very strong and resilient, able to plough through rock and endure most enemy attacks. As with most dogs, it has a powerful sen

Ibushi (イブシ) was the main antagonist who appeared on Naruto: Uzumaki Chronicles 2. He was part of the Shirogane Clan, a clan that uses puppets called the Puppet Walkers. His prime goal, along with the Shirogane clan, was to resurrect the clan's ultimate weapon, the Master Puppet, a living and sentient weapon with the power to destroy the Five Great Shinobi Countries. However, the Shirogane clan sealed away the Master Puppet, due to his self-awareness in the Spirit Orbs, which they hid in each Fi

Ichi (壱) was an antagonist that appeared in Naruto Shippūden the Movie: The Will of Fire. He was a shinobi and one of Hiruko's three followers, along with Ni and San. Ichi was very overconfident in his abilities. He would talk down to and mock his opponents during battle. Like his comrades, he would not hesitate in using the Chimera Technique to merge with others, even if it meant distorting his own body. Ichi had light-coloured eyes and brown hair. He was a tall, gaunt man that greatly resemble

Ibuse (イブセ) was a venomous salamander and Hanzō's signature summon. He was large enough for his summoner to stand on top of his head and when battling alongside Ibuse, Hanzō was powerful enough to fight, and eventually, overpower all three of the Sannin. Ibuse is a giant brown salamander with a lighter colored underside, and seemingly no eyes. Ibuse took part in Hanzō's fight with Jiraiya, Orochimaru and Tsunade. He has also fought against Chiyo numerous times, alongside Hanzō. Ibuse was a power

Ibiki Morino (森乃イビキ, Morino Ibiki) is a tokubetsu jōnin of Konohagakure and the commanding officer of the Konoha Torture and Interrogation Force. In the anime, he was also later made team leader of Team 40. In his youth during the Chūnin Exams, Ibiki, and his teammates Hayate Gekkō and Tokara confronted Team Orochimaru in the Forest of Death during the second round of the examination. Several years later, Ibiki led a squad that was trying to retrieve secret codes held by the Cypher Division of K

fields.en_description: Ibara (イバラ) is a citizen of Konohagakure and the mother of one of the students in Naruto Uzumaki's class at the Academy. She, like other people in the village, greatly disliked Naruto, seeing him only as the Nine-Tails itself. This is later displayed when she was glad that Naruto did not graduate along with the rest of his class. Ibara has long smooth dark brown hair and brown-coloured eyes. She wears a dark pinkish-coloured headband around her head and a light green shirt under an opened black

Ichigen (一見) was a young monk-in-training at the Fire Temple. He deeply admired Chiriku and aspired to be like him. Ichigen sported a bald head and he also wore the typical ninja monk uniform. He has small black eyes. His young age and unfinished training meant that his skills were still immature. Main article: Akatsuki Suppression Mission Ichigen warned Chiriku of the intruding Akatsuki members Kakuzu and Hidan. He is presumed to be dead since he isn't identified as one of the three known monk

Ichirōta Oniyuzu (鬼柚子一朗太, Oniyuzu Ichirōta) is a shinobi from Kirigakure. Like his allies, Ichirōta has a great hatred for the peaceful era of the Sixth Mizukage, viewing it as an insult to their heritage as they calmly allow tourists to visit the village. Joining Shizuma Hoshigaki, he sought to restore the "Bloody Mist" era and usurp Chōjūrō. However, unlike most of his allies, he doesn't let his anger distract him, due to preferring a no-nonsense attitude of quickly getting the job done rather

Idate Morino (森乃イダテ, Morino Idate) is a former genin from Konohagakure who later fled his village, becoming a citizen of the Land of Tea and eventually adopted into the Wasabi family. He is also the younger brother of Ibiki Morino. Idate took the Chūnin Exams, up until the "tenth question". Like any exam ran by his older brother Ibiki, those who chose to abandon the exam before the question would have their team disqualified, but can retake it in six months. Idate chose to stay along with his sq

Ichikishimahime (イチキシマヒメ) is an inhabitant of the Ryūchi Cave. Ichikishimahime appears to be more playful than her comrades, floating carefree in the air and spinning around while talking to Boruto about wanting to play with him. Like the other snakes, she has a more malevolent side and, as per her own admission, prefers to eat chakra that is weak and on the verge of disappearing. She claims herself to be honest. As her test forces the participant to use their mind in a direct manner, (compared

Iggy (イギー, Igī) is a citizen of the Land of Water. During his childhood, Iggy made one friend with a boy named Banna because the latter was being picked on due to his appearance. Iggy seemed to be a mean, self-centred and somewhat cruel individual readily attack his friend when he got caught by the Konoha shinobi. He is also somewhat of a coward, having to wrestle greatly with the decision to save his best friend after he was captured even though he bragged to others that he was a great shinobi.

Ikada Funato (舟戸イカダ, Funato Ikada) is a boy from the Land of Water that was born into the Funato clan, and an apprentice to the shipwright Kajiki. Ikada was born in the northern seas of the Land of Water, the youngest son of Funato clan head, Araumi. During a battle against Kirigakure, his mother Minamo was struck down and frozen in ice while protecting him. He was a newborn at the time, and as such has no memories of her. From a young age, he was often mocked by his older brothers for not havin

Ikkaku Umino (うみのイッカク, Umino Ikkaku) was a shinobi from Konohagakure. When Kohari was injured while protecting him during the Nine-Tailed Demon Fox's Attack, he offered to look after her. Ikkaku said he would look after her since it was the parent's job to protect their child, not the other way around. He instructed Iruka to flee. Iruka did not listen, forcing other Konoha ninja to drag him away from the battle. His parents were killed by the Nine-Tails. Their names had been added to Konoha's Me

Ikkyū Madoka (まどかイッキュウ, Madoka Ikkyū) is the current daimyō of the Land of Fire. Ikkyū is a very business oriented man. His focus on work tends to make him ignore his son, Tentō leaving him in the care of servants and keeping him occupied through lavished gifts. However, he still loves his son and cares for his well-being, as he was furious at learning of Tentō's kidnapping and deeply worried for his well-being. While he loves his son and was willing to pay the money ransom, he was conflicted wi

Ikanago (イカナゴ) is a senior of Sunagakure. Ikanago is very interested in the Kazekage's lineage, fearfully thinking that if Kankurō and Gaara were not to have any children, then Shikadai Nara would become the only remaining member of the bloodline and "worse", lost to Konohagakure. During a meeting with Gaara, Ikanago was present and, alongside other seniors, attempted to convince the Kazekage in accepting an arranged marriage meeting to continue his prominent bloodline for the village.

Inabi Uchiha (うちはイナビ, Uchiha Inabi) was an officer of the Konoha Military Police Force and a member of the Uchiha clan. Alongside Yashiro and Tekka Uchiha, Inabi questioned Itachi Uchiha about his whereabouts during the time when Shisui Uchiha supposedly committed suicide. He told Itachi that they had all intention of duly investigating the matter and when they presented Shisui's alleged suicide note, he stated that for someone who wielded the Sharingan it would be no problem to forge such a not

Inaho (イナホ) is a genin from Konohagakure. Inaho, like her teammates, is overconfident in her and her team's abilities to the point where she thought Team Ajisai fled because they were too powerful which wasn't the case. Inaho's short brown hair frames her face, falling over her blue-clothed forehead protector which is worn normally. She wears a green top, brown knee-length skirt along with a beige sash and a poncho top. At the second Chūnin exams two years later, her hair has grown longer and wa

Indra Ōtsutsuki‎ (大筒木インドラ, ‎Ōtsutsuki Indora) was the first born son of Hagoromo Ōtsutsuki. He was initially thought to be the most suitable successor of his father's teachings, however, it was his younger brother Asura that ended up inheriting this mantle — a decision that would lead the two brothers to fight against each other. Indra is also credited with being the creator of ninjutsu, and the progenitor of the Uchiha clan. In the anime, despite the loss of his mother following problems with h

Ino Yamanaka (山中いの, Yamanaka Ino) is a kunoichi of Konohagakure's Yamanaka clan. She and her fellow members of Team Asuma are their generation's Ino–Shika–Chō trio. Ino is an only child and was a popular student during her time in the Academy. There, she met Sakura Haruno, who was teased by other kids for her large forehead. Ino defended Sakura from the bullies and encouraged her to embrace her forehead rather than hide it, becoming good friends with her. Over the following years, Ino's guidance

fields.en_description: This woman is a citizen of Konohagakure's Yamanaka clan. She possesses a calm and collected demeanour. She also appears to be very regal and has a classy appearance, and a similar style of vocabulary to compliment it. Despite this, she is a fierce fighter and as part of the Allied Mothers Force, will not hesitate to protect the children and village against potential enemies. She has light brown eyes without pupils and brown hair which is tied into a bun with a red ribbon in it. Strands frame bot

Inoichi Yamanaka (山中いのいち, Yamanaka Inoichi) was the head of Konohagakure's Yamanaka clan, and along with Shikaku Nara and Chōza Akimichi, he was a part of the 15th generation Ino–Shika–Chō trio. He was also the head of the Analysis Team in the village's Intelligence Division. When he became a genin, he was partnered with Shikaku and Chōza. In the anime, nearing the end of the Third Shinobi World War, his team was assigned to deliver a request for a peace treaty between the Konoha and Iwagakure.

One time, Inari's dog, Pochi, was stolen by the bully Akane. As he lost interest in Pochi, Akane threw him into the sea. When Inari hesitated to go in and save him, Akane pushed him in as well. Together with his teammates Chōchō Akimichi and Shikadai Nara, he forms the seventeenth generation of the Ino–Shika–Chō trio. Inojin is the only child of Ino and Sai Yamanaka. As his parents continued to stay close to their childhood friends over the years, Inojin ultimately came to know the various parents' respective kids well. From a young age, Inojin would often have sleepovers with Chōchō and

fields.en_description: Inori (イノリ) was a follower of Boro's cult. Inori had developed an illness to which she could not find or even afford treatment for. At some point, Boro manipulated her into joining his cult, with the promise of the Ōtsutsuki Clan saving her from her misfortune by casting the Infinite Tsukuyomi. Inori had blue long hair and violet eyes. She wore a white robe of Boro's cult. Main article: Kawaki Arc When a small village was plagued by Boro, Inori and his other followers approached the villagers wi

He was a shinobi from an unknown village and the older brother of Inori. He cared very much for his sister, being able to locate her when she disappeared to Boro's Cult. He did not believe Boro's tales of the Infinite Tsukuyomi's grace, attempting to convince his sister of its fallacies. He showed some degree of despair when he could not kill Boro, but immediately expressed courage, choosing to die rather than join the cult. He was a young man of medium height with short purple hair that sticks

Iroha (イロハ, Iroha) is a genin from Konohagakure that appeared in Tsunade's Infinite Tsukuyomi dream. Iroha has short brown hair that is smooth on the left side but spiky on the right. He also has large black eyes and short eyebrows. He is sent on a mission with his team and is later the only person to return to Konoha. On his return, he is spotted by the Konoha gate guards and collapsed. He is later questioned by Minato in the Konoha Hospital. All he's able to remember about his encounter with t

Inomatsu (イノマツ) is a genin from Konohagakure. Inomatsu once studied under the guidance of Asuma Sarutobi. Like the members of Team Asuma, he was deeply saddened by his former teacher's death. Inomatsu has long black hair and black eyes. During Asuma's funeral, he wore the typical Konoha funeral clothing. He also has small black markings underneath his eyes. Inomatsu was present at Asuma's funeral, mourning his loss.

Iori (衣織) was a villager of Green Banks. Upon the Pale Blue Valley offering to buy the deed to Green Banks' bridge, Iori hired Hidari and Ashimaru under the belief they were shinobi that could be trusted. Acquiring poison from them, he poisoned the Green Banks' village head, Tofu, resulting in his death. Iori was a very dishonest and selfish man. Disloyal to all but himself, he looked for the quickest way to make money. Seeing the Green Banks' bridge as his chance for a fortune, he had no qualms

Iruka Umino (うみのイルカ, Umino Iruka) is a chūnin of Konohagakure, who served primarily as an instructor at the Academy until being promoted to Headmaster years later. Iruka's parents were killed in the Nine-Tailed Demon Fox's Attack twelve years before the beginning of the series. Initially, a young Iruka was present on the battlefield, and wanted to stay in order to protect his mother. His father declared that it was the parents' duty to keep their child safe from harm. fields.en_description: Isago (イサゴ) is a jōnin of Sunagakure. Isago has an angular face with a strong jawline and troughs under his eyes. He wears the standard attire of a Suna ninja inclusive of a ghutrah, flak jacket and forehead protector. Isago is most likely a very skilled shinobi since he is the right-hand man to Baki, who plays an important role in Sunagakure's advisory council. During Gaara's abduction he was seen alongside Baki who was issuing him orders to deploy a pursuit unit to go after Kankurō. After form

Iroha Hyūga (日向イロハ, Hyūga Iroha) is a jōnin of Konohagakure's Hyūga clan. During the Fourth Shinobi World War, he was assigned to the Kumo Barrier Team. Iroha has been noted to be an overly serious individual, and as such, he is not good at dealing with abnormal situations. Iroha has long brown hair over which wears a bandanna-style forehead protector. Two strands of his hair hang down on either side, framing his face. Customary of all Hyūga he has the featureless white eyes of the Byakugan. He
Isago (イサゴ, Isago) is an inhabitant of the Land of Wind and the daughter of Gojō.

Isari Funato (舟戸イサリ, Funato Isari) was a pirate from the Land of Water. After his father returned from another raid, Araumi also brought with him a young boy named Tenma who Asaumi decided to adopt. Isari happily welcomed him to the family. From a young age, they would train arduously together under their father's watch. Isaribi (漁火) is a citizen of the Land of the Sea. She was a human test subject under the control of Amachi, who in turn used to work for Orochimaru. Isaribi was part of a test that was meant to give shinobi the ability to breathe and operate underwater. Isaribi was one of the first test subjects, and was not the final version. Ise (伊勢) was a doctor and a citizen of Amegakure, where he lived in a small village with his son and wife. During the Second Shinobi World War, Ise and his wife Fusō were providing humanitarian aid. One night during the war, Ise and his family were hiding in their battle-damaged house when Konoha ninja broke in looking for food. Ise and his family tried to sneak away but when they were detected. He used a unique gauntlet to assassinate Kakeru, leaving the elderly king with fatal wounds that eventually led to his

Ishikawa (イシカワ) was the First Tsuchikage (初代土影, Shodai Tsuchikage, literally meaning: First or Founding Earth Shadow) who founded Iwagakure in the Land of Earth. In the anime, he was stated to be a member of the Kamizuru Clan. At the first meeting of the five Kage, Ishikawa, accompanied by Mū, sat alongside the others, where he noted that he had come in good faith to endorse the meeting of the five Kage, but noted that he would not sign so easily to agreement. Isobu and the tailed beasts first came into being in the waning days of Hagoromo Ōtsutsuki, who used his Creation of All Things Technique to divide the Ten-Tails' chakra into nine separate bodies and giving each a name. Itama Senju (千手板間, Senju Itama) was a young shinobi from the Senju clan. Upon hearing the news of his brother Kawarama's death, a tearful Itama assembled alongside his father, and his remaining siblings Tobirama and Hashirama as the fallen were buried. After his father scolded him for crying — as shinobi were not to show emotions — Itama looked on horrified by the altercation between his father and his eldest brother. He afterwards joined the international criminal organisation known as Akatsuki, whose activity brought him into frequent conflict with Konoha and its ninja — including Sasuke who sought to avenge their clan by killing Itachi.
