fields.en_description: Isono (イソノ) is a man who took part in the eating contest organised in the Land of This. Isono appears as one of the Chōji's opponents during the eating contest in the Land of This. Isono manages to pass the first two rounds of the contest. Later, he goes to the final round, in a duel with Chōji and Tamao. The duel consisted in eating barbecue. Seeing the speed of his rivals, Isono used his special technique, Lethal Juggler, allowing him to cook food with one hand and eat the food with the other.

This crow had Shisui Uchiha's left eye implanted into it. Shisui wanted to use his Mangekyō Sharingan's Kotoamatsukami to stop the Uchiha clan from carrying out their planned coup d'état against Konohagakure. Before he could do so, his right Mangekyō was taken by Danzō Shimura. Fearful that Danzō would also take his left eye and use it for ill purposes, Shisui removed his remaining eye and entrusted it to his best friend, Itachi Uchiha, asking that Itachi use it to protect Konoha. The eye was im

Ittan (イッタン) is an Iwagakure shinobi. Ittan is a calm and collected individual even when under enemy attack. He takes conflict seriously, reminding his teammate Zaji not to get overly confident because they were at war. Ittan has light-coloured, spiky hair and a dark-coloured beard (both of which are depicted as brown in the anime). He wears the standard Iwagakure shinobi outfit complete with his right sleeve missing as well as the forehead protector of the Allied Shinobi Forces. As a chūnin, It

Ittetsu (イッテツ) is a genin from Sunagakure. Ittetsu admires Gaara more than he does anyone else, he is very brave as seen when he joined Sunagakure's Kazekage rescue squad. He also seems to be quick to be moved to tears as seen when he heard that Gaara was okay. He has short brown hair over which he wears his forehead protector in a bandanna style. He wears a brown flak jacket over a short-sleeved, blue shirt along with a pair of dark pants, with his shuriken holster strapped to his right thigh.

A jōnin-level Iwagakure kunoichi that led a battalion of Iwagakure ninja to attack Konohagakure's border after its invasion by Sunagakure and Otogakure. She is shown to be very ruthless as she willingly sacrificed many Iwagakure genin during her fight with Kosuke Maruboshi, considering it their duty to obey even if it meant death. She also has a bloodthirsty side, licking her lips at the thought of cutting her opponents into pieces. She has long brown-coloured hair which she ties in such a fashi

The Doctor (ドクター, Dokutā) was an Outer of Kara who worked for Victor's company in the Land of Valleys. Wanting to elevate his position, he secretly worked with the retired Third Tsuchikage Ōnoki to create the Fabrications and Akuta. As an Outer of the secret organisation, Kara, the doctor worked under Victor in an unauthorised project to recreate the God Tree from a splinter recovered during the Fourth Shinobi World War. Wanting to elevate his own social status, the doctor proceeded with his own

Iwabee Yuino (結乃イワベエ, Yuino Iwabee) is a Konohagakure genin. While a standout during his entire time enrolled in the Academy, his poor academic test grades lead him to be held back repeatedly. He is a member of Team 5 along with Metal Lee and Denki Kaminarimon. Iwabee had a grandfather who was killed by Yagura Karatachi. On the day of the Seventh Hokage's inauguration, Iwabee watched the event beside other villagers. Dreaming of becoming a mighty and famous ninja, Iwabee soon enrolled in the Aca

Iwaji (岩次) is a shinobi from Iwagakure and along with his siblings made up the Three Brothers group. Iwaji seems to be a relentless and cruel person. He also seems to be easily irritated and quick to action as seen when his brother had to stop him from rushing after Kosuke Maruboshi. He is, unlike his two brothers, both tall and slender, with pronounced cheekbones, a prominent chin, and a narrow face. He does however have the same shaven head and wears bandages around his arms like his siblings.

Iwana (ヤマメ, Iwana) is a citizen of the Land of Water. During his childhood, Iwana was close friends with Yamame. When Kagura Karatachi had moved to their village, Iwana had noticed he isolated himself from the other children, so he and Yamame approached the boy and befriended him. He is a kind, friendly and positive guy. Iwana treats shinobi with respect and, realising that they are the hope for saving the village, refuses his food in their favour. He also keeps the memory of the deceased Kagura

Iwakyō (岩狂) is a shinobi from Iwagakure and the eldest brother of the village's Three Brothers group. Iwakyō is seemingly cruel and relentless, like his brothers. He is a large man, with a bald head and dark eyes. He wears the standard Iwa-nin flak jacket, with his forehead protector around his neck, and the standard pants with a lapel. Like Iwazo, he wears bandages around his arms and black, spiked wristbands. He seemingly possessed a great deal of brute strength, as he was able to rupture a la

Iwana Akame (赤目イワナ, Akame Iwana) is a chūnin of Konohagakure. In the past, Iwana participated in a foreign espionage mission, where he was attacked and lost his left eye. In the anime, he and Bekkō were seen alongside Daikoku Funeno at the Academy, watching Itachi Uchiha get attacked by bullies. Iwana loathes Naruto Uzumaki and thinks that he should be captured and punished for stealing the Scroll of Seals. In the anime, he showed himself as a teacher who worried about the students, who immediat

Iwana (イワナ, Iwana) was a shinobi assisting Orochimaru that appeared in Naruto: The Cross Roads. Like most petty villains Iwana thought that he was very powerful when in actuality he wasn't. He was very loyal to Orochimaru. Iwana also had a perverted side, getting a nosebleed from watching Naruto's Harem Technique, and he was also short-tempered, as he vowed to kill Naruto for it. He wore a green-coloured shark-like top complete with a hood which resembled a shark's head, with an appendage on the

Iwashi Tatami (たたみイワシ, Tatami Iwashi) is a chūnin from Konohagakure. Though much of his personality has not been seen first-hand, Iwashi is described as being very methodical in nature in the databooks. He is also haughty in private but has a more reserved demeanour in public. He has dark eyes, brown hair and a small goatee. When first introduced, he wore a simple button up grey uniform like the one worn by the shinobi in the Konohagakure Intelligence Division. When seen after that, however, he

He is characterised as being the more responsible, mature and serious of the two. This is seen when he angrily burst into the Jōnin Standby Station's lounge to drag his partner back to work. Similarly, in another omake, he admonished Kotetsu's lack of pride in his work when the latter complained that they were simply the Fifth Hokage's errand-boys, before

fields.en_description: Iwazō (岩造) is a shinobi from Iwagakure and along with his siblings, made up the Three Brothers group. From all indications, Iwazō seems to be very aggressive, brutish and unwilling to let his target or targets escape him. He bears great resemblance to his eldest brother, in that they are both very muscular, albeit Iwazō is a lot more stocky, and they both have shaved head and wear spiked, black, wristbands. He has dark marking around his eyes and wears the standard Iwagakure flack jacket, withou

Izuna Uchiha (うちはイズナ, Uchiha Izuna) was a shinobi of the Uchiha clan. He, along with his brother Madara, were renowned as the clan's two strongest members in their lifetime. Before the era of ninja villages, Izuna was one of the five sons born to Tajima Uchiha. However, three of his brothers died at the hands of the Senju, leaving the second eldest Izuna and his oldest brother Madara. Alongside Madara, Izuna was considered one of the most gifted members of the Uchiha. Izuna often competed with h

Izumi Uchiha (うちはイズミ, Uchiha Izumi) was a kunoichi of Konohagakure's Uchiha Clan. Izumi was the daughter of Hazuki Uchiha. Unlike her mother, Izumi's father was not an Uchiha, and for that reason their family lived separately from the Uchiha clan for the first few years of Izumi's life. During the Nine-Tailed Demon Fox's Attack, her father died while protecting her. From the grief brought on by his death, as well as feelings of guilt that he would not have died had Izumi been stronger, Izumi eve

Iō (イオウ) is a ninja weapon inventor from Konoha. He and his assistant, Shōseki, help make weapons for the village. Most of his original weapons are shown to either be impossible to carry or serve no purpose at all. It is assumed he was relocated to the outskirts of the village due to the random explosions he creates, which he claims are "challenges" during his inventing. Iō has a very eccentric personality and has a great love for creating weapons without thinking of the consequences, even creat

Iyashi (イヤシ) is a medical-nin from Konohagakure's Medic Corps. He wears the standard high collared, full body uniform of the Konoha medical ninja. His uniform has also the Konoha Medic Corps-sign on the left side of his chest. As a medical-nin, Iyashi presumably has a high level of intellect, is well-versed in medical ninjutsu, and has excellent chakra control to perform medical procedures. In the anime, he is able to perform the Mystical Palm Technique. Following Sasuke Uchiha's match in the pr

Iō (イオウ, Iō) was the village head of the Bamboo Village. Iō lived in Bamboo Village with his wife and daughter. Despite the village's remoteness, they were able to make a meagre living by selling goods made out of the native bamboo in the nearby towns. For a period of time, they even enjoyed the generous donations of the Lightning Group, who they accordingly celebrated as heroes. But the Lightning Group's deeds eventually brought them into conflict with Kirigakure, and the few who survived sough

Iō (イオウ, Iō) is a medical-nin from Konohagakure. Iō is a calm individual, often seen with a composed look, even when he is facing strong opponents. Iō has black eyes and brown hair covered by his forehead protector which he wears in a bandanna-style. He wears the standard attire of the Konoha-nin complete with flak jacket. fields.en_description: Jaggy (ギザ, Giza) was a stray wolf that was found and taken care of by Himawari Uzumaki. While deemed as a dangerous creature, Jaggy was friendly with those who treated him with care and respect, such as Himawari, sniffing her hand after she fed him, and laying comfortably in front of her while she caressed his fur. While initially hostile towards Kawaki, snarling at him during their first meeting, Jaggy also grew to become comfortable around him. Originally part of a pack of wolves, Jaggy realis

Jako (ジャコ) is a leader of a gang of thieves. Jako was a self-admitting "rotten person". He is a very cruel man, as he told Sakura Haruno that he would kill her, along with Naruto and Sasuke, as soon as he got his treasure back. Jako has black eyes, brown, spiky hair which he ties into a short ponytail, and a small goatee. He wears a blue coat with yellow lining over a white top and dark-coloured pants underneath. He also wears a light blue scarf around his neck. Jako's main ability is that he ca

Jakō Ryūdōin (龍堂院邪光, Ryūdōin Jakō) is one of the Three Ryūdōin Brothers, alongside Rokkaku and Genshō, who were seeking revenge against Might Guy for their father's humiliation and death. Jakō has small black eyes with a dark outline. He wears a purple cloth that covers his entire body and carries a giant scroll that he uses to activate his technique. J (ジェイ, Jei, Viz: Jay) is a shinobi of Kumogakure. J seems to be a very brave man, or at least very loyal, as seen when he willingly trailed Sasuke Uchiha and his team by himself. J is a dark-skinned, bald man with a flak jacket with one strap over one shoulder, and a black shirt underneath. He also wears a pair of black sports sunglasses and a forehead protector with a white cloth. Janmāru-Tataru (ジャンマール＝タタル) was a contemporary of the Sage of Six Paths. He was the founder of the Astronomy Research Institute. Tataru established the Astronomy Research Institute high in the mountains, just beyond the northern border of the Land of Redaku. One day he met the Sage of Six Paths, who was searching Redaku for a way to cure damage to his chakra pathway system caused by his time as a jinchūriki. Tataru took the Sage in and, despite having no medical training, offered to help him. On

Jigen (ジゲン) was a novice monk that became the vessel of Isshiki Ōtsutsuki and eventually had his body completely taken over by Isshiki invading it, acting as an Inner of Kara and its surrogate leader. Around the time that Kaguya Ōtsutsuki and Isshiki Ōtsutsuki arrived on Earth, Jigen was a novice monk and after Kaguya left him for dead, Isshiki assaulted Jigen, during which he shrunk himself and entered the monk's ear in order to survive. Through having his nutrients absorbed from within his bod

Jibachi (ジバチ) was a shinobi from the Kamizuru Clan and the youngest grandson of the First Tsuchikage, the founder of Iwagakure. The Kamizuru clan fell from grace due to conflict with the Aburame Clan of Konohagakure in the past. Like the Aburame clan, the Kamizuru focused on the utilisation of bugs in their techniques. They sought the legendary bikōchū in the hopes it would help in the revitalisation of their clan. Jibachi's grandfather, the First Tsuchikage, then hid away his forbidden secrets

fields.en_description: Jiga (ジガ) was the second oldest brother from the Janin trio. From an early, unspecified age, Jiga had ingested iron. In doing so, he became capable of magnetising his body, as well as other objects. Some years later, Jiga, along with his brothers, established a coup d'etat, which resulted in the death of the Land of Vegetables' daimyō. After their rise to power, the three brothers betrayed their allies, which included greedy and disloyal courtiers they had recruited, and slaughtered them all. Th

Jigumo (ジグモ) was one of the members of the Fūma clan who were deceived by Orochimaru. After the Fūma clan finished a war with a neighbouring country, they wandered the Land of Rice Fields hoping to settle down. Near the end of their journey, Orochimaru and Kimimaro appeared before the Fūma and told them that if they joined Otogakure that Orochimaru would help in restoring their power. Jigumo, along with Kamikiri, Kotohime, and Kagerō, were enchanted by this idea and, under Arashi, decided to go

Jibiki (ジビキ) is a pirate from the Funato clan. Jibiki dislikes quiet waters, preferring a rough, violent sea over a quiet, peaceful one. He is very committed by nature, pushing himself well into exhaustion to complete his mission. He believed that any attempts to negotiate with the enemies would be futile, and reported to Araumi in hopes of persuading Isari to stop his secret plan to barter with the Mizukage. Nevertheless, Jibiki is loyal to Isari enough to accompany him on the negotiations, and

Jantō (ジャントウ) is a gambler from the Tanzaku Quarters. Jantō is an experienced and calculating gambler who likes games with good odds. Jantō has short spiky light brown hair and black-coloured eyes. He also wears a pair of glasses. He wears a black kimono with white rimmings. He is behind the times, as he had never heard of Tsunade's notoriously bad luck when Jiraiya and Naruto come to ask him about her. Jantō appears in Naruto Mobile as a constant rival for the player in the Tanzaku location. He

Jiji (ジジ) is imprisoned at the Astronomy Research Institute. Jiji was originally a ninja of Sunagakure. A few years prior to the events of Sasuke Retsuden, the Prime Minister of the Land of Redaku visited the village while he was touring the region. While there, he hired Jiji to come to Redaku and train an army of ninja, as Redaku was historically a peaceful country with no combat experience. Jiji travelled to Redaku's capital city and was given a room in the royal palace; one of the palace maid

Jimei (ジメイ) is a genin of Konohagakure. Jimei has a short crop of spiky brown hair and a long-sleeved light-coloured shirt with a black collar. He also wears his blue Konohagakure forehead protector like Sakura does. During the written test of the Chūnin Exams, he is caught cheating five times, causing him and his team to fail the test. "Jimei" (自明) can mean "obvious" or "self-evident". This could be a hint towards the fact that it was obvious to the Konoha chūnin that he was cheating.

Jin (ジーン) is a thief. He is a rather violent yet cowardly person who immediately gave up when they were surrounded by stronger opponents. Like his leader, Jin is greedy and eager to find the Gekkōran flower due to its high black market value. Jin is a man of average height with medium length blond hair and black eyes. He wears a blue shirt, pants and sandals, and a white cloth draped over his shoulders. Jin and his comrades use traps that have knives in them, with which they even managed to inju

Jingo Kumano (熊野ジンゴ, Kumano Jingo) is a former missing-nin from Kumogakure. After being pardoned by his village, he set out to start a ramen restaurant in Konohagakure. Jingo abandoned his village over having no talent as a shinobi, becoming a missing-nin. Eventually, the village pardoned him, but he was still jobless and without money. Jin Kaminari (かみなりジン, Kaminari Jin) is a genin of Konohagakure. He seems to enjoy watching battles. Jin is a light-skinned, medium-sized boy with grey eyes and spiky dark hair, one strand of which hangs over his forehead on the right. He wears a dark tank top and a blue bandanna around his forehead. Main article: Ao Arc At the Training Hall, Jin watched Boruto Uzumaki fight the Seventh Hokage alongside other genin. Jin's full name roughly translates to "thunder blade". Jin is a fanmade original

At some point, Jinin joined the Seven Ninja Swordsmen of the Mist, where he came in possession of the Kabutowari. Famed as a hermit and pervert of stupendous ninja skill, Jiraiya travelled the world in search of knowledge that would help his friends, the various novels he wrote, and, posthumously, the world in its entirety – knowledge that would be passed on to his godson and final student, Naruto Uzumaki. After he graduated from Konoha's Ninja Academy, Jiraiya was teamed with Orochimaru and Tsunade under the leadership of Hiruzen Sarutobi. Hiruzen gave them a

Put in a team with his brothers led by Kakashi, Jirō failed in his new teacher's bell test and then he was restrained for the punishment. His brothers are assured by him to eat the lunches their teacher left out. Having exactly followed his orders, Kakashi fails Jirō and his brothers. Jiryū Sendō (仙道ジリュウ, Sendō Jiryū) is the leader of the Sendō clan. Jiryū formed the Sendō clan after the Howling Wolf Village declared its neutrality from all conflicts. He gathered together many of the village's former shinobi - left unemployed by the neutrality - and created a criminal gang that primarily dealt in saigenzai, a popular hallucinogen. Jirōchō Wasabi (ワサビ次郎長, Wasabi Jirōchō) is the head of the Wasabi family in the Land of Tea, which is a clan warring with the nearby Wagarashi family. On a winter day, Jirōchō was confronted by Idate Morino and the young latter attacked him. However, he defended himself only with his umbrella. Upon meeting Idate, Jirōchō realised the young boy was just a starving thief, who tried to steal money from the latter. The boy tried to attack Jirōchō again, only to be restrained by him. As he released I

JJ (ジェイ・ジェイ, Jei Jei) is a citizen of Konohagakure. JJ is a boy with a sleek pompadour and blue eyes. He wears a blue jacket with a white undershirt. JJ is adept in taijutsu, being able to fight on an equal footing with Iwabee. Main article: Academy Entrance Arc On the day of the entrance ceremony, as everyone began looking for an absent Boruto Uzumaki, he suddenly appeared, crashing a train into the Hokage Monument, which left JJ amazed at his antics. Later, his class was assigned from Shino to

Jirōbō (次郎坊) was a shinobi of Otogakure and a member of the Sound Four. In the anime, the Sound Four were originally prisoners of Orochimaru, forced to fight other prisoners to the death in battle royales. By surviving their respective matches, they proved themselves to be the strongest of Orochimaru's prisoners and as such were made his bodyguards. Junsai was a shinobi of Kirigakure. Ten years prior to the formation of the Allied Shinobi Forces, Junsai was part of Ganryū's team that was tasked with retrieving a scroll along with a team from Iwagakure taken by Kumogakure shinobi. After retrieving the document, Iwagakure betrayed Ganryū's team and killed Junsai and Suiren. Jujumaru (ジュジュマル) is a shinobi from the Land of Calm Seas. Over time, Jujumaru and his brother became elite assassins for the Land of Calm Seas' daimyō. Jujumaru is merciless and confident in battle. Unlike his brother, however, he is more responsible and not interested in wasting time. Jujumaru is a tall man of fair complexion with brown eyes and purple hair. He had shown to be quite arrogant and sure of himself, as seen when he told Team 7 not to underestimate the Jōmae-nin right before he supposedly killed himself in an explosion. This act also showed that he was a very convicted and loyal ninja to his home village, not willing to let any information regarding his own village come into the hands of Konoha. He was also shown to be serious and kept his priorities in check during combat fleeing under confrontati

Jūgo (重吾) is a shinobi from an unnamed clan, who was being held at Orochimaru's Northern Hideout. He was said to have gone to Orochimaru of his own free will, hoping that Orochimaru would cure him of his rages. He was later recruited as a member of Sasuke Uchiha's group Taka, which was initially called "Hebi" at the time of its creation. An outcast, Jūgo's rage made him a danger to anyone around him, as they stood little chance of survival should he lose his temper. At one point, he became so an

Jōseki (ジョウセキ) is a Senior from Sunagakure. With the village believing Gaara, the jinchūriki of the One-Tail Shukaku was a failure, Jōseki noted that they needed to depend on the Fourth's development of new techniques and the trading of gold to keep their economy from crumbling. After making this announcement, he noted that they needed to deal with Gaara as well. As a member of the village's council, his main concern is that the village maintains peace and stability. Jūzō Biwa (枇杷十蔵, Biwa Jūzō) was a jōnin from Kirigakure and a member of the Seven Ninja Swordsmen of the Mist. In the anime, Jūzō deserted his village and became a member of Akatsuki, where he was partnered with Itachi Uchiha. When Jūzō joined the Seven Ninja Swordsmen of the Mist, he became the wielder of the Kubikiribōchō, which he used many times to dye the battlefields red with the blood of his enemies. fields.en_description: K (ケー, Kē) is a chūnin of Kumogakure and was partnered with J. K holds a great deal of respect for his partner, J, and always moves alongside him when possible. K has short, spiky brown hair and black eyes. He wears the standard uniform of the Kumogakure shinobi including flak jacket, a white forehead protector and shin guards. Kabure Tokisuki (時好カブレ, Tokisuki Kabure) is a chūnin of Konohagakure. Kabure has been said to like fashionable things and is weak-willed. Kabure has short brown hair that comes to a point at the top. He has small black eyes and wears a blue forehead protector and the typical flak jacket of a Konoha shinobi. Kae Yukiwari (雪割カエ, Yukiwari Kae) is an exchange student to the Konohagakure Academy and the princess of the Land of Bamboo. As future heir to the throne, Kae had been required to act in a manner that befitted her status. Due to that, she did not get a chance to make friends, instead spending her time only with her younger stepbrother during her childhood. Kae was very close to her late mother. Kaede (カエデ) is a kunoichi of Konohagakure. Kaede is deeply infatuated with Naruto Uzumaki to the point she and her friends would chase after him repeatedly for his affections. However, it appears her affections for him are rather vain and solely because he is the hero of the village. In fact, she would rather flirt with Naruto than focusing on her training or missions as a shinobi. Kagami Uchiha (うちはカガミ, Uchiha Kagami) was a jōnin from Konohagakure's Uchiha clan. In the anime, Kagami was amongst the first few hundred of students to attend and graduate the Academy. Having become friends with Danzō Shimura and Hiruzen Sarutobi, he saved the former many times with his dōjutsu. During the First Shinobi World War, he and his teammates from the Escort Unit accompanied the Second Hokage on a mission. fields.en_description: Kage (影, Kage) is an Anbu from Konohagakure. Kage is a reliable shinobi who always accomplishes his missions. Kage has a crop of short, brown hair which hung over the left side of his forehead protector and dark eyes. He wears the standard attire of the Anbu inclusive of flak jacket and typical of most Anbu, he carries a sword strapped to his back. Very little is known of his abilities but Kage is renown for his ability to swiftly approach targets under the cover of darkness, almost like a shado

Kaede Yoshino (嬉野カエデ, Yoshino Kaede) is a former academy student of Konohagakure. Kaede is a very kind and caring young girl. Kaede is a young girl with long, teal-coloured hair tied back a few inches above the end in a loose ponytail, large eyes of the same colour, and fair skin. She was shown to wear a kimono-style garment that is pink in colour and held closed with a yellow obi. Konohamaru liked her a lot, but her father was to be sent on a mission that caused her family to move away from the

Kagari (篝) is a genin from Amegakure. Kagari has spiky brown hair. He wears the same yellow jumpsuit as his teammates which was stitched up the middle along with a pair of sandals. He also wears a forehead protector that covered his whole head, a rebreather and a sash around his face that obstructed his eyes. In the anime, he was seen in a long-sleeved kimono shirt, pants over a black full body suit, sandals and a pair of glasses that obstructed his eyes. He is described as stubborn, and is a sp

Kagari (カガリ, Kagari) was a follower of an Ōtsutsuki Cult. Years ago, Kagari's village suffered a plague which he and his sister Akari had survived. They were soon approached by Boro, who invited them to his cult with false promises. Some time later, Kagari was chosen to be a candidate as Isshiki Ōtsutsuki's vessel. He did not survive the Kāma transfer and Akari was left unaware of his fate for three years.

Kageki (歌劇) is the twin brother of Katazu and the man who accidentally killed Shikazo. Kageki had loaned money to Shikazo one time and after the birth of his child, he needed the money and asked Shikazo if he can be repaid but he refused. After a small scuffle, Shikazo fell and hit his head on a pickling stone that was hard enough to kill him. Since then, Kageki and his family went into hiding, while his twin brother, Katazu, took his identity and got the attention of his pursuers. Kageki has lo

Kagen Uchiha (うちはカゲン, Uchiha Kagen) was a member of Konohagakure's Uchiha clan. Kagen worked for the Konoha Military Police Force's logistical department, which meant he never had an opportunity to awaken the Sharingan. This, combined with the fact that Kagen was of unremarkable talent and had no close relatives, made him the perfect target for Root. Root killed Kagen and had the twins Gozu and Mezu — both surgically altered to look like him — split responsibilities of impersonating Kagen in ord

Kagerō (カゲロウ) was a jōnin of the Fūma clan. She was among the Fūma clan members who were deceived by Orochimaru. She was also one of a three-member group (alongside Jigumo and Kamikiri) who guarded Orochimaru's base in the Land of Sound. After the Fūma clan finished a war with a neighbouring country, they wandered the Land of Rice Fields hoping to settle down. Kagura (カグラ, Kagura) is a former Anbu of Konohagakure and a missing-nin created specifically for the story of the American-exclusive Naruto: Clash of Ninja Revolution 2. Some time prior to the series, Kagura was an Anbu member who had wished to become Tsunade's apprentice, and, hopefully, the Hokage. However, she went rogue and left the village when Tsunade refused to take Kagura as her student, although it was only because of Kagura's lack of compassion for her colleagues. In the time since the

He was the head of the Kaguya clan. Because of Kimimaro's frightening abilities, even among the Kaguya clan, he kept him locked away until one day, he released Kimimaro to help destroy Kirigakure. After reaching Kiri's outskirts, he ordered the entire clan to enter the village in order to destroy it, simply to show off their clan's fearsomeness. Although they were briefly able to gain the upper hand, they were eventually surrounded and outmatched. Knowing they would lose, the clan head told the

Kagura Karatachi (枸橘かぐら, Karatachi Kagura) was a shinobi from Kirigakure, who worked as an aide to the Sixth Mizukage, and a special advisor of the village. Striving to turn Kiri into a village that rivals Konohagakure, he became a prison warden so he could nurture people more. Being the grandson of Yagura, people kept their distance from him. As his safety couldn't be guaranteed, he was relocated to a small village outside of Kirigakure. There, he initially spent his time practising his kenjuts

Kahiko (カヒコ) is an elder who led a wandering caravan who were descendants of the Stone of Gelel ore miners. Kahiko was one of the few who knew the true history of his ancestors and the many secrets encompassing the Stone of Gelel, being a descendant of the ore miners of the Gelel source. He devoted his life in protecting the vein's secrets from evildoers, and led a caravan of fellow descendants including his granddaughter Emina. Kahiko is a man of duty and care, as seen when he was worried of hi

Kahyō (華氷) is a member of the Ryūha Armament Alliance. She later becomes the warden of Hōzuki Castle. Kahyō and her older brother, Rahyō, were born in Kirigakure. Because her ancestors were conquered by Kiri, Kahyō was distrusted by the village and considered expendable. After Kahyō married, she and her husband chose to leave Kiri in order to escape this mistreatment. They settled in the Land of Waves, hoping to find freelance ninja work. Although they did indeed find work, they were no more res

Kaguya Ōtsutsuki (大筒木カグヤ, Ōtsutsuki Kaguya) was a member of the Ōtsutsuki clan and the matriarch of a branch family, including her children Hagoromo and Hamura. Long before the founding of the hidden villages, during an era of endless war, Kaguya consumed the fruit of the God Tree and became the first wielder of chakra on Earth, before later merging with the tree to become the Ten-Tails. A millennium ago, Kaguya and Isshiki were both sent to cultivate a God Tree on the planet Earth and harvest i

Kail (カイル, Kairu) is a citizen of the Land of Redaku. Main article: Sasuke Retsuden: The Uchiha Descendants and the Heavenly Stardust (manga) Kail ran into Lyla while she was chasing a group of thieves, who had stolen a ring from her. The man who was with Lyla chased and stopped the thieves. Noticing his usage of ninjutsu, Kail came to the conclusion the man was a shinobi. As a thank you for helping her get her ring back, Kail brought Sasuke to her home to answer his question regarding the Sage

Kaito Kawanami (川波カイト, Kawanami Kaito) is a genin of Konohagakure. Kaito and his team graduated a year before Boruto's class in the Academy. Since then, his team would regularly take missions overseas. Kaito is a very laidback individual, with a slight condescending nature to him. While seemingly friendly, he is shown to be very mischievous, stealing Chōchō Akimichi's potato chips and tricking Boruto into doing the heavy-lifting of a practical exam for him. He is very proud, unwilling to receive

Kaji (カジ) is a citizen of the Land of Waves. Kaji is a very cautious man considering all the precautions he took to not be caught by Gatō's men. He is also cowardly. Kaji is a middle-aged man with short brown hair and usually wears a pointed straw hat along with a long-sleeved grey and black-coloured outfit with the collar upturned. Along with this he wears a pair of pants and a simple sandals. He also has dark-coloured eyes. Main article: Prologue — Land of Waves Kaji transported Team 7 and Taz

Kaiza (カイザ) was a travelling fisherman who came to the Land of Waves to seek new opportunity. After saving Inari from drowning, he taught the boy everything he knew about life, stressing that he must protect the things that were precious to him, saying to always do so "with these two arms". He eventually married Tsunami, Inari's mother, and became Inari's stepfather as well as role model. When Gatō tried to take over the Land of Waves, Kaiza tried to stop him. But Gatō decided to use Kaiza to in

Kajiki (カジキ) is a shipbuilding craftsman in the Land of Water. Kajiki came from a family of fishermen. However, he did not share the same passion for his family's profession, and eventually became a shipwright. He eventually took Ikada Funato as his disciple in shipbuilding. Although he thought there was something suspicious about Ikada's past, he did not question the boy. Kajiki is a very stern and focused man. Adamant about efficiency, he scolds his subordinates for making mishaps. While kind

Kajika (カジカ) was a missing-nin from Kirigakure who appeared in Naruto: The Cross Roads. Kajika was formerly a shinobi of Kirigakure. After leaving the village and becoming a missing-nin, Kajika became acquainted with Orochimaru and Otogakure. Kajika was very loyal to "Lord" Orochimaru, stating that he "wanted to be useful to someone he respected" and referring to Orochimaru as "the Wonderful One". He was also very cruel and seemingly relished combat, licking his lips when he fought Sasuke. He ha

Kajūra (カジュウラ) or Lighting God Self (雷神我, Raijinga) is a jōnin terrorist and a mercenary ninja of Ishigakure, currently under arrest by Sunagakure forces. Kajūra possesses the ability to combine Earth and Wind Release nature transformations, allowing him to access the Magnet Release kekkei genkai, which he uses in unison with Iron Sand. With it, he can absorb the mass around himself and expand his body's scalar appearance, taking on the shape of a giant. He can also use the technique in unison w

Kakashi Hatake (はたけカカシ, Hatake Kakashi) is a shinobi of Konohagakure's Hatake clan. Famed as Kakashi of the Sharingan (写輪眼のカカシ, Sharingan no Kakashi), he is one of Konoha's most talented ninja, regularly looked to for advice and leadership despite his personal dislike of responsibility. To his students on Team 7, Kakashi emphasises the importance of teamwork; he himself received this lesson, along with the Sharingan, from his childhood friend, Obito Uchiha. After the Fourth Shinobi World War, Ka

fields.en_description: Kakkō (カッコウ) was a jōnin from Iwagakure. During the Third Shinobi World War he was partnered with Taiseki and Mahiru. He most notably engaged Team Minato of Konohagakure, led by Kakashi Hatake. He was successful in capturing Rin Nohara and placed her under a genjutsu, but was unable to extract any information from her. Soon after, Kakashi and Obito Uchiha appeared to rescue Rin, seemingly defeating Kakkō in the process. However, he managed to corner them. The right side of Obito's body was crush

Kakesu (カケス) is one of Ōga's victims. Kakesu is a young woman with chin-length purple hair and eyes of the same color. Main article: Labyrinth Game Arc When the Thunder Train she was taking was diverted during her sleep, she woke up confined alongside other passengers. Ōga revealed himself and put them through experiments to test their ability to avoid death. During the first experiment, Kakesu was deceived by Rokuro into undoing his restraints with the promise of saving her from the collapsing

Kakeru Tsuki (ツキカケル, Tsuki Kakeru) was the father of Michiru and the grandfather of Hikaru Tsuki. Kakeru was the benevolent king of the Land of the Moon. His minister and friend, Shabadaba, showed greedy desire to take over as king, to which Kakeru saw but hoped that Shabadaba would one day understand the his noble vision of selflessness and generosity. As time went on, however, Shabadaba showed no improvement, and eventually, Kakeru accepted the advice of his soldiers and decided to deal with t

Kakoi (カコイ) is a member of the Konoha Barrier Team. Kakoi has shoulder-length brown hair and unique markings under his eye. He wears a high-collared white tunic and white hat. By using Water Release, Kakoi was able to erect an immense Sensing Barrier with the help of others, which allowed him to monitor the situation in Konohagakure. He was first seen monitoring the village's Sensing Water Sphere when Pain's assault on Konoha begins and mobilised the first responders. When Kakoi's name is writte

Kakuzu (角都) was an S-rank missing-nin from Takigakure and a member of Akatsuki who was partnered with Hidan. Kisame Hoshigaki jokingly referred to them as the Zombie Combo (ゾンビコンビ, Zonbi Konbi, English TV: Zombie Pair), due to the fact that, in differing senses, they could not die. When under the servitude of Takigakure as an elite ninja, Kakuzu took on a mission to assassinate Hashirama Senju, the First Hokage. This mission, however, ended in failure against the God of Shinobi. Despite the insu

fields.en_description: This shinobi was a missing-nin from an unknown village and a member of Akatsuki, who was partnered with Kakuzu. Sometime after defecting from an unknown village, he joined the criminal organisation Akatsuki, becoming Kakuzu's fourth partner. In the anime, during a battle with several shinobi, he was eliminated by Kakuzu, who later, upon being chastised by his teammates, claimed he was too slow and should have simply dodged his attack. Kakuzu later took his heart. In the anime, he was depicted as

Kakō (カコウ) was a fabrication that was created to serve Kū, as well as lead the Akuta in order to fulfil Ōnoki's desire to protect peace within Iwagakure and the shinobi world. Kakō was shown to be a very irritable and impatient man, enjoying constant excitement from battle and the likes. Similar to his fellow artificial humans, he was fascinated by the nature of human interaction and enjoyed reading about it. Kakō's love for battle could also make him disobedient towards orders and made him reck

Kakui (カクイ) was a shinobi from Kumogakure. Kakui was a capable kenjutsu user and could incorporate the Lightning Release: Shadow Clone Technique into its usage. Main article: Kara Actuation Arc When word that the cell of the First Hokage was stolen from Konohagakure spread, the Fifth Raikage sent a three-man squad consisting of Kakui, Marui and Omoi to reclaim it. Upon arriving, they learned that the previous holder of the target, Sakuya, had been killed and the cells allegedly stolen by Konoha-

Kamakiri Ikeno (池乃カマキリ, Ikeno Kamakiri) is a shinobi from Kirigakure. Kamakiri is a young man with long, white hair, with a small ponytail tied at the end, and bandages that cover the lower half of his face. His outfit consists of a purple kimono, with waves at the end of its long sleeves, and a red belt, tied around his waist. Kamakiri carries his weapons strapped on his back. Not much is known of Kamakiri's abilities other than that he fought using two kama that resembled regular kunai in size

Kamikiri (カミキリ) was one of the members of the Fūma clan who were betrayed by Orochimaru. He was the leader of a three-member group (alongside Jigumo and Kagerō) who guarded Orochimaru's base in the Land of the Rice Fields. After the Fūma clan finished a war with a neighbouring country, they wandered the Land of Rice Fields hoping to settle down. Near the end of their journey, Orochimaru and Kimimaro appeared before the Fūma and told them that if they joined Otogakure that Orochimaru would help i

Kamira (カミラ) was a knight in Haido's army. She, Ranke, Fugai, and Haido attacked Temujin's village in search of the Stone of Gelel. She seemed to be very sadistic and disturbed, considering her illusion and the way she takes delight at Kankurō's fear and despair. She seemed to be overconfident regarding Ranke's abilities, seeing as how she displayed disbelief at Ranke's death. She liked to play with her opponents and taunt them from afar. She is also somewhat flirtatious, using affectionate and

Kamatari (カマタリ) is the personal summon of Temari. Kamatari is a giant, white-furred weasel with a dark green eye-patch covering his left eye. He carries a large sickle that is almost as long as himself. He was summoned using Temari's Giant Folding Fan as a medium through the Summoning: Quick Beheading Dance, after which he slices down everything in his path with enough force to decimate an entire forest. After he starts moving, he can't be seen by the unaided human eye. He was summoned holding a

Kamata (カマタ) is a prisoner at Hōzuki Castle. Kamata appears as a greedy and sneaky individual. However, shameless as he comes off, his actions are in fact for his younger sister. Loving her deeply and caring for her well-being, Kamata is willing to go to great efforts to support her. At the same time, ashamed of the things he had to do in the goal, he has lied to her about his recent life. Not without some honour, he is shown loyal to those he has grown close to. He has subconscious habit of fla

Kanabun (カナブン) is the leader of the Kanabun Gang. Kanabun is a person who, even in a small turmoil that took place in a small town, will not miss the chance of obtaining benefits and sent his people to take bets on the fight between Tsukado and Katazu. He also showed an aggressive side, refusing to acknowledge a draw in battle and directing his men to kill those for whom he lost money. After a small fight, Kanabun and his men fled in fear, promising revenge. Kanabun has short spiky grey hair and

Kanchi (カンチ) is a young boy, the son of Kokushi. Main article: Kawaki Arc Kanchi had fallen ill to a plague that ravaged his small village, with his father Kokushi tending to him. Boro and his cult arrived to the village with the intention of saving them, with Kanchi's father distrusting the outsiders. Boro "healed" Kokushi, who asked him to heal Kanchi as well.

Kandachi (カンダチ) was a missing-nin from Amegakure and was Hanzō's right hand man, before the latter's death. Sometime after Pain killed Hanzō, Kandachi and a group of Ame ninja fled the country and went into hiding by taking over a village surrounded by a magnetic force that affects a person's chakra flow to the brain similar to genjutsu. Sukune interfered with Kandachi's takeover and resulted in his brutal murder by his summon, the Conch King. He held the women and children hostage and threatene

Kaneki (カネキ) is the president of the Kaneki Corporation. In order to retain his reputation against rival companies, Kaneki pushed forward a dangerous project in one of his chemical plants, even when warned of the high risk. This resulted in an explosion that killed many people. He successfully pinned the blame of the explosion on the deceased project developer, Mikazuki Amaashi. Kaneki is a rather mischievous old man who does whatever he wants, taking advantage of his status. He absolutely does

Kande Inabikari (稲光カンデ, Inabikari Kande) is an Academy student of Konohagakure. Kande is a laidback boy with confidence in his abilities. Kande is an average-height child with fair skin and yellow eyes. He also has blue messy hair with strands standing about. He wears a white hoodie and pants with a simple brown bracelet on his left wrist. While only just starting in the Academy, Kande has rather adept skill in Lightning Release, able to generate it from his hair and launch bolts accurately to s

Kankitsu Akitsuki (明月カンキツ, Akitsuki Kankitsu) is Remon Yoimura's distant relative and fiancé. When they were little, Kankitsu and Remon grew up together. Sometime later, when Kankitsu reached the age of twenty, a curse mark appeared on his right palm. In order to subdue the curse for another hundred years, Kankitsu was ultimately betrothed to Remon. When he visited the Yoimura household to discuss the date for the wedding ritual, Kankitsu was lured and tricked by Sōma to touch its rock, where th

Kanna Ōtsutsuki (大筒木カンナ, Ōtsutsuki Kanna) was a villager during the era of Ninshū, where she lived in a village that Asura Ōtsutsuki was tasked to help. She eventually grew closer to him and became his wife. Kanna lived in a village whose people were suffering from a strange illness that her mother fell victim to. When Asura and Taizō came to the village to solve their "problem" that Hagoromo Ōtsutsuki had tasked them with solving, she believed they were bandits where she was injured in the scuf

Kankurō (カンクロウ) is a shinobi of Sunagakure and the second eldest of the Three Sand Siblings. While initially terrified of his younger brother, Kankurō would come to believe in him and his dream to become the Kazekage like their father before them and would become one of Gaara's most loyal protectors, confidant and bodyguard. Kankurō was born the second child to Karura and the Fourth Kazekage: Rasa. While it was customary for close relations to a Kage to be a jinchūriki, neither he nor his sister

fields.en_description: Kanna (カンナ, Kanna) is a citizen of Konohagakure as well as the current Master Carpenter. He is the son of a carpenter, who was the master carpenter thirty years prior the series. He supervised the rebuilding of Konohagakure, where he hired a lot of foreign help, among others, Gennō. He seemed like a kind man, eager to help the Konoha 11 with their requests. He also seemed organised, knowing where each document he has is located. He is also very proud, stating he could never face the Fifth Hokage

Kanoe (庚) is a former member of Konohagakure's Anbu faction Root. To prevent Hiruzen from being reinstated as Hokage, Danzō gave Kanoe and nine other Root members a mission to assassinate him. Disguised as a foreign shinobi, he fought the Anbu accompanying his target, who turned out to be a disguised Kakashi, resulting in the mission's failure. Kanoe was loyal to Danzō and would follow any and all orders given to him. He is extremely focused in combat, as seen when he didn't show any emotions wh

Kanpu (カンプ) is a caretaker at an orphanage located on the outskirts of Konohagakure. He and Keiri warned Nonō Yakushi about the orphanage's financial struggles, which only became worse after Kabuto was taken in. He was defensive of Kabuto when it was discovered he needed glasses and saw great potential in him. Sometime later, when Danzō Shimura came to the orphanage to recruit a new member for Root, Kanpu became outraged when Danzō threatened to steal what little money the orphanage had if they

Kanoto (辛) is a former member of Konohagakure's Anbu faction Root. To prevent Hiruzen from being reinstated as Hokage, Danzō gave Kanoto and nine other Root members a mission to assassinate him. Disguised as a foreign shinobi, he fought the Anbu accompanying his target, who turned out to be a disguised Kakashi, resulting in the mission's failure. Kanoto is a tall shinobi, with standing, medium-length brown hair. He wears a standard Anbu attire, and his mask has dark blue markings. As an Anbu, Ka

Kanyū (漢入) was a ceramist of Ceramic Village. Kanyū's parents died when she was young and she was taken in by Mashō, the leader of Ceramic Village and creator of the Hanasaki style. She admired Mashō's skills and decided early on that she wanted to be a ceramist just like him. As such, Mashō gave her a pendant to signal that she was a student of Hanasaki; he would wear a similar pendant to signal that he was her teacher. But shortly afterwards Mashō disappeared, and soon so did all of the other

Kanpō (カンポウ) is a medical-nin of Konohagakure. He wears the standard high-collared, full body uniform of the Konoha medical ninja. His uniform has also the Medic Corps sign on the left side of his chest. As a medical-nin, Kanpō presumably has a high level of intellect, is well-versed in medical ninjutsu, and has excellent chakra control to perform medical procedures. He attended to Neji Hyūga after his match with Naruto Uzumaki in the final part of the Chūnin Exams. He was surprised when Hiashi

Karashi (カラシ) is Sanshō's son, and heir to her Curry of Life Shop. Karashi was bullied before meeting Rock Lee, and saw Rock Lee as a strong person and role model. However, he chose to join Raiga Kurosuki's family, due to seeing how hard Rock Lee worked to improve his skills as a shinobi, thus concluding that power is everything. He seems to be very timid, but acts tough. He appears to be very willing to blame his choices on someone else, and is a complete coward. However, he is capable of being

Karai (カライ) is a shinobi from Kumogakure. While returning from a covert mission in the Sugi Village having stolen their kinjutsu Karai, Nigai and the Fourth Raikage are set upon by the mercenary Nokizaru Group who had been hired to retrieve the scroll. Though they fled, an Exploding Insect was implanted into them microscopically and after they berated the Raikage, an irate Nigai attacked the group only to explode. Following the same vein, Karai attacked them but stopped before he could be killed

Karasuki (カラスキ) is a turtle-like artefact belonging to the Ōtsutsuki clan. Karasuki talks in a very matter-of-fact nature. It does not respond beyond explaining the situation or asking for instructions. Despite belonging to the Ōtsutsuki clan and even referring to its members in a respectful manner, it notes that it has no true loyalty to one side. It only exists to perform temporal travel and instruct people about the rules of performing such. Karasuki apparently has a very long lifespan, havin

Kaori (カオリ) is a Konohagakure citizen, and a nurse at the Konoha Hospital. Kaori is a very caring person; as shown when she didn't want Lee to get hurt training while he was supposed to be in the hospital. Kaori is a young, slender woman with brown hair which she wears combed back with a single strand hanging in between her brown eyes. She wears the typical attire of the Konoha medical team which includes a plain white dress and a hat as well. When Rock Lee was admitted to the hospital after his

Karenbana (カレンバナ) was a kunoichi from the Land of the Moon, and the teammate of Ishidate and Kongō. She was hired by Shabadaba to kill its rightful heir and king, Michiru Tsuki. Karenbana and her comrades were hired by Shabadaba to kill Kakeru Tsuki and his family in order for Shabadaba to take the throne of the kingdom. Karenbana, despite being an adult, looked like a child and became angry whenever someone mistook her for a child. She was very confident in her teammates and her own abilities.

Karin Kagura (神楽かりん, Kagura Karin) is the owner of a ninja weapon shop known as "Emporium Karin" located in Konohagakure. When her father died of a mysterious illness, he left the store to Karin. She, however, is not able to handle all the jobs herself and is frequently in need of assistance. Karin is a gloomy and shy girl, only speaking to Naruto whenever she is around him. Despite that, she is also happy and thankful to those who help her out. Karin has fair skin, reddish-pink eyes, short shou

She was a member of the Uzumaki clan who lived in Kusagakure. Karin's mother came to Kusagakure while her daughter was still young. The two were allowed to stay, provided that the mother would use her powers to heal the injured of the village under watch by Zōsui. As the fighting broke-out, the mother was forced to regularly over-use her powers. Eventually, she died from healing too many people at once. This led the leaders of Kusagakure to pass on her former duties to Karin. From what little wa

Karin (香燐) is a subordinate of Orochimaru, a former kunoichi of Kusagakure, and a member of the Uzumaki clan. She assisted Orochimaru in his experiments, and was left in charge as warden of his Southern Hideout while he was away. She was later recruited into Sasuke Uchiha's group Taka, which was initially called "Hebi" at the time of its creation. In the anime, Karin and her mother were allowed to take refuge in Kusagakure, on the condition that her mother healed the village's wounded under watc

Karui Akimichi (秋道カルイ, Akimichi Karui) is a kunoichi from Kumogakure, and a member of Team Samui. She would later marry Chōji Akimichi and emigrate to Konohagakure, thus becoming a member of the Akimichi clan. Karui seems to have a somewhat comedic negative relationship with her teammate Omoi. During their début, they argued over the possible reasons that the Raikage could have called them. She assumed that he wanted them to get him more protein shakes. However, the argument started with Omoi, i

fields.en_description: Karura (加流羅) was a citizen of Sunagakure and the wife of Rasa, the Fourth Kazekage. Karura bore Rasa three children: Temari and Kankurō prior to being pregnant with their youngest child: Gaara. Apparently against her husband's wishes, Karura was forced to allow the tailed beast Shukaku to be sealed within their unborn son. This came at a very steep cost as Gaara's premature birth was also marked by her untimely death. Before her death, however, with her medical team unable to save her, and her h

Karyū (カリュウ) was the leader of the Dark Thunder Group. Karyū was born into a clan of Lava Release users. Unlike villages such as Kumogakure where lava users are well-regarded, Karyū lived in a small village where they were only ever treated as disposable weapons of war. For this reason, his clansmen tended to die young. Karyū did not want that fate for himself and so fled his village. His village pursued him and would eventually have found and killed him, but first he was found by Fūshin. Fūshin

fields.en_description: Kashike (カシケ) is a former academy student of Sunagakure. Kashike is a friend of Abiru, Tsuchino, and Tomari and used to play football with them around Sunagakure. After Gaara accidentally attacked them while trying to play with them, Gaara brought Kashike ointment to apologise. Kashike refused his generosity and called Gaara a freak. He remains scared of Gaara, and most other things to this day. During his days at the academy, Kashike and his three friends chased Shira away since he couldn't ent

Kasumi (カスミ) is a former academy student of Konohagakure. She appears during a flashback to Ino Yamanaka and Sakura Haruno's time in the Academy, appearing alongside Ami and Fuki. In the anime, she is also seen in Naruto's flashback during shuriken training. Kasumi had ginger hair that was done in an afro style with a shuriken-like mark on the front left side of her haircut. She wore a purple dress with mesh underneath and long light pink sleeves along with two sets of belt-like fixtures to it.

Kasumi (かすみ, Kasumi) or Princess Dusk (キリ姫, Kiri-hime), is a princess of Castle Dusk and a reformed antagonist that appears in Naruto: Ultimate Ninja Heroes 2: Phantom Fortress. She also makes a cameo on Naruto Shippūden: Ultimate Ninja 5 and Naruto Shippūden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 2. She had the appearance of a priestess with long dark hair, and wore a white kimono and a black choker along with a curse mask with a red snake on the left side that was given to her by Orochimaru. The hair ornament

Kasuga Nara (奈良カスガ, Nara Kasuga) is a chūnin of Konohagakure's Nara clan. Kasuga has dark eyes and long black hair which frames his face in three parts with the rest tied up in a messy ponytail. He wears the standard attire of the Konohagakure shinobi complete with forehead protector and flak jacket. Like other members of the Nara clan, he is able to manipulate shadows. He demonstrated aptitude with the Shadow Imitation Technique, being able to restrain Ten-Tails for a short amount of time with
Katara (カタラ) is a young orphan in the Land of Silence. Katara has neck-length, messy black hair and round brown eyes. His skin is tanned from the sun, and is considered very cute.

Katasuke Tōno (遠野カタスケ, Tōno Katasuke) is a tokubetsu jōnin of Konohagakure's Scientific Ninja Weapons Team. After the Fourth Great Shinobi War, Katasuke headed up an effort to help all surviving war causalities recover from their maiming injuries. He would often visit and pester Naruto Uzumaki, the Seventh Hokage, for approval on various new projects, ultimately getting well-acquainted with the Hokage's family. He developed an advanced form of prosthetics that would allow people to return to nor

fields.en_description: Kawaki (カワキ) is a genin who was raised by Kara to be the future vessel for Isshiki Ōtsutsuki and the key to the fulfilment of their greatest wish. After being brought to Konohagakure by Team 7, he is taken in by Naruto Uzumaki who adopted him as his own. He ultimately develops a bond with his new family, especially Boruto, while working with them to solve the mystery of the Kāma. As a child, he lived alone with his drunken, abusive father, Kokatsu. In the anime, he was forced to chop wood for a

fields.en_description: Katsuyu (カツユ) is a slug and the personal summon of the Fifth Hokage Tsunade, and her disciple Sakura Haruno. Katsuyu resides in the legendary Shikkotsu Forest. At some point during the Second Shinobi World War, Katsuyu was summoned to the battlefield, alongside Gamabunta and Manda. Katsuyu is quiet and more subservient to its master especially when compared to Manda or Gamabunta. It addresses Tsunade with the highly respectful honourific "-sama", and, in the English versions, calls her "Mistress

en_general_infos.Affiliation: Shikkotsu forest konohagakure allied shinobi forces

fields.en_description: Katazu (カタズ) is a swordsman who took his twin brother Kageki's identity after the accidental death of Shikazo. Kageki had loaned money to Shikazo but after the birth of his child, he asked to be repaid by him but Shikazo refused and a scuffle broke out which resulted him hitting his head on a rock hard enough to kill him. Kageki went to Katazu after that and he took his brother's identity while Kageki and his family went into hiding. Katazu purposely attracted Shikazo's pursuers while they went

Kawarama Senju (千手瓦間, Senju Kawarama) was a young shinobi from the Senju clan. During the war-torn era before the creation of the shinobi villages, Kawarama was one of the many young shinobi who were put on the battlefield to fight. At a young age, he became a shinobi with outstanding talent, but nevertheless became a casualty to the Uchiha and the Hagoromo clan during the ever-waging battles. When the remains of Kawarama's body were retrieved, it was buried alongside other fallen comrades, in a

Katsura (カツラ) was a friend of Tenma Izumo during their time in Konohagakure's Academy. Katsura's father died during the Nine-Tailed Demon Fox's Attack, which many believed to have been the doing of an Uchiha. For this reason he joined Tenma and Hagiri in bullying Itachi Uchiha, though he was secretly afraid to face Itachi. Despite being much younger than all of them, Itachi easily defeated them once a fight broke out. "Katsura" (桂) is the Japanese name of the "Japanese Judas tree".

Kaya (カヤ) was a character from Jiraiya's novel, who appeared in Tsunade's Infinite Tsukuyomi dream. Kaya loved her two sons Ashitaba and Komichi dearly, praying to their village's deity "Lord Mashima" in their favour. She was very devoted to said deity in general, assuming that when her sons returned safely, it was thanks to Lord Mashima. Kaya was a woman with fair skin, long brown hair, and large black eyes. She wore a plain light-grey shirt, grey pants under a brown skirt and black sandals. Af

Kayo (加代) is the wife of the daimyō of the Land of Honey. She originated from the Land of Bean Jam. She has long purple hair which is done in a hime-style and dark eyes. She wears a traditional long sleeved kimono. While in route with her delegation, they encountered some bad weather and decided to divert and seek shelter. While on their way, a thick mist enveloped them followed by a while light leaving nothing behind, but the destroyed litter that the princess was being transported in. She and

en_general_infos.Affiliation: Land of honey land of bean jam

fields.en_description: Kayui (カユイ) is a shinobi of Kumogakure. Kayui is a relatively calm and level-headed individual as seen from when he calmly questioned what they should do when they were being pursued by Ameyuri. He later attempted to keep the peace between his comrades when a conflict arose. Kayui is a tall, dark-skinned shinobi of muscular build with shoulder-length slick-backed blond hair and purple, pupiless eyes. He wears the standard attire of the Kumogakure shinobi, and wears his shirt zipped down midway.

Kazami (カザミ) is a shinobi from Kusagakure and a teammate of Muyami and Burami. Kazami is very defensive of his comrades, as he was willing to start a fight with the Konoha genin after Neji Hyūga repelled Burami's sweat from their food, unintentionally knocking him off his feet. Kazami is a very determined man, showing his unwavering resolve in completing his mission and likewise is a strong supporter of teamwork. He is also comically supportive of his teammates, to the point that he sometimes wa

Kazabune (カザブネ) is a travelling salesman who deals in water balloons and other toys. Kazabune has short brown hair and a small brown goatee. He also has dark-coloured eyes. He wears a light green-coloured tank top shirt. Jiraiya accidentally destroys his cart while demonstrating the Rasengan, so he pays for the damage with money taken from Gantetsu. He also buys Kazabune's entire inventory of balloons to teach Naruto the Rasengan.

Kazuma (カズマ), also known as Furido (フリド, Furido), was a member of the Twelve Guardian Ninja, and eventually led half of the group to stage a coup d'etat against Konohagakure, and more specifically, the Hokage. Kazuma was once part of the Twelve Guardian Ninja. Over time, he and five other members developed a radical new view of safety and stability for the Land of Fire. Feeling that Konohagakure's more passive methods of protecting the country were ineffective, Kazuma's faction decided to do awa

fields.en_description: Kegon (ケゴン) is a jōnin from Takigakure. Kegon has short, brown curly hair and small black eyes. His outfit consists of a violet jacket, with the inside being green, black top, with his midriff being exposed, and dark pants. He also has two holsters attached near each of his elbows. He wears a blue forehead protector. Kegon has a level of proficiency in Water Release techniques, able to launch a barrage of water shuriken in quick succession at his opponent. Kegon and Yōrō were instructed by Shibu

Kazan (カザン), renowned as Hundred Transformations Kazan (百変化のカザン, Hyaku Henge no Kazan) was a Yugakure shinobi who appeared in Naruto the Movie: Blood Prison. Kazan was a very strong-willed individual who was proud of his abilities. He does have a sense of loyalty and repaying debt, as he followed orders from Mui and his four council members to save his son, who was held captive by the five, and when Mui rescued him from the other four's betrayal, Kazan repaid his debt by protecting Mui and attem

Kiba Inuzuka (犬塚キバ, Inuzuka Kiba) is a member of Konohagakure's Inuzuka clan and a member of Team Kurenai. Despite his headstrong, and at times egotistic attitude, Kiba is loyal to his comrades and will do anything to protect them with his trusted canine companion, Akamaru, by his side. At a very young age, Akamaru was given to Kiba by his mother, Tsume, and the two became very close soon afterwards. Before entering the Academy, Kiba and Akamaru played together a great deal, resulting in Tsume g

fields.en_description: Kedama (ケダマ) is a prisoner at Hōzuki Castle. Since coming to Hōzuki Castle, Kedama was very rebellious to the guards. His constant fighting against them earned him high praise from the other inmates. He grew especially close to the fellow inmate, Kiku. Together, they formed a plan to escape the prison. The plan required a lot of rain and Kiku predicted that it would soon rain. On the night of the plan, with no rain in sight, Kedama decided to stay in his cell, concluding that the plan would have

Keiri (ケイリ) is a caretaker at an orphanage located on the outskirts of Konohagakure. She and Kanpu warned Nonō Yakushi about the orphanage's financial struggles, which only became worse after Kabuto was taken in. She was frustrated by Kabuto's inability to tell time, unaware he needed glasses. Sometime later, when Danzō Shimura came to the orphanage to recruit a new member for Root, Keiri threatened to report Danzō's blackmail to the Third Hokage. Keiri seemed to get easily frustrated with the c

Kido Tsumiki (積木キド, Tsumiki Kido) is an Anbu executive from Konohagakure, formerly a high-ranking member of Root. Kido was raised by his father and mother, the former of whom dedicated all of his income to send Kido to the Academy, so that he could have a higher chance at a better life. However, when his father began faking taking his medicine to save money for Kido's schooling, he eventually succumbed to his sickness. Because of this, Kido grew an addiction to money. In time, Kido became a powe

Kidōmaru (鬼童丸) was a shinobi from Otogakure and a member of the Sound Four. In the anime, the Sound Four were originally prisoners of Orochimaru, forced to fight other prisoners to the death in battle royales. By surviving their respective matches, they proved themselves to be the strongest of Orochimaru's prisoners and as such were made his bodyguards. The Sound Four were at some point forced to accept Kimimaro as their leader, who easily defeated them all in battle and, because of his Shikotsu

Kie (帰依) was a member of the original Akatsuki. In search of peace, Kie joined the independent group called Akatsuki. During one of the ordeals he and his comrades had to go through, Kie was injured and had to wear a sling on his arm. Later, during a gathering of Akatsuki members, he reaffirmed to Konan his own and the others' endorsement of Nagato and Yahiko. He was presumably killed afterwards when Madara Uchiha attacked the members of Akatsuki, who were on their way to save Yahiko, Nagato and

Kihō (鬼鳳) was a shinobi from Otogakure, and a member of Team Guren. He seemed rather blunt, and went along with Rinji's strategies without complaints. He, like some of his teammates, wanted nothing to do with Orochimaru and wished to flee. Kihō also feared death and would do anything to live. He referred to death as "going boom" because of Kabuto. Kihō had pale, pasty-looking skin and white hair with dark, blue-framed glasses with orange lenses. His outfit consisted a dark purple cloak with oran

Kigiri (鬼霧) was a shinobi from Otogakure and a member of Team Guren. Kigiri, like some of his teammates, wanted nothing to do with Orochimaru and wished to flee. He appeared quite laid-back compared to other members of the group. Also, he addressed Rinji as Aniki (兄貴, literally meaning: Brother) on occasion. He was doubtful of Guren's promise to him and the others. He feared death and wouldn't run into a fight recklessly. In addition, he seemed to enjoy playing cards with others and disliked get

Kiiro (キイロ) was a freelance shinobi. Kiiro was born into a family of bee users. By tradition, only the firstborn, Kodaka, was taught how to control the bees, and it was the responsibility of Kiiro, as the secondborn, to protect Kodaka. Kiiro resented this responsibility, believing he could make better use of the bees and that giving his life to protect Kodaka, which was expected of him, would be a waste of his talents. Kiiro did not hide these feelings from Kodaka. After their parents died, it f

Kiki (キキ) is a monkey and a trained circus animal. Kiki was partnered with Chamū in a circus and together, were its best act. Kiki cares about his owner Hikaru Tsuki and his friends. Kiki is a brown furred monkey with a long tail and big black eyes. Kiki wears a small red vest and a small red hat. Kiki also wears a tiny yellow cape and a yellow bow-tie on its tail. Kiki is a trained circus animal belonging to the circus that Michiru Tsuki purchases. He is Chamū's partner. At the end of the movie

Kiji (キジ) is a genin from the Benisu Island. Both Kiji and his twin brother Sada seem to have very cheerful dispositions and are often seen smiling. The two brothers also tend to sing while they work or if they speak they say the same thing. Kiji has short black hair that hangs around his face with a topknot. He wears a simple outfit with an apron-like suit over it along with a white sash, wrist warmers and simple shinobi sandals. As a shinobi from the Benisu Island, Kiji makes use of an abacus

Kikuchiyo (キクチヨ) is a ninken of Konohagakure's Inuzuka clan, and partner of Mimi Inuzuka. Kikuchiyo is very loyal to Mimi, attacking others who get aggressive with her. Kikuchiyo is a small dog that resembles a Siberian husky with blue eyes. Main article: Kawaki & Himawari Academy Arc Kikuchiyo accompanied Mimi to the Academy when she began attending it. During a practice pitting the classmates against each other, Mimi decided to not partake. When Ehō Norimaki scolded her for it, calling her laz

Kikunojō (菊之丞) was a skilled ninja from the Land of Vegetables. He grew up and trained alongside his friend, Yurinojō, who shared a friendly rivalry with him. When still kids, he and Yurinojō developed a huge crush on Tsunade and fought for her affection. Since a young age, Kikunojō showed tremendous talent for ninja arts and earned great fame throughout the Land of Vegetables. He was later chosen as a personal guard to the daimyō. He was a rather strong and implacable person who sought to fulfi

Kiku (キク) was a prisoner at Hōzuki Castle. During his time at Hōzuki Castle, Kiku befriended Kedama, who he admired for his defiant attitude towards the guards. Together, the two came up with a plan to escape the prison. Kiku had learned to predict the weather from the clouds from his fisherman father, and determined that despite the good weather, it would soon rain, which he and Kedama intended to use to get rid of the Heavenly Prison seal on them. Kiku proceeded with their plan, but Kedama was

Killer B (キラービー, Kirā Bī, Viz: Killer Bee) is a shinobi from Kumogakure. He is the most recent jinchūriki of the Eight-Tails, Gyūki, though, unlike his predecessors, he was able to befriend it and hone its power for Kumo's benefit. Despite being responsible for the village's protection, B aspires to be the world's greatest rapper. At a young age, he was along with several other children who were gathered by the Third Raikage and Dodai in order to select a tag partner for his son A. Out of all th

fields.en_description: Kimimaro (君麻呂) was the sole survivor of the Kaguya clan. Upon dedicating his life to Orochimaru, he became the leader of the formerly-named Sound Five (音隠れの忍五人衆, Otogakure no Shinobi Gonin Shū, literally meaning: Hidden Sound Shinobi Five People), until he fell ill, which forced him to leave the group. Being a rare possessor of his clan's Shikotsumyaku kekkei genkai, the clan patriarch feared Kimimaro's abilities and had him locked up in a cage unless needed for battle. The Kaguya clan was wiped

Kin (キン, Kin) appears in Naruto the Movie: Ninja Clash in the Land of Snow. He is a popular actor who plays Brit in the movie "Princess Gale". In the movie, Michy, Kin, and Hidero summoned their rainbow chakra to defeat the Armoured Warriors and their leader. Kin is a relaxed individual and enjoys picking fun with his colleagues. Kin is a bald man with purple-coloured eyes. He has black eyebrows. He appeared along side the other actors that play in the movie "Princess Gale". He was taking a brea

Kin Tsuchi (キン・ツチ) was a kunoichi from Otogakure and a member of Team Dosu which took part in the Chūnin Exams under orders from Orochimaru to test Sasuke Uchiha's skills. Like her teammates, Kin appeared to be overconfident in her abilities. She had a strong dislike towards Sakura due to her apparent vanity for her hair and criticises her for focusing on her appearances rather than training, even going so far to call Sakura a female swine and boy-chaser in the manga. Like her teammate Zaku, she
