fields.en_description: The King of Hell (冥府の王, Meifu no Ō) is a deity that rules over life and death. One who wields the Rinnegan is able to call upon this deity for various purposes, possessing authority over it through the power of the Six Paths. As it possesses Rinnegan in its own eyes, the user is able to see anything the King of Hell sees. The King of Hell can be called upon by Rinnegan wielders through the power of the Naraka Path, with its head emerging from the ground amidst dark flames. When the user grabs th

Kina Kodon (虎呑キナ, Kodon Kina) is a young member of the Kodon clan. When Kina was an infant, his father, Tenma Kodon, attacked the Howling Wolf Village with the ancient monster, Rōen, in an attempt to convince the village to preserve its shinobi ways. He lost control of Rōen during the attack and Kina's mother died in an unsuccessful attempt to seal it back into the Kodon shrine it was historically imprisoned within. Tenma's only option to save the village was to seal it into his son. Tenma tried

King (キング, Kingu) is a giant gorilla that lives on Genbu. Killer B calls him King-chan (キングちゃん, Kingu-chan), as a sign of affection. King, like most inhabitants of the island is very large in size towering over the humans there. He is brown in colour with lighter shades of brown fur on his hands, face and chest. He also has green eyes and a prominent scars running down the left side of his body: above his eye, his mouth and along his torso. King appeared before the Kumo and Konoha ninja when Mot

Kinkaku (金角) was one of Kumogakure's infamous Gold and Silver Brothers, and a member of the Kinkaku Force. During the First Raikage's reign, he and Ginkaku were part of a team that was assigned to capture the Nine-Tailed Demon Fox, but the two were swallowed during the confrontation. However, they survived by eating the flesh of the beast, and thrashed inside the tailed beast's stomach for two weeks, eventually forcing the Nine-Tails to regurgitate them. Upon their escape, they both came out loo

en_general_infos.Team: Gold and silver brothers kinkaku force

fields.en_description: Kinshiki Ōtsutsuki (大筒木キンシキ, Ōtsutsuki Kinshiki) was a member of the Ōtsutsuki clan's main family, who served as a guardian for his foster son Momoshiki. At some point, Kinshiki consumed his guardian's chakra after they entrusted him with their power. Kinshiki was very loyal and subservient to his foster son Momoshiki, to the extent that he offered himself to be changed into a chakra fruit (or chakra pill in the movie) without hesitation. He also referred to his foster son using the honourific "

Kinoto (乙) is a former member of Konohagakure's Anbu faction Root. Shortly after the Third Great Shinobi War, Kinoto served as a bodyguard to Danzō Shimura during a meeting with Orochimaru after the latter had been passed over for the position for Hokage. Later, he informed Danzō about Orochimaru's defection from Konoha. He later took part in an assassination attempt of Hiruzen Sarutobi on Danzō's orders, which was foiled by Kakashi informing Hiruzen of their plans beforehand. Three years later,

Kintoki (キントキ) is a giant bear that lives on Genbu. Kintoki is a bear with white fur on his arms, legs and head. The fur on his paws and torso is black, as is a mark that runs over his right eye that resembles an eye patch. Kintoki is undoubtedly very strong considering he's a giant bear. He is also able to Sumo Wrestle according to Killer B. When he was bested by Killer B in a sumō match, he was told by him that he had gotten soft. Later, alongside King and the other bears, Kintoki watched Migh

Kirara (キララ) was a fabrication, that was created to serve Kū and to lead the Akuta in order to fulfil Ōnoki's desire to protect peace within Iwagakure and the shinobi world. Kirara was a well-mannered girl as seen when she greeted Kū with a curtsy. Similar to most of her allies, Kirara had a distinct fascination with the nature of human interaction. She showed a fashionable side, enjoying various accessories to show off her ladylike-side. Even more, she had a special fondness for everything she

Kiri (伎璃, Kiri) is the village head of Green Banks. Growing up with her father, Kiri looked up to him in how he was both such a strong and wise leader. Upon her father passing away suddenly, Kiri succeeded him and became the village head of Green Banks. Afterwards, the village was attacked by Pale Blue Valley, with the intention of forcing Kiri to hand over the deed to village's bridge her father had built. Before her father's demise, Kiri was a cheerful girl who idolised the man. She aspired to

Kiri (キリ, Kiri) is a medical-nin from Kirigakure. In the anime, Kiri harbours hostility towards the shinobi of Iwagakure for having killed his father. He is a focused shinobi who cares about his comrades' lives. Kiri has short spiky, black hair and black eyes. He wears the standard attire of a Kirigakure shinobi inclusive of flak jacket, and pin-stripped leg and arm-guards. He also wears the forehead protector of the Allied Shinobi Forces. As a medical-nin, Kiri is able to perform the Mystical P

Kirisame (キリサメ) is a missing-nin from Amegakure. He left his village behind to help Suien seek the Hero Water in Takigakure. He seems to be the most sadistic of the three, as he laughs while repeatedly stomping Naruto. He enjoys killing and even had to be repeatedly reminded not to kill so many people by Suien. Kirisame wears a grey hat like forehead protector with the Amegakure symbol on the front of it, tied around the back of his head. He has tiny black pupils, messy, chin-length brown hair c

Kiruru (キルル) was a genin of Kirigakure. Kiruru and his team took part in the same Chūnin Exams as Itachi Uchiha. When, during the exams' second stage, they found Itachi travelling through the Forest of Death alone, they attacked him, expecting it would be easy to take his scroll. After falling prey to Itachi's Crow Clone Technique, having his fire overpower their water, and finally glimpsing his Sharingan, Kiruru and his teammates surrendered their scroll in exchange for being allowed to live. I

Kirisaki (キリサキ) is a missing-nin from Kirigakure. At some point in the past, Kirisaki's medical misdeeds were discovered by Kirigakure, forcing him to leave his village and become a missing-nin. Kirisaki is lecherous, selfish, opportunistic, and greedy. He also has a merciless streak as seen when he beat up and tried to murder a young boy who stole his briefcase. Kirisaki has long white hair and hazel eyes. He wears a white shirt, an orange tie, a purple vest, black pants and a purple overcoat.

Kiseru Gankubi (雁首キセル, Gankubi Kiseru) is an Anbu from Konohagakure. He is a former undercover agent as an Outer of Kara. Kiseru claims he was born in a mountain village near the border with Takigakure, where he enjoyed hot springs with his grandfather, though he later admitted this was a lie. He eventually moved to Konoha, where he became an Anbu and met Konohamaru Sarutobi. At some point, he became part of a multi-village team investigating several mass disappearances alongside a treasured fri

en_general_infos.Team: Five great countries' joint investigation team

fields.en_description: Kisuke Maboroshi (まぼろし奇介, Maboroshi Kisuke) was a member of Konohagakure's Anbu. The leaders of Konoha had suspicions that there was a spy within their midst and Kisuke was assigned with the task of finding out who that person was. His investigations led him to an upcoming shinobi, Sabiru. One night, he tracked down Sabiru in a forest, and after discovering he was the spy he engaged him in battle. After a short fight, Sabiru deceived him with a shadow clone and threw him in the river below. He m

Kisame Hoshigaki (干柿鬼鮫, Hoshigaki Kisame), feared as the Monster of the Hidden Mist (霧隠れの怪人, Kirigakure no Kaijin), was a shinobi of Kirigakure's Hoshigaki Clan. After joining the Seven Ninja Swordsmen of the Mist, he became an S-rank missing-nin and was partnered with Itachi Uchiha when the latter joined Akatsuki. Originally, Kisame was to guard the Cypher Division under orders from his superior, Fuguki Suikazan of the Seven Ninja Swordsmen of the Mist. When the group was cornered by Konoha-nin

en_general_infos.Team: Cypher division seven ninja swordsmen of the mist

fields.en_description: Kisuke's Wife was a villager of Konohagakure. She was murdered inside her own home while her husband Kisuke Maboroshi was away. Their house was subsequently set on fire while her body was still inside. It was later revealed that it was Sabiru who had killed her. She seemed to really like flowers, her favourite being tulips which she kept in the house. According to Kisuke, she was a kind and cheerful individual. Her appearance included her purple hair in a bun with two short locks of hair falling

Kitane (キタネ) was once a member of the Twelve Guardian Ninja. He appears to have once been friends with Asuma Sarutobi before his death. While he was still alive, he was part of the Twelve Guardian Ninja. Ten years before the start of the series, when six of the members tried a coup d'etat, he alongside Asuma Sarutobi, Chiriku, Nauma, Tōu, and Seito fought against them, only to be killed by Kazuma when Kitane and the three other lightning users tried to use Limelight on Kazuma. Kitane never made

Kitō (キトウ) is a medical-nin of Konohagakure. Because he wears the standard high-collared, full-body uniform of the Konoha medical ninja, the only discernible facial feature of Kitō is his dark eyes. He is skilled enough in medical ninjutsu to aid in the delicate technique used for resuscitating Neji Hyūga who was on the brink of death. He is able to perform the Mystical Palm Technique, too. As a medical-nin, Kitō naturally also has basic knowledge of medical treatments and ninjutsu, as well as g

Kiyoi Yotsuki (夜月キヨイ, Yotsuki Kiyoi) is a shinobi from Kumogakure and a member of the Yotsuki clan. Kiyoi is very loyal to his clan and Kumogakure. He would rather remain silent than sell out his comrades, as shown when he was being attacked by the Taka. Kiyoi has dark eyes, brown hair and a very well-defined jaw line. He wore the standard attire of Kumogakure shinobi, including a forehead protector, flak jacket and shin guards. He also has a black strap on the right side of his head. Main artic

Kitsuchi (黄ツチ) is a jōnin from Iwagakure. At some point, when it was discovered that a spy had infiltrated their village, Kitsuchi and another shinobi found Nanigashi, who had intercepted the spy but failed to capture him. Kitsuchi is a solemn, disciplined, adaptive and level-headed individual. He is calm under pressure, decisive when acting and assertive, making him a good leader. He also has a large amount of pride in himself and his daughter, believing them capable of turning the battle in th

en_general_infos.Occupation: Second division commander of the allied shinobi forces

fields.en_description: Kiyomu Fukuda (Fukuda Kiyomu) is a ninja from Konohagakure. An entry seen briefly in a bingo book prior to Chiriku and Asuma Sarutobi's in the anime showed that Kiyomu has a 7.8 billion ryō bounty on their head. Kiyomu Fukuda was named after the director and storyboard artist for episode 76.

en_general_infos.Height: Part ii: 170.18 cm1.702 m  5.583 ft  67 in

fields.en_description: Kizashi Haruno (春野キザシ, Haruno Kizashi) is a shinobi of Konohagakure. In the anime, after learning that his daughter was to be taught by Kakashi Hatake, Kizashi and his wife were visited by Kakashi and the Third Hokage. Kizashi and his wife eagerly invited both of them for tea. Kizashi is a very jovial and charismatic individual, often times joking with those around him and using puns which at times exasperates his wife, Mebuki. The dynamics between the two, can easily overwhelm others as they co

Kobanza (コバソザ) was a pirate from the Funato clan. Kobanza was a patient and careful individual, willing to bide his time to reach a goal, but only up to a point. His spreading of Taiki's murder and the inconsistencies in his false testimony while impersonating a Dotō Island refugee were enough to expose his plan upon close scrutiny. He preferred to deal with enemies in a stealthy manner, turning them against each other. He was fiercely loyal to the Funato Clan, preferring to kill himself in an a

Kiyoyasu Kagetsu is a citizen from the Land of Fire and a member of the Kagetsu Family. Kiyoyasu seemed very confident in his own abilities to make people laugh. Kiyoyasu is a tall man, with a short crop of black hair and black-coloured eyes. During the "funeral" of Tōbei Kagetsu, he wears a black suit with a white shirt and black tie underneath. Main article: Funeral Proxy Mission He is one of the family members attending Tōbei's funeral. After some failed attempts from his other relatives to m

Kobushi Saiki (砕気コブシ, Saiki Kobushi) is a shinobi from Kumogakure. Kobushi has light-brown skin, greyish-brown hair, greyish-brown eyebrows, and green eyes, with one of them sporting a long horizontal scar right through his left eye and left his eyebrow. His outfit consists of a single long-sleeved white kimono with dark-blue trimmings, with the left sleeve already missing, and a dark-blue obi belt. He wears a light orange forehead protector as a collar. Kobushi also dons a wrist protector and t

Kobuna (コブナ) is a pirate of the Funato clan. Kobuna is a rather self-confident boy who loves family deeply. Originally, while committed to the Funato and hoping to defeat Kirigakure, he was a cheerful boy, always eager to help out his clansmen. Upon learning of his father's death, however, he immediately committed himself completely to avenge him. However, upon seeing Boruto's genuine regret in killing Funamushi and willingness to sacrifice himself for peace made Kobuna have a change of heart. K

Kodama (コダマ) is the brother of Hibiki. After his father's murder and the investigation going nowhere over lack of evidence, Kodama and Hibiki became dedicated to avenging their father by finding the killer, who was a proficient Wind Release user and was left with a cross shaped scar after the encounter with their father. They would go from village to village attacking ex-shinobi who were Wind Release users, though they never killed any of their victims, leaving only cross shaped tears on their c

Kohan Yamanaka (山中コハン, Yamanaka Kohan) is a member of Konohagakure's Yamanaka Clan, as well as a shinobi in the Konoha Barrier Team. Kohan is a very disciplined man, taking his job seriously. He dislikes tardiness and does not believe in coddling people. At the same time, he is a kind man who seeks to help where he can. He is also openly an admirer of Ino Yamanaka. Kohan is a tall man of fair complexion and pale blue eyes. He has hime-style blond hair reaching his mid-back that is tied in a high

Kohada (コハダ) is a citizen of Konohagakure who works at her father's sushi-store. She helps keep the store clean. Kohada is described as being well-liked by regulars at her father's store. She has also been described as being a hard worker. She has brown hair and light-coloured eyes. After the Third Hokage's funeral, Jiraiya spied on Kohada and some other girls who were bathing in a public bath house. Kohada (小鰭) is a Japanese gizzard shad that is a common ingredient for sushi. This is a referenc

Kohari Umino (うみのコハリ, Umino Kohari) was a kunoichi from Konohagakure. During the Nine-Tails' attack, she received a severe injury to her back, which her son Iruka noticed, causing him to wish to stay and protect her. Despite her injuries, she was more concerned about Iruka's welfare. Her name, along with her husband's, was added to the Konoha Memorial Stone after they died. Kohari was a believer of her village's will and as such was very protective of her son, willing to give her life to protect

Kodaka (コダカ) was a freelance shinobi. Kodaka was born into a family of bee users. As the firstborn, Kodaka was the only one taught how to control the bees, granting him a symbiotic relationship similar to Aburame. Unlike the Aburame, whose insects lived within their bodies, Kodaka's bees lived upon his body, which he kept covered with a large coat. His younger brother, Kiiro, always envied Kodaka, not only because he believed he was more deserving of the family's secrets, but because he, as the

Kokatsu (コカツ) is a former shinobi. In the anime, Kokatsu was apparently a former shinobi who was a hero from the Fourth Shinobi World War, though many doubted the claim given his boorish nature. Whatever hardships he had to endure ultimately took its toll on him, leaving him a bitter man who took solace in drinking. Eventually, he would have a son, Kawaki. Kokatsu was abusive towards Kawaki. One night, after locking Kawaki away for accidentally breaking his bottle of alcohol, Jigen arrives to th

Kokage Yanagikage (柳陰コカゲ, Yanagikage Kokage) is a chūnin of Konohagakure. Kokage has a short crop of brown hair and black eyes. He sports a purple-coloured tattoo on his left cheek, which features the kanji 陰 (kage), meaning "shadow" or "shade". He wears the standard Konohagakure attire complete with a flak jacket and bandanna-styles forehead protector. Kokage is capable of using Wind Release nature transformation and he displayed his skills with the Wind Release: Great Breakthrough technique du

Koji Kashin (果心居士, Kashin Koji) is a clone of Jiraiya that was created by Amado Sanzu for the purpose of killing Isshiki Ōtsutsuki. A former Inner of Kara, he was in charge of the sector on the outskirts of the Land of Fire. Koji was created as an alternate plan against Isshiki after Amado's plan for using augmented cyborg Outers was shut down by Jigen. In the anime, Koji witnessed Kawaki being confronted by Garō and Kawaki unconsciously activated his Kāma and blasted Garō. An enigmatic man, Koj

Koharu Utatane (うたたねコハル, Utatane Koharu) is a former member of the dissolved Team Tobirama. She and her teammate Homura Mitokado now serve as members of the Konoha Council. In the anime, shortly after the foundation of the village, she was shown to be part of a class alongside Homura Mitokado and Torifu Akimichi. Later she watched on, as Hiruzen Sarutobi and Danzō Shimura were about to spar, along with Torifu and Kagami Uchiha. Under the guidance of the Second Hokage, Tobirama Senju, Koharu and

fields.en_description: Kokuri (コクリ) was a former accountant of the Mujina Bandits. While originally trying to become a ninja, he failed in it, ultimately instead become an accountant. He was hired by a company to handle their money. Eventually, he learned that it was front for the Mujina Bandits. Horrified that he was helping such a shady organisation with all their stolen money, he ran away. In such a haste, he also took the recent stolen money with him. After narrowly escaping his former employers, Kokuri decided to

Kokushi (コクシ) is a villager who joined Boro's cult. Kokushi is a short man with short, brown hair that's spiked toward the left. He also has a unibrow, large ears and sideburns. Main article: Kawaki Arc When a disease plagued his village, Kokushi tended to his son Kanchi, who had fallen ill. Suddenly, Boro and his cult arrived to his village, claiming to be there to save them. Kokushi himself had been infected by the disease and distrusted outsiders. To prove themselves, Boro "healed" him, his s

Kokuyō (コクヨウ) was a fabrication, that was created to serve Kū and to lead the Akuta in order fulfil Ōnoki's desire to protect peace within Iwagakure and the shinobi world. Kokuyō was a very serious and straightforward individual, viewing emotions and companionship as irrelevant and only things that will interfere with efficiency. He showed little trust in others and focused solely on his mission. He was shown to be very merciless, willing to kill allies to insure no loose ends should they fall b

Kokuō (穆王), more commonly known as the Five-Tails (五尾, Gobi), is one of the nine tailed beasts. It was last sealed within Han from Iwagakure. Kokuō and the tailed beasts first came into being in the waning days of Hagoromo Ōtsutsuki, who used his Creation of All Things Technique to divide the Ten-Tails' chakra into nine separate bodies and giving each a name. Some time after being created, the Sage explained to the young tailed beasts that a link existed between them despite their separation. He

Kokuyō (コクヨウ, Kokuyō) is a puppeteer who violently sought the hand of Shizuka in marriage even though she spurned his advances in order to rule the Nadeshiko Village. Wanting to rule over the Nadeshiko Village, Kokuyō challenged the leader, Shizuka, in an attempt to defeat her so she would be forced to marry him per the village's rules. Because of his ambition, Kokuyō ended up challenging Shizuka ninety-eight times with his puppets, but each one had been easily destroyed by the latter. From all

Komachi (小町) is a Konohagakure Anbu operative and a partner to Towa. She appears exclusively in video games. Komachi always follows her orders and she wishes to protect Konohagakure. She also mocks her opponents during combat. Komachi wears the standard attire of a Root member though she is not of Root. She wears a cat-like white Anbu mask. She has purple-coloured arrow-like markings on her mask. She has long blonde hair that she keeps tied up and then down in four different strands. She keeps a

Komame (コマメ) is the bureau chief of Konohagakure's Central Post Office. Komame originally studied to become a shinobi before turning his interest towards direct service for Konoha. Komame is a very serious and responsible man. Believing strongly in an organised setup and finishing all tasks presented, he treats his job with a methodical approach. He traits every aspect of his job with the utmost importance as he is furious to learn even a single mailing did not get sorted or delivered properly.

Komaza (コマザ) is a genin from Sunagakure. Komaza was angry when he got caught cheating five times during the Chūnin Exams testing and he angrily questioned the chūnin that were tasked with watching the genin take their test. Komaza has short, spiky brown hair and dark eyes. He wears a light-green shirt with the sleeves rolled up, brown pants and a bracelet of sorts around his left hand. Komaza who was caught cheating five times during the first phase of the Chūnin Exams, thus failing the test. Wh

Komichi (コミチ) was a character from Jiraiya's novel, who appeared in Tsunade's Infinite Tsukuyomi dream. Komichi was very fond of his teddy bear "Kenta" (ケンタ) and even went back to the dangerous village to retrieve it. Komichi was a small boy with short brown hair and large black eyes. He wore a plain green shirt, beige pants and pink sandals. Despite having been told to evacuate their village by Team Jiraiya, Komichi and Ashitaba went back to retrieve his teddy bear. In their house, they encount

Komugi (コムギ) is a genin from Konohagakure. Komugi seemed to get happy easily even crying tears of joy when he found his team passed the first part of his second Chūnin Exams. He, like his teammates, is overconfident in his abilities. Komugi has spiky black hair and a small, pointed goatee. He has squinting eyes and wears a simple two-toned t-shirt, pants and the village's forehead protector. He has some taijutsu skills as he fought hand-to-hand against the Sunagakure ninja on the night before th

Komori is a member of the Enlightened Ones. Komori is confident in his team-mates' abilities. He also held an interest in Hinoko. Komori has a short crop of black hair that is spiked towards the front and dark-coloured eyes. He wears a black trench coat common of the Enlightened Ones. Komori is first seen cleaning in the inn where Shikamaru Nara, Hinoko and Rō enter. When the inn gets raided by shinobi, Komori, claiming to hate Tobari officials, helps them escape. Later, When Hinoko asks to join

Komushi (コムシ) was a young shinobi from Sunagakure. Komushi grew up during the tenure of the Third Kazekage, where he primarily worked as a messenger for Chiyo to her grandson Sasori, with whom he had a friendly relationship. During a border-patrol mission Komushi was wounded and subsequently lost an arm. This was later replaced by Sasori with that of a puppet as a prosthetic limb. Later he ingested some of Sasori's poison by mistake and died while Chiyo tried to save him. Because he knew Sasori

fields.en_description: Kona (コナ) is a young orphan in the Land of Silence. Kona is a young girl with purple hair tied in two ponytails. She wore a teal green patient outfit. Main article: Kara Actuation Arc Kona ended up infected with the cells of Hashirama Senju which left her in an unconscious state. She was found by Yubina, whose treatment could not cure her of the infection and had to slow the spread with fūinjutsu. It wasn't until the arrival of Mitsuki, whose unique body was able to resist the cells, that Yubina

Komitsu (コミツ) is the younger brother of Ōmitsu. Komitsu and Ōmitsu are the much younger brothers of Kodaka and Kiiro. After the deaths of their parents, Kodaka and Kiiro had to start taking freelance work from the hidden villages in order to support the family. This frequently kept them from Komitsu and Ōmitsu, who had to look after themselves. Kodaka would send them messages with his bees telling them how much he missed them. Kiiro eventually returned to Komitsu and Ōmitsu and told them that Ko

Konan (小南) was a kunoichi from Amegakure and a founding member of the original Akatsuki. After Yahiko's death, she was partnered with Nagato, who had since taken control of Akatsuki, and was the only member to call him by his name. After Nagato's death, Konan defected from Akatsuki and became the de facto village head of Amegakure. When she was young, Konan's family was killed during the Second Shinobi World War, and she was left to fend for herself. Some time later, Yahiko found her, and the tw

Konenmaru was one of Suien's summons in Naruto: Mission: Protect The Waterfall Village! (novel). Konenmaru was very loyal and obedient to Suien. Konenmaru had the appearance of a catfish with white markings and long spiny whiskers. Konenmaru had the ability to use Water Release to shoot torrents of water at enemies. Konenmaru could also use his whiskers to capture his opponents.

Kongō (コンゴウ) was a member of the Wandering Ninja Clan in the Land of the Moon. Kongō and his comrades were hired by Shabadaba to kill Kakeru Tsuki and his family in order for Shabadaba to take the throne of the kingdom. Typical of his brutish appearance, Kongō was violent and thuggish. He preferred to simply pound his opponents with sheer force rather than using strategy, and leered in a sadistic way when he approached Hikaru Tsuki with the intention of killing the child. However, he could be qu

Konashi Nerikiri (練切コナシ, Nerikiri Konashi) is an Academy student of Konohagakure. Konashi comes from a family of shinobi and wagashi artisans. Konashi is a dedicated, but shy, boy. Despite being willing to enter a sweets competition, he struggled with asking Kae her opinion on his sweets until the competition's deadline. He was unable to ask her directly, so he left her a note asking to meet her in private. Later, after witnessing Kawaki defeat a flame bear, he developed enough confidence to ask

This astronomer is a kunoichi of Konohagakure and the assistant of the Sixth Hokage. She has orange eyes with black pupils, blonde hair tied up in a big heart-shaped bun, and red-coloured glasses. She wears a long white shirt, with a light blue collar, a short black skirt, dark stockings and open-toed boots. Given her status as an astronomer, she is highly knowledgeable in stars and other heavenly bodies, like the moon. Being Kakashi's trusted assistant, she can also place a countdown clock on a

Konohamaru Sarutobi (猿飛木ノ葉丸, Sarutobi Konohamaru) is a shinobi of Konohagakure's Sarutobi clan. After later becoming a jōnin, he becomes the leader of his own genin team. He strives to one day become Hokage after his idol, Naruto Uzumaki. Konohamaru was born into the Sarutobi clan and was named after Konoha by his grandfather. While being raised by his Anbu parents, Konohamaru was never referred to by his name by the villagers, only ever called "Honourable Grandson" (お孫様, Omago-sama) because of

fields.en_description: Kontsuchi (紺ツチ) is a citizen of Iwagakure. Kontsuchi has light brown hair with a beard and grey pupiless eyes. He wears a red and white high-collared robe with a dark turtleneck long-sleeved shirt with a zipper underneath and long pants with shinobi sandals. His attire has a unique style such as a short left sleeve, a long right sleeve, and a long hem on the right side of his waist. He also wears black gloves. Main article: Mitsuki's Disappearance Arc Kontsuchi was present when the Fourth Tsuchi

Korega (コレガ) was the captain of the Land of the Moon's military. Korega had a really serious, mannered, and tough attitude. He was also very obedient, given that he remained loyal to Kakeru Tsuki, the former king, and his son and grandson, Michiru and Hikaru Tsuki, respectively. Furious at Kakeru's dethronement and demise, Korega attacked Shabadaba's henchmen with his team in a rage-filled desire for revenge despite everyone's superior power. Korega had a short crop of fuzzy black hair, thick bl

en_general_infos.Occupation: Captain of the land of the moon military

fields.en_description: Korobi (コロビ) is a shinobi from Sunagakure. He is shown to be cowardly and wimpy around Gaara, due to him formally being a murderous maniac. He later befriends Gaara, forming one of Gaara's very first friendships. He has small black eyes. He dons the standard attire of a Suna-nin, complete with a forehead protector, flak jacket, and a ghutrah. Like his partner Yaoki, Korobi specialises in the use of puppets. He carries a certain type of puppet which are able to spew out water. He was able to defe

Koshō (こしょう) is a genin of Konohagakure, forming a team with Satō and Shio. Main article: Ao Arc At the Training Hall, Koshō watched Boruto Uzumaki fight the Seventh Hokage alongside other genin. Koshō's name translates to "pepper", while her teammates' names translate to "sugar" and "salt", respectively. Koshō and her team are fanmade original characters that won the Boruto: Naruto Next Generations Chapter #11 Borukura original character contest, created by Haruharu of Ibaraki Prefecture. She a

Kosuke (小助) was an Anbu of Kirigakure. During the Third Shinobi World War, Kosuke was part of a team of hunter-nin sent after Rin Nohara. When Rin was killed by Kakashi Hatake, Obito Uchiha who had witnessed the killing and who had been in love with Rin responded by slaughtering Kosuke and his team in a fit of grief, with Kosuke being one of the first victims of Obito's rampage. Kosuke was a loyal shinobi from the Village of the Bloody Mist, willing to execute any mission for its sake. Kosuke wo

Kosuke Maruboshi (まるぼしコスケ, Maruboshi Kosuke) is a genin of Konohagakure and is reputed as the Eternal Genin (万年下忍, Mannen Genin) as well as Konoha's Strongest Genin (木ノ葉最強の下忍, Konoha Saikyō no Genin). When he was still a child, he made a reckless decision that cost him the lives of his teammates. Ashamed of this, he felt he was not worthy of being promoted beyond the rank of genin. Despite this, he continued to train arduously to improve his skills, something that was insisted upon him by Tobira

Kotohime (琴姫) is a member from the Fūma clan who sided with Orochimaru alongside Arashi, Jigumo, Kagerō, and Kamikiri when the clan fell on hard times. After the Fūma clan finished a war with a neighbouring country, they wandered the Land of Rice Fields hoping to settle down. Near the end of their journey, Orochimaru and Kimimaro appeared before the Fūma and told them that if they joined Otogakure that Orochimaru would help in restoring their power. Kotohime agreed and went with them. Orochimaru

Kotetsu Hagane (はがねコテツ, Hagane Kotetsu) is a chūnin from Konohagakure. In the anime, captaining a team of genin, the shinobi were tasked with retrieving Condor from the Zeroth Training Ground. Encountering the ostrich, he was beaten up multiple times, during which Izumo Kamizuki arrived to assist him, followed by the pair capturing Condor. Kotetsu is never seen without his partner and best friend Izumo, whom he trusts explicitly in and out of combat. He is characterised as being the more carefre

fields.en_description: Koyuki Kazahana (風花小雪, Kazahana Koyuki) is a famous movie actress, primarily known for portraying Princess Gale (風雲姫, Fūun-hime). She is the only child of Sōsetsu Kazahana, the former daimyō of the Land of Snow. As an actress, she is known under the stage name Yukie Fujikaze (富士風雪絵, Fujikaze Yukie). As a child, her father would tell her about "spring", a season that did not exist in the perpetual-wintered Land of Snow. She would happily await her father's project in bringing spring to the land,

fields.en_description: Kozuchi (コヅチ) was a citizen of Iwagakure. Kozuchi lived with his grandfather following the elderly man's retirement. Later, he died while fighting a group of missing-nin who were stealing the secrets of Iwagakure. From what little was seen of him, Kozuchi was shown to be a very happy and energetic boy. He was noted by Ōnoki to be very smart. He was very close to his grandfather and likewise committed to his village. He dreamed of becoming Tsuchikage one day and to which, embodied Iwagakure's bel

Kuen (クエン) was a former shrine maiden who sealed Sōma four-hundred years ago. Four-hundred years ago, Kuen confronted Sōma, an evil spirit that steals memories. She managed to seal the demon inside of her body. However, with the rapidly draining memories in her, Kuen failed to slice off both emerging horns to complete the seal. Instead, it was sealed in a nearby rock with a portion of it staying within Kuen. Sōma's curse left Kuen forever purged of her memories, leading her to step down as the s

Kujaku (孔雀) was a kunoichi from the Takumi Village and the only female member of the Four Celestial Symbols Men. Kujaku was very arrogant and would regularly laugh at her enemies. Kujaku was a fairly slender kunoichi who had fair skin, blue-green cyan hair that had two light yellow striped bangs in the front of her hair, and thin blue-green cyan eyebrows. Light brown pupil-less eye irises, had light red lipstick on her lips, worn a light grey jacket that had a long white furry tuft around her ne

The Kuma Panda is a panda frequently seen around the Land of Fire. Main article: Versus Momoshiki Arc The Kuma Panda was wreaking havoc around a small village's crop field and Team 7 was assigned to subdue the bear. Konohamaru Sarutobi restrains the bear using the Shinobi Gauntlet. Main article: Chūnin Re-Examination Arc In the anime, at the Forest of Death during the Chūnin Exams, Boruto Uzumaki retrieved the chūnin in need of help in order to pass the test. He was confronted by Kaito Kawanami

Kumade Toriichi (酉市クマデ, Toriichi Kumade) was a tokubetsu jōnin of Konohagakure. Not much is known about Kumade's life. The anime revealed that he entered the Academy at the same time as Kakashi Hatake and others. At some point in time, Kumade clashed with Zabuza Momochi of Kirigakure. He was however killed by the latter with a combination of the Hiding in Mist Technique and Silent Killing. Kumade had a short, spiky grey hair. He wore the standard attire of the Konoha-nin complete with a forehead

Kumadori (クマドリ) is a medical-nin of Konohagakure and Shizune's junior. He is also a member of the village's Analysis Team in the Intelligence Division. Kumadori wears a white medical uniform. He has a short crop of brown hair and black eyes. Being placed in a team alongside Shizune and Oyone to analyse the captured body of Pain's Animal Path proves that Kumadori must have a great knowledge about medical ninjutsu. As a medical-nin, Kumadori must also have an excellent chakra control as well. Main

Kurama (九喇嘛), more commonly known as the Nine-Tails (九尾, Kyūbi), was one of the nine tailed beasts. Centuries of being regarded as a mindless monster and sought after as a tool for war caused Kurama to hate humans. After being sealed into Naruto Uzumaki, Kurama attempts to maintain its cynical perspective about the world, but with Naruto's insistence on treating it with respect, the fox overturns its hatred and willingly strives to use its power for the world's salvation. Kurama and the tailed b

fields.en_description: Kunugi Mokume (木目クヌギ, Mokume Kunugi) is a jōnin of Konohagakure. During the Second Shinobi World War, he was assigned to a team with Tsunade, Dan Katō and another unnamed shinobi. After Dan was gravely injured, Kunugi watched on as Tsunade tried to save his life but realising that, with so many of his vital organs directly injured, and even with Tsunade's aid, there was little to no hope of doing so. He later tells Tsunade to stop with the medical treatment as Dan had already passed away and res

Kunihisa (クニヒサ) is the spoiled son of rich jeweller Kunijirō. At first Kunihisa was a very spoiled and selfish child that would do nothing without his money to help him. He wishes to become a shinobi and has made up fake-techniques. He doesn't view himself as a child. Later on, Naruto taught him how to overcome his selfishness. Kunihisa now has a better attitude towards life and even thanked Naruto for helping him. Kunihisa has short green hair kept in a bowl-cut style and light-coloured eyes. H

Kunijirō (クニジロウ) is a rich jeweller who started off poor and is an old acquaintance of Tsunade. Kunijirō started from nothing but later became rich from selling rare gems. At some point he became acquainted with Tsunade and they became friends. Kunijirō is a tan-skinned man with short greyish-blue hair, which slightly curls at the end. He also bears black-coloured eyes, a beauty mark, which is located on the left side of his face, and pink stud earrings. His mouth is also noticeably large. When

Kura Kageno (影野クラ, Kageno Kura) is an Academy student of Konohagakure. Kura is a modest girl, who in most cases stands aside, or, being in the company, silently watches what is happening. However, she is no stranger to the interest, and listens to gossip about her classmates with pleasure. She also enjoys horror movies, readily volunteering to join in investigating the spooky Seven Mysteries of the Academy, but still, even after passing part of the tests, she eventually chickened out and ran awa

Kurobane (クロバネ) is an Anbu from the Land of Calm Seas. Kurobane and his brother became elite assassins for the Land of Calm Seas' daimyō. They would regularly be sent to silence people who defied the daimyō, torturing them to confess to crimes they didn't commit so they could be publicly executed. Kurobane is shown to be a very cold-hearted and sadistic man, relishing in the chance to make his targets suffer and scream. He has no loyalty for fellow countrymen, killing students under his employer

fields.en_description: Kurobachi (クロバチ) was a shinobi from Iwagakure's Kamizuru clan. The Kamizuru clan fell from grace due to conflict with the Aburame clan of Konohagakure in the past. Like the Aburame clan, the Kamizuru focused on the utilisation of bugs in their techniques. They sought the legendary bikōchū in the hopes it would help in the revitalisation of their clan. Kurobachi's grandfather, the First Tsuchikage, then hid away his forbidden secrets so they couldn't be used against the clan. Kurobachi, like his

Kurenai Sarutobi (猿飛紅, Sarutobi Kurenai, née Yūhi (夕日)) is a member of Konohagakure's Sarutobi clan. During her time as an active duty kunoichi, she served as the jōnin-leader of Team 8. As a child, Kurenai met Asuma Sarutobi during the Academy entrance ceremony where the two quickly became friends. She graduated at age 9. In the anime, during the Chūnin Exams, Kurenai was placed in a team with Asuma and Raidō Namiashi. She later was cheering for her classmates during the third round of the Chūn

Kuroma Tatsushiro (龍代クロマ, Tatsushiro Kuroma) is the antagonist that appears in Naruto Shippūden: Dragon Blade Chronicles. He is a young man with grey hair and green markings on his face. Like Akari, his younger sister, he has red eyes and small horns on his head, signifying a connection with the Genryū, the five dragons that he awakens in the hopes of absorbing their power. He has numerous tags on his robe that allow him to use elemental attacks, and a large scroll strapped to his back with a ca

Kuromaru (黒丸) is a ninken from Konohagakure's Inuzuka clan and Tsume Inuzuka's partner. Kuromaru is an adult canine with a wolfish appearance. As his name suggests, he has black fur with a white underside. He most closely resembles a Northern Rocky Mountain Wolf. He is missing his left ear, and wears an eyepatch over his right eye. He appears to have grown much larger in Part II than when he was seen in his brief Part I appearance. As an Inuzuka ninken, Kuromaru uses collaborative attacks alongs

Kurotsuchi (黒ツチ) is a kunoichi of Iwagakure, the granddaughter of the Third Tsuchikage, and a descendant of the First Tsuchikage. After her grandfather's retirement, she would later follow their endowment by taking on the mantle as the Fourth Tsuchikage (四代目土影, Yondaime Tsuchikage, literally meaning: Fourth Earth Shadow). In the anime, after becoming a ninja, a young Kurotsuchi witnessed Deidara flee from Iwagakure, shortly after bombing surrounding buildings. At the time, Deidara had already be

Kusabi (クサビ) is one of the many mercenaries hired by Gatō. Kusabi seemed to be very violent and belligerent by nature as seen from his shouting of death threats to Team Kakashi and declaring that he was going to pillage the Land of Waves. He is also very cowardly when a challenge is given. Kusabi had brown hair which was tied in four and had decals hanging from it. He had a red cloth wrapped around his pure white eyes with holes in it for seeing. He carried a long, pole-like weapon which had a r

Kurozuka (クロヅカ) was an Anbu and one of the last remaining members of the Land of Woods' Prajñā Group. Kurozuka was loyal to his comrades, fearlessly attacking high-ranking shinobi as an act of revenge. In the anime, he also refused to answer any questions from Danzō Shimura, ordering him to kill him instead. Kurozuka had short brown hair and wore the standard attire of the shinobi from his country: a high-collared flak jacket and a white demon-like mask with three prominent horns and an open mou

Kushimaru Kuriarare (栗霰串丸, Kuriarare Kushimaru) was a Kirigakure jōnin and a member of the Seven Ninja Swordsmen of the Mist. In the anime, Kushimaru committed many acts of cruelty in his lifetime, including killing his sensei. At some point in time, Kushimaru encountered the young Might Guy, Ebisu and Genma Shiranui on a mission alongside the other members of the Seven Ninja Swordsmen of the Mist. The young shinobi managed to flee, however, due to the timely arrival of Might Duy, who sacrificed

Born into the famed Uzumaki clan of Uzushiogakure, Kushina lived most of her youth being caught up in war, making her seek for daily peace. Kusuna was very overconfident and was also very sadistic trying to torture and cut up his targets. Kusuna plays the "big brother" part among Yomi's underlings and is a leadership-type. He was also shown to be heartless as seen when his team-mate Gitai was killed and Kusuna just scolded him for dying. He has been described as being both intelligent and shadowy. fields.en_description: Kussaku (クッサク) was a shinobi from Kirigakure and part of the Allied Shinobi Forces' Sensor Division. Due to being trusted for the first time during the Fourth Shinobi World War, Kussaku became timid. Kussaku had long black hair and his bangs hung over his blue Allied Shinobi Forces' forehead protector. He wore the typical Kirigakure attire inclusive of flak jacket. Kussaku using Water Release was able to erect an immense Sensing Barrier along with others' assistance, which allowed him to monitor

Kusushi (クスシ) is a medical-nin from Konohagakure. He wears the standard high collared, full body uniform of the Konoha medical ninja and a pair of light-coloured glasses. He also has black eyes. As a medical-nin, Kusushi presumably has a high level of intellect, is well-versed in medical ninjutsu, and has excellent chakra control to perform medical procedures, such as the Mystical Palm Technique in the anime. He, along with a team of medical ninja are sent as medical support to the Sasuke Recove

Kusuma (クスマ) is a citizen of the Land of Fire and sells masks in Tanzaku Quarters. He loves festivals and children, particularly his own three. Kusuma has trimmed, short, grey hair and black eyes. In the manga, he wore a white suit of clothing along with a wide obi and a rope tied around his head. In the anime, he was shirtless and had a towel around his neck. Many of the masks he sells resemble Anbu masks or characters from other anime and manga series.

Kusune (クスネ) was a ninja who possessed Iō's ninja tool, Tsurukame. Kusune is one to underestimate his opponents based on their appearance, but at the same time recognised Naruto Uzumaki and Neji Hyūga as excellent fighters at close range, realising that it was necessary to keep a distance with them. He is also very self-confident and eager to acquire powerful new weapons. Kusune is dismissive of Konohagakure, claiming that after Orochimaru's attack, the country had become weak due to which he an

Kuwa Yokohori (横堀クワ, Yokohori Kuwa) is a citizen of Konohagakure. Main article: Academy Entrance Arc Upon enrolling into the Academy, Kuwa was placed in Shino Aburame's homeroom. Main article: School Trip Arc Kuwa and his class went to Kirigakure for a field trip, where they were greeted by their tour guide, Kagura Karatachi. Main article: Graduation Exams Arc When Shino's class had the opportunity to become shinobi, Kuwa chose not to participate in the Genin Exams.

Kyohō Fuefuki (笛吹巨峰, Fuefuki Kyohō) is a shinobi from Kirigakure. When he was younger, Kyohō was a victim of the Funato clan's pillaging, who had burned down his village. The bloodshed had left a lasting impact on Kyohō that had not only physically scarred him, but mentally as well. Due to his traumatic past, Kyohō is a very withdrawn man with deadpan demeanour to himself, rarely speaking more than a few words, always in a stunted manner and hiding his scars from people. Kyōya (キョウヤ) is an accountant of Kakuzu, a member of the Akatsuki. Kyōya seems to be a very obedient person and always listens to what his boss says. He has short, spiky light-brown hair and dark eyes. A scar runs across his forehead and another runs downwards to his cheek. He wears a simple green suit along with a pair of shoes. Kyodaigumo (巨大蜘蛛, literally meaning: Giant Spider) is a giant spider, and the personal summon of Kidōmaru. Kyodaigumo is a gigantic black spider with orange stripes going down the back of her abdomen. She greatly resembles a tarantula. Once summoned, Kyodaigumo can quickly release an egg sac full of baby spiders roughly the size of a small dog. Kyūroku Wagarashi (ワガラシ九六, Wagarashi Kyūroku) is the head of the Wagarashi family in the Land of Tea, which is a clan warring with the nearby Wasabi family. He is a very dishonest and manipulative man. He has short black hair, and small dark eyes with a small wart over the left. He also has a black moustache. Kyūsuke (鳩助) was once a shinobi from Amegakure and one of the original founding Akatsuki members. In the anime, Kyūsuke at some point left Amegakure, having grown tired of Hanzō's rule. He and his comrades began stealing from villages to survive. One day, they came to the village that was protected by a newly-formed and small group called Akatsuki. He is the former daimyō of the Land of Lightning. He is a dark-skinned man with a beard and silver framed glasses. He wears a loose fitting kimono and dark coloured cloak over it along with what seems to be the customary head-gear of the daimyō of the five great nations. Leh (レー, Rē) is a messenger hawk who delivers letters to and from the Land of Redaku's royal family. Lando (ランド, Rando) is a young citizen of the Tonika Village. Lando was a child in Tonika Village before it was attacked. During its destruction, he was rescued by Dokku along with two others before leaving their home and meeting up with Leo and Miina along the way to Hachō Village. Lando appears to be a more or less average boy with some knowledge of fishing. Lyla (ライラ, Raira) is a citizen of the Land of Redaku. This lion-turtle was the personal summon of Ni who appears in Naruto Shippūden the Movie: The Will of Fire. The Lion-Turtle was a very large beast, and had the combined appearances of both a lion and a turtle. Covering its face, was a green mane of fur as well as an orange protective plate with two piercings on the sides. Its body had many distinctive red markings covering its outer shell. Lily Himeno (姫野リリ, Himeono Riri) is a popular idol of the Land of Fire. Lily is described as having lovely facial features and blonde shoulder length hair that's styled in loose waves. She wears white boots and a mini-dress with ribbons and frills sewed onto it. Despite not being formally trained as a kunoichi, Lily was taught to harness her innate talent for Lightning Release. Having trained constantly for five years, since her youth, she has the ability to generate powerful electric currents.

Log (ログ, Rogu) is a synthetic human created by Orochimaru and the older clone brother of Mitsuki. Log was created as a synthetic human by Orochimaru, being cultivated from an embryo and given the name Mitsuki (ミツキ), after "Tsuki" (杯, literally meaning: Vessel) and the sixth sign of the Chinese zodiac calendar, "Mi" (巳, literally meaning: Snake). Madara Uchiha (うちはマダラ, Uchiha Madara) was the legendary leader of the Uchiha clan. He founded Konohagakure alongside his childhood friend and rival, Hashirama Senju, with the intention of bringing about an era of peace. When the two couldn't agree on how to achieve that peace, they fought for control of the village, a conflict which ended in Madara's death. She cares deeply about her family and tries to help them. Mai has oddly shaped chin-length brown hair and light blue eyes. She has a dot on the middle of her forehead. Makaro Akimichi (秋道マカロ, Akimichi Makaro) is a chūnin of Konohagakure's Akimichi clan. Makaro holds a great deal of respect for his village's Hokage. Malice (マリス, Marisu) was a kunoichi and the main antagonist that appeared in Naruto Shippūden 3D: The New Era. Malice was the most skilled kunoichi of the Rinha clan when her clan was around. Manari (マナリ) is the daughter of the Land of Redaku's previous king. After her father's death, Manari's younger brother, Nanara, was the first choice to replace him as King of Redaku. Nanara did not want the job and pressured Manari to become Queen in his place. She did so without complaint. Afterwards, the Prime Minister and his allies convinced Manari to send Nanara to Nagare Village, arguing that Nanara was too young to grow up in the palace; Manari agreed. Maroi is one of the Kumogakure shinobi with names that match their personality. He is in fact a calm, jovial and level-headed individual that sometimes came off as being entirely carefree. Maruta (マルタ) is a hawk trainer that lives in the mountains. He is also the caretaker to the famous Senri Hawk. Maruta established himself in the mountains, raising and teaching the hawks there. Over the years, many individuals, including powerful ninja, came seeking a Senri Hawk of their own, but few were ever able to earn any of the hawks' acknowledgment and failed to earn one. Masako (マサコ) is a citizen of Rōran. Along with many women and children in Rōran, her husband was kidnapped by Mukade to work to assemble his puppet army. While much is not known of his personality, Mawashi is renowned as the "Demon Sergeant of the Analysis Team" because of his hard leadership style. Mawashi is a bespectacled man with short cropped brown hair. He was designed — based on the Demonic Statue of the Outer Path — as a means to capture Kurama and interfere with the plans of Akatsuki. After the dreadful reign of Yagura Karatachi ended, she became Mizukage and worked tirelessly to reform internal policies and recreate diplomatic relations with other villages. He died while he was still a juvenile. After his death, the wetlands common throughout Redaku preserved his remains, eventually becoming fossils. Duy spent his entire career as a genin, causing many to look down upon him and earned him the epithet of the "Eternal Genin" (万年下忍, Mannen Genin). Despite his new-found hatred towards Iruka, Mizuki pretended to be his friend in order to be noticed and to discreetly keep Iruka miserable. Mizugoke has good chakra control. Mizugoke had snuck into Konoha and stolen important documents. He encountered Neji and Naruto when they defeated his brother. fields.en_description: Natsu Hyūga (日向ナツ, Hyūga Natsu) is a kunoichi of Konohagakure's Hyūga clan. Natsu was a maid of the Hyūga clan, and was the caretaker of Hanabi Hyūga. One day when Hanabi wanted to play with her sister, Natsu reminded her that Hinata was busy with her training. The next morning when they were taking a walk through the village, they witnessed Naruto Uzumaki being scolded by a villager. As Hanabi wondered why Naruto was treated as an outcast, Natsu told her to shun him. Later, she watched over Han

Natsu (ナツ) is a shinobi from Iwagakure. Natsu is seemingly a proud person, being very concerned with proving his abilities and not being humiliated by faring poorly in the war. In extension to this he also have a tendency to argue over whom deserves the credit for killing an opponent. Natsu has dark spiky brown hair, and he sports the standard Iwagakure flak jacket along with the maroon-coloured forehead protector which has the insignia of the Allied Shinobi Forces. During the Fourth Shinobi Wor

Natori (ナトリ) is a chūnin of Konohagakure that works in the Konoha Aviary. Natori's most notable feature are the lines around his eyes that are turned up at the ends. He has short brown hair and wears his forehead protector like a bandanna along with the standard Konoha shinobi outfit, minus the flak jacket. He also tends to wear a thick set of bandages around his left arm for birds to perch on without damaging his arm. It is said that his speed and accuracy are outstanding compared to the rest o

Natsuhi (ナツヒ) was a jōnin of Hoshigakure. Both she and her husband had completed the star training. Years ago, both Hotarubi and Natsuhi completed the star training of their village. After seeing the side effects of the training they stole the star to prevent further damage. However, they were caught by the Third Hoshikage who 'banished' them to keep an eye on the village after promising to stop the star training. Natsuhi and Hotarubi begged the Third Hoshikage to tell their young son Sumaru tha

Nattō Itohiki (糸引ナットウ, Itohiki Nattō) is a young citizen of Konohagakure. He wants to become a shinobi, which he also explains his pranks. He has large brown hair tied at the top of his head, freckles and green eyes. Main article: Kara Actuation Arc In the hospital for incoming surgery, Nattō spent his time pulling pranks on the staff. While visiting Boruto Uzumaki, Team 5, specifically Iwabee Yuino, was pranked by Nattō. Nattō was caught by the genin and returned to his room. He claimed his pra

Neji Hyūga (日向ネジ, Hyūga Neji) was a shinobi of Konohagakure's Hyūga clan. Though a prodigy even by the Hyūga's standards, Neji was a member of the clan's branch house; no matter how skilled he became, he would always be in service to the Hyūga's main house, a fact that convinced him fate was predetermined. After experiencing Naruto Uzumaki's refusal to be limited by such an ideology, Neji realised his fate was what he chose it to be, and as a member of Team Guy he sought the strength necessary t

en_general_infos.Team: Team guy sasuke recovery team konoha 11 (anime only) star guard team (anime only) second division

fields.en_description: Nauma (ナウマ) was once a member of the Twelve Guardian Ninja. While he was still alive, he was part of the Twelve Guardian Ninja. When six of the members tried a coup d'etat, he alongside Asuma Sarutobi, Chiriku, Kitane, Tōu, and Seito fought against them, only to be killed by Kazuma when Nauma and the latter three of the Twelve Guardian Ninja tried to use Limelight on him. Nauma had short, light brown hair. He also had a scar on the right side of his forehead and another two scars, one on each lo

Nawaki (縄樹) was a genin from Konohagakure's Senju clan. He was the younger brother of Tsunade and the grandson of Hashirama and Mito. He was also the grandnephew of Tobirama. He shared his dream of becoming Hokage with his sister on his twelfth birthday, who gave him their grandfather's necklace in the hopes that it would help him achieve his dream. The day after his birthday, Nawaki died in battle after running into an explosive trap. When Tsunade rushed to him, Orochimaru noted that his body w

Nazuna (ナズナ) is the granddaughter of the village head Hinoki from Naruto: Path of the Ninja 2. Nazuna has a waist-length, greyish-blonde hair. Her bangs hang just above her grey eyes. She wears a black onmyōji–like kimono with a lower red-body garment, red hat and red traditional Japanese wooden sandals. She keeps a purse on her right hip. Naruto describes her as being almost as cute as Sakura Haruno. "Nazuna" (ナズナ) can mean "Shepherd's-purse".

en_general_infos.Affiliation: Valley of great evil"valley of great evil" is not in the list (allied shinobi forces, akatsuki, root, kara, pale blue valley, daidai village, aburame clan, academy, advanced technology research institute, akagahara, ...) of allowed values for the "affiliation" property.

fields.en_description: Nejiri (ネジリ) is a genin of Sunagakure. Nejiri was worried as to how many teams will actually pass the exams. He has black hair and wore a long-sleeved shirt with a big collar and a pair of dark-coloured pants along with his village's forehead protector. He also has black eyes. He sits next to Sakura during the first phase of the Chūnin Exams. He asks Ibiki how many teams will be allowed to pass, but withdraws his question when he realises the answer won't do him any good. "Nejiri" (捩じり) means "t

Nekobaa (猫バア, English TV: Granny Cat, literally meaning: Grandma Cat) is an old woman who lives in an abandoned city together with her granddaughter, Tamaki. She runs a supplies shop that the Uchiha clan used to use. She lives with lots of cats, including talking ones such as Denka and Hina. In the anime, Itachi Uchiha would usually visit Nekobaa for errands he had to run with a young Sasuke Uchiha tagging along with him every time. Sasuke would get bored and throw tantrums so Itachi made a game

Nemui (ネムイ) is a genin of Kumogakure. During the finals of the Chūnin Exams, Nemui was pitted against Itachi Uchiha in the semi-final round. His fighting style gave Itachi trouble, as it allowed him to dodge his attacks and made genjutsu ineffective. Eventually, Itachi found an opening in which to cast genjutsu on Nemui. After using genjutsu during each opening, Nemui becomes too traumatised to continue the match, granting Itachi a victory. True to his personality and nickname, he is presumed to

Nekomata (猫又) is a giant cat and the boss of the ninneko underworld. During Sasuke Uchiha's childhood, Itachi Uchiha made a game of collecting paw prints of quick, nimble cats from a normal cat to a lion and the last paw print to be collected was Nekomata's. Itachi once defeated Nekomata and his ninja cats and requested him to fight Sasuke with all his might when he got older. Years later, Team 7 was assigned to get Nekomata's paw print and infiltrated his fortress. The team was split up during

Neon Asakusa (浅草ネオン, Asakusa Neon) is an Academy student from Konohagakure. Her parents are executive members of the Kaminarimon Company. From a young age, Neon would regularly play with Osuka Kamakura as their mothers were longtime friends. When Osuka's parents started getting too busy with various movies to spend enough time with their daughter, Neon was asked to help look after her and keep her company. Neon is a soft-spoken and timid young girl. Insecure by nature, she easily lets herself ge

She is the mother of Neon Asakusa, and an executive member of the Kaminarimon Company. Neon's mother has been friends with Hibari Kamakura for a long time, and their daughters grew up together as childhood friends. While not much is known about her, Neon's mother is a kindhearted individual, offering to walk Osuka home as she was aware of Hibari's busy schedule. When she learned of Osuka's kidnapping, Neon's mother and Hibari worked together tirelessly to develop a drone with a sensory ability t

Nerugui is a ferret appearing in Naruto the Movie: Legend of the Stone of Gelel. Nerugui is a long-time companion of Kahiko and his clan. He apparently does not take to people unless they are from the clan being especially connected to the royal bloodline. Nerugui got visibly mad when Naruto was making fun of him for falling for their trap. He then attacked Naruto for this. Kahiko has described him as being shy and also said that he never attacks people contrary to what he did to Naruto. Nerugui

Ni (弐) was an antagonist that appeared in Naruto Shippūden the Movie: The Will of Fire. She was a kunoichi and one of Hiruko's three followers, along with Ichi and San. She, like her teammates, was very overconfident in her abilities. She would mock her opponents during battle and would even talk down to her dog-like summonings. Like her comrades, she would not hesitate in using the Chimera Technique to merge with others, even if it meant distorting her own body. She had two purple rectangular m

Ni summons two dog-like creatures that appears in Naruto Shippūden the Movie: The Will of Fire. They both possess two spear-like weapons on their backs that they can launch out to attack the enemy. These spear-like weapons move extremely fast and are durable enough to withstand one of Kakashi's Lightning Cutters head on without any apparent damage. They first appear attacking Naruto Uzumaki when he tries to save Sai. Both were attacked by Shino Aburame's kikaichū, devouring the chakra from them.

A monstrous clone of Naruto Uzumaki created by Kabuto Yakushi's specially-developed snakes with chakra from Kurama mixed into its being. The clone first appeared to be very animalistic and violent, much like Naruto was upon entering his Version 2 form. The clone seemingly possessed a distinct interest in Naruto, instinctively siphoning Kurama's chakra from him before going on a rampage and readily attempting to kill him upon locating him some time later. It also showed the capability to speak, s

Nezumi Kaitō (怪盗ネズミ, Kaitō Nezumi) is a jewel thief. Nezumi is a very greedy and cunning person, ready for any meanness for the sake of profit. He is able to put on a show of an offended person who the police have arrested for no reason, insulting their actions. Nezumi is cruel and willing to rip open a kitten's belly without hesitation to get the jewels. Nezumi is a rather tall, thin man with a narrow, rat-like face, befitting his name. He has small grey eyes, short, dishevelled grey hair, prot

Ningame (忍亀, literally meaning: Ninja Tortoise) is Might Guy's personal summon. In the anime, Ningame was summoned by Guy to enter into a contract with his other student Tenten, but she offended Ningame, and he refused to enter into a contract with her. Ningame is often-time a very stern and serious tortoise seen from his scolding of Lee when the latter tried to use the Front Lotus on Sasuke. Like his summoner Might Guy, Ningame is also easily moved to tears; this is shown when Lee hugged Guy an

fields.en_description: Nigai (ニガイ) was a Kumogakure shinobi. While on a covert mission to steal a kinjutsu from the Sugi Village, he, A, and Karai were set upon by the mercenary Nokizaru Group who had been hired to retrieve the scroll. Though initially telling his comrades to ignore the taunts of the group, he falls prey to it when they chide the Raikage for running away. Turning to face his opponents he uses a technique and immediately swelled to giant proportions and then exploded. Nigai was a cautious and level-hea

Nishi is a shinobi of Konohagakure. Nishi is a committed shinobi who highly respects the Hokage, and will carry out missions without complaint. While deeply committed, his focus on the task at hand makes him susceptible to simple, but unorthodox deception. He is confident in his sensing abilities. Nishi is a man of average height with a round face in the manga, but chiselled cheekbones in the anime. He has gray eyes, a small beard with a moustache on his face, and combed ashy hair. Nishi dresses

Nishi (西) is a villager from Konohagakure who worked at the Ramen Ichiraku. Nishi, using the name Nishikawa, once worked for the circus now owned by Michiru Tsuki in the Land of the Moon alongside Matsu. He and Matsu later moved to Konohagakure. Nishi has short black, spiky, hair and black eyes. He has a small rope-like piece wrapped around his forehead acting as a headband. He wears a white chefs uniform that is the same as Matsu's. Nishi has been described as not being very smart and he is als

fields.en_description: Nobori (ノボリ) is a former academy student of Konohagakure. Nobori cares deeply about his friends and wants to always protect them. Nobori has short light brown hair and black-coloured eyes. He wore an orange shirt under a brownish-coloured jacket, a pair of blue pants and sandals. He wears a black belt with a silver-coloured belt buckle. His brownish-coloured jacket is held closed by twelve intertwined black strings in the front. The black strings hold the jacket closed in an "X" style. He was on
Noji was a villager of Takigakure. He was killed in a landslide caused by Team Suien. Noji was incredibly loyal to his village, giving his life to protect it. Noji was described as a small man.

Nitora Take (武にとら, Take Nitora) is an academy student of Konohagakure. Main article: Academy Entrance Arc On the day of the entrance ceremony, as everyone began looking for an absent Boruto Uzumaki, he suddenly appeared, crashing a train into the Hokage Monument, which left Nitora amazed at his antics. Later, her class was assigned from Shino to shadow a non-shinobi workplace to better understand its lifestyle. Main article: School Trip Arc Nitora and her class went to Kirigakure for a field tri

Nonō Yakushi (薬師ノノウ, Yakushi Nonō), renowned as The Wandering Miko (歩きの巫女, Aruki no Miko, Viz: The Wandering Nun), was an Anbu from Konohagakure's Root division. She left the organisation and became a jōnin in the regular forces, a captain of the Medic Corps, and a caretaker at the village's orphanage. At the orphanage she became known as "Mother" (マザー, Mazā). While undercover in Iwagakure, she went by the name "Nanigashi" (ナニガシ, Nanigashi). Nonō was a member of Konoha's Anbu sub-division Root.

fields.en_description: Nonota (ノノタ) is a Sunagakure shinobi. Nonota is rather prone to panicking, getting visibly distressed as Musai described the nature of Toroi's techniques after being magnetised. Nonota's most noticeable feature were the green markings on his cheeks that ended with two spikes pointing towards his face. He wore the standard attire of the Suna shinobi complete with the ghutrah and the black forehead protector of the Alliance. Like many Sunagakure shinobi, Nonota is capable of using the Cloth Bindin

Nue (鵺) is a yōkai that was created by Root. It is the result of Project Gozu Tennō, designed to be the ultimate weapon harvested from Hashirama Senju's cells. While spearheaded by Tanuki Shigaraki, it was passed on to his daughter Sumire Shigaraki with the intention to wreak havoc in Konohagakure. As Danzō continued his amoral methods to protect Konohagakure, upon realising the potential power within the First Hokage's very cells, he harvested some of them. Placing Tanuki Shigaraki, one of his

Nowaki (ノワキ) was once the leader of the Lightning Group. At the time, he went by the name Fūshin (風心, Fūshin). Fūshin was born on a poverty-stricken island in the Land of Water. As a child, he was ostracised for his kekkei genkai and was blamed for being responsible for a typhoon that destroyed his village. He was sold to a businessman named Kusabi, and endured torture and starvation by his owner. At the Coliseum, he fought against Chino but was defeated when he fell victim to her Ketsuryūgan ge

fields.en_description: Nurari (濡羅吏) was a shinobi from Otogakure and a member of Team Guren. Nurari, like some of his teammates, wanted nothing to do with Orochimaru and wished to flee. He enjoyed toying with his foes and constantly mocked them. He was also shown to be rather feminine through his voice and appearance, particularly his lipstick and eyelashes. Despite his slender and somewhat feminine appearance, he was male. He wore a full-body slime suit, leaving only his face uncovered. He wore dark green lipstick, h

Nurui (ヌルイ) is a shinobi of Kumogakure. Noting that he was a cautious individual, Nurui's actions come off more as those of a coward's. Not one to play hero, he planned an escape for his team, even laying obvious traps as they went so that it would appear as though they had put up a fight. However, he is loyal to his comrades and while not a coward, does not believe that persons should risk their lives unnecessarily. Nurui is of tall stature and has shoulder-length brown hair and green eyes. He

She was a member of Konohagakure's Uchiha clan. With both of her grandson's parents dead, she became Obito's guardian. On the day of the Youth Ninja Competition, she answered her apartment door when Rin Nohara arrived, and teased Obito about having a great-grandchild. Later that night at dinner, Obito asked her which of his parents he took after. She responded that he takes after both of them and that he must honour them and work for the sake of others. She presumably died either before, or duri

Ohagi (オハギ) is a dango chef in Konohagakure. A citizen of the old town in Konohagakure, Ohagi had a longtime friendship with new city resident Taruto, who took part in the old town's festival fireworks display, going on trips with them. As they were also both chefs, they developed a dango shortcake, which drew from their areas of expertise. When the new city decided to put on their own fireworks display, they put Taruto in charge of it, creating a rift between Ohagi and Taruto. When Ohagi and ot

Okami (女将) is a hostess who works at an inn in the Land of Fire. Okami has a large afro of black hair and she wears thin circular white-coloured glasses and a navy blue kimono. When Team 7 visited her inn to relax in the hot springs, secretly in order to see Kakashi's face, Aniki tried to take revenge on Kakashi and disguised himself as Okami. Okami was seen alongside a disguised Moya Triad welcoming Temari and Shikamaru Nara, who were looking for a gift for Hinata Hyūga's and Naruto Uzumaki's w

Oboro (朧) is a genin from Amegakure. Oboro has spiky brown hair and dark eyes. He wears the same yellow jumpsuit as his teammates which was stitched up the middle along with a pair of sandals. He also wears a forehead protector that covers his whole head, a rebreather and a sash around his face with eyeholes cut out. In the anime, he was seen in a long-sleeved light-purple kimono shirt and pants with a pair of sandals. He is described as vindictive, and impatient. This was shown when he showed j

Obito Uchiha (うちはオビト, Uchiha Obito) was a member of Konohagakure's Uchiha clan. He was believed to have died during the Third Shinobi World War, his only surviving legacy being the Sharingan he gave to his teammate, Kakashi Hatake. In truth, Obito was saved from death and trained by Madara, but the events of the war left Obito disillusioned with reality, and he inherited Madara's plan to create an ideal world. Resurfacing under the names of Tobi (トビ, Tobi) and Madara Uchiha himself, Obito subtly

fields.en_description: Okisuke (オキスケ) is a samurai from the Land of Iron and one of Mifune's right-hand-men alongside Urakaku. Okisuke is a very solemn, and dutiful individual who will carry out his assigned tasks to the letter without hesitation. In the anime, he voiced distaste in teaming up with shinobi, believing that they were using the samurai as mere tools for the safety of the whole world. It was not until Mifune explained everything to him, telling them that they would be working alongside each other as equal

fields.en_description: Onbu (オンブ) was an infant onbaa that was taken from its nest by a hawk, dropped onto Naruto's back, and thought he was its mother. Onbu is a ball-shaped creature covered in light brown fur. Only its ears and face were not completely covered. It had a tuft of fur coming from the top of its face covering its forehead. Onbu also had strands of hair sprouting from its face. When a hawk came across Naruto Uzumaki, it became frightened and dropped the onbaa. It clung to Naruto's back for safety, mistak

Oko (オコ) is a member of the Byakuya Gang. After Gekkō brought Ryōgi into their organisation, Oko justified the goods they stole to the child. Oko is a fair-skinned man with shoulder-length dark red hair and brown eyes. He wears a Byakuya Gang attire and an owl mask. As a member of an internationally-known thieving group, Oko is very stealthy on his missions. He is relatively skilled at taijutsu, being able to fend off Boruto Uzumaki in a short clash. He is also proficient in Fire Release, able t

Omoi (オモイ) is a shinobi from Kumogakure that serves as a close aid for the Fifth Raikage. Omoi is a very cautious person and likes to think things through before acting, and as a result, gets lost in his thoughts quite often. He is more level-headed than his teammate Karui, but often demonstrates a wild imagination and has a habit of exaggerating the end result of minor things (like when Karui threw a rock at him and he believed it would cause an avalanche and destroy Konohagakure) and likes to

fields.en_description: Okyō (お京) goes to the same river where Naruto trains to learn the Summoning Technique. Jiraiya spends more time watching Okyō frolicking with her friends than he does watching Naruto. Okyō seems to be a very happy and fun person as she is seen to always smile. Okyō has long, smooth light-brown hair that hangs over her face a bit and wears a greenish-coloured swimsuit. She is fair-skinned and has a plain looking face. She also has large, light-coloured eyes and was seen to wear a thin shade of re

Oppo (オッポ) is an underling of Aniki. Oppo and Teru failed to pass the exams at the academy and become genin. They went to different jobs, but each time they were fired, and in the end, when they had absolutely nothing to eat, they joined Aniki. Oppo is a rather weak person, obeying Aniki because he took him under his wing, despite being constantly belittled by him, and considers himself a failure. He was scared of retribution when he realised he had also kidnapped the Hokage's daughter. Despite

Orochimaru (大蛇丸) is one of Konohagakure's legendary Sannin. With a life-ambition to learn all of the world's secrets, Orochimaru seeks immortality so that he might live all of the lives necessary to accomplish his task. After being caught red-handed performing unethical experiments on his fellow citizens for the sake of this immortality, Orochimaru defected from Konoha rather than be persecuted for his ambitions, and for many years sought the village's destruction in order to take revenge and de
