fields.en_description: Osoi (オソイ) was a genin from Kumogakure. He was the father of Musai. Osoi fought alongside Toroi in his last battle, which led to his own death. He was later mistakenly reincarnated by Orochimaru in an attempt to reincarnate Toroi. After explaining the mix-up to Orochimaru and Kabuto, they decided to keep him around for future use. Seemingly a very proud ninja, Osoi told his son that he should lie about his father's ability. He wanted Musai to ensure that the Raikage knew of his sacrifice. While

Otoha (オトハ) is a nurse from Konohagakure who works at the Konoha Hospital. She has brown hair and light-coloured skin. She went to the same public bath house where Naruto trained to improve his chakra control. Naruto spied on her when he first arrived.

Osuka Kamakura (鎌倉オスカ, Kamakura Osuka) is an Academy student in Konohagakure. Osuka's mother Hibari is an old friend of Neon's mother, which led to them being friends. When her parents began spending less time with her due to their careers, Neon was asked to keep her company, as Osuka struggled to make friends. From early childhood, Osuka would occasionally join her parents on their movie shoots. One such occasion was at a mountain range where she learned how to identify edible plants. Osuka is

Oyone (オヨネ) is a medical-nin of Konohagakure and a member of the village's Analysis Team in the Intelligence Division. Oyone wears a white medical uniform. She has a short crop of straight black hair that hangs down to her cheeks, framing her face. Being put in a team alongside Shizune and Kumadori to analyse the captured body of Pain's Animal Path proves that Oyone has a great knowledge about medical ninjutsu. As a medical-nin, Oyone must also have an excellent chakra control. Main article: Pai

Otokaze (オトカゼ) is a jōnin of Sunagakure. He has spiky brown hair and his eyes take to squinting. He wears the standard attire of the Suna-nin inclusive of flak jacket and forehead protector. Otokaze was the first to find the Fourth Kazekage's body after the failed Konoha Crush. He alerts his fellow shinobi that had been scouring the Land of Wind in search of the Kazekage using his whistle. "Otokaze" can mean "sounded wind". Oto means "sound" and Kaze means "wind" which means his name could be a

Penjira (ペンジラ, Viz: Penzila) is a citizen of the Land of Redaku. He is imprisoned at the Astronomy Research Institute. Penjira has long been a gambling-fanatic. Whenever his losses placed him in too large a debt, he would marry a woman and run off with the dowry money. With the money he paid off his debtors and resumed his gambling habits until he inevitably went into debt again and the cycle repeated. He was eventually caught during one of his attempted marriages and sent to the Astronomy Resea

Pochi (ポチ, English TV: Pooch) is a dog that Inari owned some time in the past. Inari thought of Pochi as his only friend. He was stolen by Akane, who renamed him "Shooting Star" (シューティング・スター, Shūtingu Sutā). Akane eventually decided he didn't want Pochi and threw him into the ocean. Even though dogs are usually able to swim right away, Pochi started to drown. Inari wanted to save Pochi but couldn't find the courage, so Akane pushed him in. When Inari began to drown too, Pochi found out how to do

Pakura (パクラ) was a famed Sunagakure kunoichi during her lifetime. Pakura was Maki's teacher and would regularly train with her. During her lifetime, Pakura, who was also known as the Hero of Sunagakure, was considered a part of negotiations with Kirigakure, according to the village higher ups. She took her last breath while cursing her village and shinobi. In the anime, Pakura's background is further explained. Pakura was sent on a mission to stop Iwagakure's plans during their feud with Suna. S

Ponta (ポン太) is a giant raccoon and the companion of the master enka music ninja, Sabu. Ponta will carelessly attack any enemy head on. Ponta is very large in terms of size, easily towering over his partner Sabu, and was even mistaken for a bear by Kisame Hoshigaki. He predominantly has orange fur with some brown fur around his face, ears, feet and tail. The area directly around his mouth is white however. He also wears bandages on his front paws and has small black eyes. During Killer B's enka t

Pakkun (パックン) is a miniature pug, and the smallest of Kakashi Hatake's ninken. In the anime, some time after Pakkun and the other ninken made a contract with Kakashi, they aided him to search the abducted Rin Nohara by Kirigakure shinobi and acted as a diversion in order to allow them to flee. They also helped searching for the fleeing Orochimaru, allowing Kakashi and the Root Anbu Kinoe pursue him into the residence of the Iburi clan to save the only survivor, Yukimi. Despite his cute appearanc

Poochie is a pet dog from Konohagakure that appears in Naruto Shippūden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 4's "Road to Boruto" DLC. Poochie is a larger dog with brown fur. His tongue is typically seen hanging from his mouth. Boruto Uzumaki is asked by Poochie's owners, a mother and her son, to find Poochie who had run away to somewhere near the Konoha Cemetery. Boruto finds Poochie and has him return to his owners. Later, after meeting with Poochie's owners to confirm his return, the mother tells Boruto tha

This man was a shinobi and a farmer of Kusagakure. The man whose body was later used as the Preta Path was a Kusagakure ninja, whom Jiraiya met during his travels around the world. In the anime, it was shown that he was both a ninja and a farmer, who had failed to cultivate the land for his family due to his participation in war. After his death, his body was used by Nagato as one of his Six Paths of Pain. He was a stocky man with beady brown eyes. He had brown hair that was hidden by a bandanna

fields.en_description: Potcha (ポッチャ) and his partner Mondai were two imposters who tried infiltrating Konohagakure. Potcha and Mondai sought fame in their village and apparently spent months perfecting their "disguise" technique. Potcha appears to be goofy and not very smart, very much like his partner Mondai. Potcha along with Mondai put on football helmets and charge at the enemy with a high-speed attack though it is unknown what the effects of this technique are since it was halted. Main article: The Appearance of

The Prime Minister (宰相, Saishō) of the Land of Redaku assists the country's monarch. The Prime Minister served the Land of Redaku's previous King for thirty years. Because he had no family of his own, he committed himself to serving his country and its people, a task he took on happily. When the King became ill, the Prime Minister travelled to the Land of Fire and its surrounding countries. While there, the Prime Minister witnessed the shinobi and jutsu that were regarded as fairy tales back in

Rahyō (羅氷) was a missing-nin from Kirigakure and a leading member of the Ryūha Armament Alliance. Rahyō and his younger sister, Kahyō, were once shinobi of Kirigakure but fled the village in hope of a better life. After his nephew, Hakuhyō, died during the Fourth Shinobi World War, Rahyō helped found the Ryūha Armament Alliance in the hopes of creating a world where deaths like Hakuhyō's wouldn't happen anymore. Initially, Rahyō was a cold man, easily willing to sacrifice innocent people for his

Rai Uchiha (うちはライ, Uchiha Rai) was a shinobi of the Uchiha clan. Born to the Uchiha clan, Rai was able to awaken the Sharingan in his youth, as well as his own Mangekyō Sharingan. During the continuous struggle between shinobi clans, Rai and his clansmen faced an opposing force who quickly wiped out Rai's comrades with a trap. However, Rai nullified the outcome by sacrificing his left eye in order to use Izanagi. With the enemies slaughtered, he boldly declared that the Uchiha clan was invincibl

fields.en_description: Raijin (雷神) is a criminal shinobi who makes up half of the Legendary Stupid Brothers, alongside his older brother Fūjin. The two brothers originated from an unknown village. They once killed their comrades over a meal, and calmed down immediately afterwards. After the incident, they were locked up in Konoha Strict Correctional Facility, though the ones who apprehended them struggled with their mighty strength. At some point in their past, they had an encounter with Tsunade and the brothers have

Raiga Kurosuki (黒鋤雷牙, Kurosuki Raiga), renowned as the Thunder of the Hidden Mist (霧隠れの雷人, Kirigakure no Raijin), was a jōnin from Kirigakure as well as a member of the Seven Ninja Swordsmen of the Mist. Prior to his defection from the village, he also served as an Anbu. After defecting his village, Raiga became a crime boss of the Kurosuki Family, alongside his partner Ranmaru. Raiga had served the Seven Ninja Swordsmen of the Mist starting at some point before or during the Third Shinobi World

en_general_infos.Team: Seven ninja swordsmen of the mist kurosuki family (anime only)

fields.en_description: Raidō Namiashi (並足ライドウ, Namiashi Raidō) is a tokubetsu jōnin of Konohagakure who serves as an elite bodyguard to the Hokage. During his entrance ceremony into the Academy, Raidō was present when Obito Uchiha arrived late. In the anime, during the Chūnin Exams, Raidō was placed in a team with Kurenai Yūhi and Asuma Sarutobi. Not much else is known about Raidō's background except for the fact he is regarded highly for his assassination skills. He is also an elite guard to the Hokage. During his ti

en_general_infos.Team: Hokage guard platoon konoha special mission platoon twenty platoons daimyō protection squad

fields.en_description: Rainenmaru was one of Suien's summons who appeared in Naruto: Mission: Protect The Waterfall Village! (novel). Rainenmaru was very loyal to Suien. He was also violent towards his opponents. Rainenmaru was a giant black koi. Rainenmaru had incredible speed and was powerful enough to take down Ryūrimaru and Naruto Uzumaki with a single blow.

Raimei (ライメイ) is a shinobi, in contract with the Makibi Corporation, that fought in the Coliseum. Raimei is a young, light-skinned individual with spiky brown hair. He wears a white robe, with a violet sash tied around his waist, cloth that is wrapped around both of his wrists and ankles, that also substitutes as an undershirt, a pair of dark blue pants and shinobi sandals. Raimei is able to perform Lightning Release techniques, one of which engulfs his entire body in electricity. Main article:

fields.en_description: Ran (乱) is a villager who lives in the Land of Rice Fields. Ran is a very kind individual. Ran has brown eyes and long brown hair that she wears in two ponytails. She also has a strand of hair hanging between her eyes. She wears a simple dress with a red outfit underneath along with a simple sash and slippers. Main article: Menma Memory Search Mission She beseeched Neji, Tenten, Naruto and Menma to save her village from a group of bandits that were plaguing them after realising they were shinobi

Ran (ラン, Ran) is a kunoichi of Kumogakure. Ran has a short crop of brown hair and blue eyes. She wore a midriff blouse and a skirt along with a customised midriff Kumogakure flak jacket. She also wore red wrist warmers, stockings and a pair of sandals with the forehead protector of the Allied Shinobi Forces. Not much is known of her abilities but she was presumably skilled in kenjutsu as she carried a tantō strapped to her shoulder. Main article: Fourth Shinobi World War: Confrontation During th

Ran Sōgi (双儀らん, Sōgi Ran) is an Academy student of Konohagakure. He is the twin brother of Suzu. He is a rather curious boy, any news about his classmates picking up his interest. He also acts in sync with his sister, simultaneously and with the same facial expressions, surprised by another rumour. He and Suzu are competitive with one another, and yet still close to each other as they are apprehensive about spending time apart. Ran is a short boy with blue eyes and blue short hair. He wears a wh

Ranka (ランカ, Viz: Lanka) is a chūnin-level shinobi from Konohagakure's Infiltration and Reconnaissance Party. He is a former member of the Konohagakure Intelligence Division's Analysis Team where he was in charge of autopsies. Ranka cares about his teammates and doesn't want them doing anything too dangerous. Ranka fell in love with Anko Mitarashi and out of burgeoning feelings to be on the same team as her, got reassigned to the Infiltration and Reconnaissance Party. Ranka is depicted as having

en_general_infos.Team: Analysis team infiltration and reconnaissance party

fields.en_description: Ranke (ランケ) served as a knight in Haido's supposed "utopian" army. She, Fugai, Kamira, and Haido attacked Temujin's village in search of the Stone of Gelel. Ranke was a very impatient, outspoken and extroverted individual. In battle, Ranke liked to tease her opponents, which lead to her constantly underestimating her opponents, while arrogant about her own defences. This contributed to her death when she recklessly attacked Gaara. Ranke had white skin, blonde frilled hair and light-violet colour

fields.en_description: Ranmaru (蘭丸) is a young orphan from Kirigakure, and later an apprentice chef at the Curry of Life Shop. Ranmaru grew up with a weak body, but the farmers living near him gave him food to survive. One day, he used his kekkei genkai, and accidentally revealed witnessing an injury that he otherwise could not have seen. The villagers realised that he was abnormal and stopped feeding him. Ranmaru became very lonely after a while. Not long afterward, Raiga arrived in the course of a mission, and was p

Rashii (ラシイ) is a jōnin from Kumogakure. Rashii is an old man with a long, grey, hair, bushy moustache and beard. He has white featureless eyes with dark rims underneath and thick eyebrows. Due to his old age, he also has visible cheekbones and wrinkles. He wears a white bandanna-styled forehead protector and the standard flak jacket of Kumogakure. Being an old shinobi, Rashii has both extensive knowledge and ability with ninjutsu. During the Fourth Shinobi World War, he was part of Darui's Firs

Rasa (羅砂) was the Fourth Kazekage (四代目風影, Yondaime Kazekage, literally meaning: Fourth Wind Shadow) of Sunagakure. Renowned for his ability to use Gold Dust, Rasa's reign as Kazekage was marked by his frequent quelling of rampages by the One-Tailed Shukaku, which he had sealed into his youngest son, Gaara. Because the Land of Wind's daimyō began to cut down on Sunagakure's budget and instead used Konohagakure's less expensive services, Rasa therefore saw his own village in danger of extinction.

Reki (レキ) is a jōnin of Sunagakure. Reki cares about all of his comrades in Sunagakure. He was deeply saddened by Chiyo's death. Reki is a young man with dark eyes. He wears the standard attire of the Suna-nin, including forehead protector, flak jacket (lacking scroll pouches) and a ghutrah. As a jōnin, Reki is a skilled shinobi. It is said he fought in many battles and could, therefore, collect plenty of experience. Reki was one of the many Sunagakure ninja to go searching for Gaara after he wa

Reishi Kodon (虎呑レイシ, Kodon Reishi) was a pharmacist of the Kodon clan. When Reishi was seven years old, he witnessed the attempted annexation of Howling Wolf Village's by Amegakure; despite being outnumbered and less skilled, the Howling Wolf's villagers were able to able to overwhelm the invaders using blue fire powder, an innovation so easy to use and so destructive that even a child could defeat a ninja with it. In the aftermath, the captured Ame prisoners were forced to walk into the mine fi

Remon Yoimura (宵村レモン, Yoimura Remon) is a member of the Yoimura Clan. She is plagued by an ancient family curse. Remon grew up close to her distant relative Kankitsu Akitsuki. To help hold off the growing curse in her from erasing her memories, she was given a special hair-clip inherited from her ancestor Kuen. By age twenty, due to the curse, a mark appeared on her left palm, putting her at risk of gradually losing memories. Ultimately, she was betrothed to Kankitsu to subdue the curse for anot

Renga (レンガ) is the oldest brother of Jiga and Ruiga and the leader of the Janin. He is the mastermind of the coup d'état in the Land of Vegetables which resulted in the death of its daimyō. After their rise to power, the three brothers betrayed their allies, which included greedy and disloyal courtiers they had recruited, and slaughtered them all. The brothers themselves were distrusting of each other, and plotted to kill off the others in order to have more wealth and power for themselves. As w

Renga Kokubō (国防レンガ, Kokubō Renga) is a genin from Team 25, that has joined Konohagakure's Anbu. Renga is a very hard-working individual, willing to take on large amounts of work at a time. Renga has messy black hair with shaved sides and dark-coloured eyes. He wears a sleeveless brown shirt and brown shorts. Alongside his team-mates, despite his young age, Renga excels in information gathering missions, often being assigned Anbu-class missions. He has exceptional physical strength, able to lift

Renge Momoashi is a fictional character formerly in service to Shuku Village from The Tale of the Utterly Gutsy Shinobi novel written by Jiraiya. He is featured as the novel's main antagonist. He is described as hailing from a clan of "centipede users". At age six, Renge graduated from Shuku Academy and was placed on Team Shū under Shū's leadership alongside Naruto Musasabi and Tsuyu. Tsuyu almost immediately developed romantic feelings for him, but he was uninterested in her. At one point, Tsuy

fields.en_description: Reto (烈斗) was the First Kazekage (初代風影, Shodai Kazekage, literally meaning: First or Founding Wind Shadow) who founded Sunagakure in the Land of Wind, and was said to have gathered all the desert-dwelling shinobi under his control with his overwhelming power. He was presented at the first ever meeting of all five Kage. He was accompanied by the future Second Kazekage Shamon, noted to his peers that they would not be acting simply based off feelings, and that their agreement was based off the dis

Riichi (リイチ) works at an inn in Shukuba Town, though he has aspirations of someday owning his own hotel. Riichi has long black hair that he keeps in a pony tail tied in the back and small black eyes. He wears a big flat green hat on his head. "Haku Hatsu Chun" (白発中), the names of the three dragon tiles in Mahjong, are written on his forehead. When Sasuke describes Naruto and Jiraiya to him, Riichi accidentally directs him to Buna and Shimeji.

Riichi (リイチ, Riichi) is a jōnin of Konohagakure. Riichi and Fugaku Uchiha were seen evacuating villagers to the southeast shelter during the Nine-Tailed Demon Fox's Attack. Riichi is the type of person that would rather do what he wants instead of working. He would even complain about this. He normally has a happy demeanour. Riichi has shoulder length brown hair, with bangs. His eyes have a very distinctive sunken look that gives him the appearance of being tired. He wears the standard attire of

Rikumaru (リク丸) is one of the Nara clan's deer. Rikumaru does not seem to be afraid of humans like most animals and he did not flee during Shikamaru's fight with Hidan. Rikumaru looks like a normal deer with light brown-coloured fur and dark brown eyes. He also has two big black-coloured antlers on his head like a normal male deer. Rikumaru stood beside Shikamaru's side when he swore to Hidan that his clan would keep him buried there for all eternity. He later followed Shikamaru to the edge of th

Rinji (麟児) was a shinobi from Otogakure and a member of Team Guren. He also was an underling of Orochimaru. Rinji had a laid back attitude and was rarely worked up about anything. At the same time, he was shown to have sharp intellect and was a planning type. He was also somewhat ambitious, as he wanted to report to Orochimaru in Kabuto's place, threatening his position as Orochimaru's right-hand man, which led to him being killed by Kabuto. Rinji had dark brown hair with black eyes. His outfit

Rin Nohara (のはらリン, Nohara Rin) was a chūnin of Konohagakure and a member of Team Minato. She was forcibly made into the jinchūriki of the Three Tails Isobu, as an elaborate scheme by Kirigakure to destroy her village. Rin, however, would ultimately sacrifice herself to ensure the safety of the people she loved. Rin spent her young childhood playing alongside her best friend Obito Uchiha, often cheering him on when he struggled. On the day of their entrance into the Academy, Rin was present when

Rokkaku Ryūdōin (龍堂院六角, Ryūdōin Rokkaku) is one of the Three Ryūdōin Brothers, alongside Jakō and Genshō, who were seeking revenge against Might Guy for their father's humiliation and death. At first Rokkaku hated and cursed Might Guy for defeating his father in battle and along with his brothers wanted revenge on Guy. Later after being defeated by Guy, Rokkaku thought that he may have misunderstood his fathers final words. Rokkaku has neck length smooth black hair that he keeps tied in a pony t

Rokuro (ロクロ) is a missing-nin. Rokuro defected his village and had a bounty on him, leading to his capture by Anaguma and his partner. He sustained an injury he kept concealed. Back home, he expected to receive at least a life sentence. Rokuro has no issue lying and manipulating to survive, even at the expense of others, but will admit defeat if someone bests him. He is also very perceptive, able to see through people's deceptions. Rokuro is a tall man of lean frame and pale complexion. He has g

Rokusuke (ロクスケ) is a miner from the Land of Rivers. Rokusuke has short black hair and black eyes. He wears a grey bandanna tied backwards, and a blue yukata. He and his friends left the village after Raiga Kurosuki overthrows the village's government. They get caught in a storm after leaving and eventually wind up in the Land of Fire, where they meet Naruto Uzumaki. Rokusuke returns to the Katabami Gold Mine once Naruto and other Konoha ninja are sent to investigate Raiga.

Ruiga (ルイガ) was the younger brother of Jiga and Renga and the member of the Janin. Ruiga, alongside his brothers, established a coup d'état, which resulted in the death of the Land of Vegetables' daimyō. After their rise to power, the three brothers betrayed their allies, which included greedy and disloyal courtiers they had recruited, and slaughtered them all. The brothers themselves were distrusting of each other, and plotted to kill off the others in order to have more wealth and power for th

Rock Lee (ロック・リー, Rokku Rī) is a shinobi of Konohagakure's Lee clan and a member of Team Guy. Unlike most shinobi, he lacked the skills necessary to use ninjutsu or genjutsu. However, he overcomes those shortcomings by undergoing special training from Might Guy that would make him a taijutsu master while still a genin. During his time in the Academy, Lee proved to have no talent for ninjutsu and genjutsu. When he was mocked by his peers because of this, Lee persevered, focusing on taijutsu. Afte

fields.en_description: Ryōkan (リョウカン) is a medical-nin of Sunagakure. Ryōkan has dark eyes and thin eyebrows. He wears what is seemingly the standard uniform for medical ninja in Sunagakure which entails a red tunic with a white poncho-like collar which he wears along with a ghutrah and a white forehead protector. Ryōkan seems to get frustrated a lot when he is unable to help his fellow comrades. He was filled with regret at not being able to help Kankurō. Ryōkan is a talented medical-nin, but he along with his mentor

Ruka (ルカ) is a kunoichi of Kirigakure. While having a quiet, reserved demeanour, Ruka is fiercely loyal to her village and equally so to her comrades as she spoke out against Pakura's tirade against Kirigakure telling her that the Fifth Mizukage would usher in a new era for the village while worrying about the safety of her comrades. Ruka is a slim woman with fair skin, black eyes, and shoulder-length brown hair. She sports the standard attire of Kirigakure with a skirt and an Allied Shinobi For

Ryuka Tenrō (天狼リュカ, Tenrō Ryuka) is a kunoichi from Yumegakure's Tenrō clan and the daughter of Enzo Tenrō. She is good friends with Yomito Hirasaka and Taisa Amagiri. After her village was destroyed by the fake Nine-Tails, she wanted revenge more than either of her friends on Naruto Uzumaki. She was, however, against her father's idea to use the Three-Headed Guardian Beast, not wanting to endanger innocent villages. Normally, Ryuka is an upbeat and cheerful girl. She was very grateful to Naruto

Ryōgi (リョウギ) is a shinobi from the Land of Snow, and a former member of the Byakuya Gang. In his early childhood, Ryōgi lived a simple but carefree life with his parents. He would stay at home with his mother while his father would go off to shinobi missions with Gekkō. One night, to Ryōgi's horror, his father returned home mortally wounded and, soon after, was dead. Immediately afterwards, the assailant, revealed to be Gekkō, killed Ryōgi's mother. As he moved to kill Ryōgi, in fear for his lif

Ryūgan (竜眼) was a shinobi from the Takumi Village and a member of the Four Celestial Symbols Men. Ryūgan was presumed to be the youngest of his group. This, however, didn't put a limit to his prideful and arrogant attitude. During his battle with Kankurō and the Konoha shinobi, he boasted about how they were all going to die by his blade. Ryūgan also showed great pride in his weapon, the Garian Sword. Ryūgan also showed a little soft side of him. Ryūgan was a slender boy, with green eyes that we

Ryūrimaru (龍鯉丸) was Hisen's summoning creature. Ryūrimaru was summoned by Shibuki in his battle against Suien. Ryūrimaru was obedient and loyal towards its summoner, Hisen. Ryūrimaru was a crimson white catfish that was six times the size of a human man. Ryūrimaru had the ability to use the Transformation Technique. With Hisen saying, "Dragon God Transform", it transforms into a giant golden dragon.

Ryūsa (リュウサ) is a senior from Sunagakure. He has served his village for many years. Ryūsa has dark eyes, fairly thick eyebrows, and a strong jaw line. He wears the standard attire of the Sunagakure Seniors. His speech and conduct are very prudent, allowing him to act with calm judgement. His actions are always based on his deliberate judgement. As a member of the advisory council, he is most likely one of Sunagakure's wisest shinobi. He is first seen alongside the other council members during Ga

Ryūki (龍奇) is a worshipper of Jashin. Ryūki dislikes the peace that spread throughout the world after the end of the Fourth Shinobi World War, as he feels it makes the countries and its people weak. To rectify this, he decided to follow in Hidan's footsteps by becoming immortal, and with that immortality, he would bring death and destruction back to the world and establish himself as its ruler. In order for Jashin to grant him immortality, he needed to acquire a large number of sacrifices. To th

Ryūsui (リュウスイ) is a genin from Amegakure. He and Yūdachi were the ones delivering corpses to the highest tower in Amegakure, where Pain allegedly resides. Their most recent delivery was the corpse of what would be the second Animal Path. Ryūsui is highly loyal towards Pain and Amegakure, looking up to Pain with admiration due to him protecting the village and will swiftly admonish anyone insulting or even complaining about him. He is also a proud person, refusing to betray his comrades during in

Ryūzetsu (竜舌) was an Anbu from Kusagakure. She appeared in Naruto the Movie: Blood Prison. Ryūzetsu belonged to the Grass Flower Group of Kusagakure and was childhood friends with Mui's son, Muku. As children, they both dreamed of resurrecting the glory of Kusagakure. Eventually, she witnessed Mui sacrificing Muku in a failed attempt to open the Box of Ultimate Bliss, leaving only his green scarf. She was seen wearing this same scarf as a bandanna during her trek into Mui's Hōzuki Castle in orde

fields.en_description: Rō (朧) is an Anbu of Konohagakure. When Rō was a genin, he was sent on a mission with a large team. The enemy ended up ambushing and killing every member of Rō's unit. Rō hid from the enemies under the corpses of his comrades for days suppressing his chakra, pretending to be dead. It was at this time, Rō learnt the Chakra Disguise. The Anbu later placed Rō in their ranks thanks to said technique. Rō has short, spiky brown hair and sideburns. He also has brown eyes, thick eyebrows, a strong jaw a

fields.en_description: Rōen (狼嚥) is a legendary monster resembling a cross between a tiger and a wolf. In the past, Rōen frequently attacked the Howling Wolf Village, killing its villagers by absorbing their chakra. The Kodon clan was able to defeat Rōen by sealing it into their clan's shrine. Time passed and Rōen became a myth. Decades later, when the Howling Wolf Village began contemplating declaring neutrality, Tenma Kodon released Rōen from the shrine. Using saigenzai to control it, Tenma had Rōen attack the villa

Rōshi (老紫) was a shinobi of Iwagakure and the jinchūriki of the Four-Tails, Son Gokū. Rōshi became the jinchūriki of Son Gokū over forty years before the Fourth Shinobi World War at a young age. He left his home town of Iwagakure at some point to better understand and control the power of the beast within him. Son Gokū mentioned that Rōshi was just as hard-headed as Ōnoki, the Third Tsuchikage. Despite this, upon observing Naruto Uzumaki's battle against Tobi and his Six Paths of Pain, as well a

fields.en_description: Sabure (サブレ) is a pastry chef in Konohagakure. A citizen of the new city in Konohagakure, Sabure fell in love with Yubeshi, the granddaughter of his grandfather's friend Ohagi from the old town. However, a rift began growing between their grandfathers and the residents of the new city and old town over a festival's firework display, to the point Sabure and Yubeshi felt they couldn't tell their grandfathers about their relationship, despite already having picked a wedding date. When Taruto and ne

Sadai (サダイ) is a mercenary missing-nin who entered the Land of Fire to kidnap Naho. During the Third Shinobi World War, Sadai and his group encountered and fought members of the Uchiha clan. Sadai in his armour guise is a large man with a toothless mouth, giving a puppet-like impression, wearing the same head hooded uniform with a raised collar as his men. In his true form, he is a brown-haired man with dashing looks and sleeveless shirt. Without augmentation from ninjutsu, Sadai showed a high l

Sada (サダ) is a genin from the Benisu Island. Both Sada and his twin brother Kiji seem to have very cheerful dispositions and are often seen smiling. The two brothers also tend to sing while they work or if they speak they say the same thing. Sada had short black hair that hung around his face with a topknot. He wore a simple outfit with an apron like suit over it along with a white sash, wrist warmers and simple shinobi sandals. As a shinobi from the Benisu Island, Sada makes use of an abacus th

Sabiru (サビル) was a high-ranking shinobi in Konohagakure's tactical division. He was later discovered to be a traitor and a spy. Sabiru was part of Konohagakure's tactical and defence division during the Third Hokage's administration. He had seemingly come up with a plan that would fortify Konohagakure's defences to the point that the Third stated that it would assure the peace in Konohagakure forever. He was, however, discovered to be a traitor of the village by Kisuke Maboroshi, an Anbu. When K

Sabu (サブ) is an enka ninja music master. Killer B calls him Sabu-chan (サブちゃん), and later, the oddly constructed Master Sabu-chan (サブちゃん師匠, Sabu-chan-shishō). Sabu is a calm, collected, and often a dead serious person especially when he is practising enka. This was demonstrated when B joked around during an enka training session, Sabu told him to take the lessons seriously. fields.en_description: Sadoru (サドル) is a kunoichi of Konohagakure who serves as an instructor at the Academy. According to Iruka Umino, Sadoru recently became an instructor at the Academy. Sadoru is a kind and loyal shinobi getting worked up when her students were vandalising a statue of the Third Hokage. Sadoru holds Iruka in high regards and was impressed with his ability to trick Tsukune to admitting to the vandalism. Sadoru has long black hair that she keeps held in a top knot bun with multiple strands popping out

fields.en_description: Sagan (サガン) is a shinobi from Iwagakure. Sagan seems to be a calm shinobi and he was shocked while watching the five Kage fight Madara. After seeing how powerful Madara is, he stated that it was all over for him and his comrades. Sagan has long, brown hair which reaches into his back with a bang on the left side of his face. Attire-wise, he wears the standard attire of the Iwa-nin complete with a two-sleeved shirt, with mesh armour underneath it. He also wears his red forehead protector in a ban

Sagi (サギ) was the son of Ōwashi, the older twin brother of Toki, and the real heir of the Land of Birds. As a child, Sagi and Toki were very close, and spent much time playing together with their mutual friend Chishima. After his death, his spirit appeared and saved his sister from committing suicide. The spirit gave his sister a pocket watch that had stopped. She swore to avenge her brother's suspicious death and make his frozen time move again, by disguising herself and becoming daimyō in his

Sagiri (サギリ) was a tradesman who was granted entry into the Nadeshiko Village. Because of the village's laws and customs, he and Shizuka were prohibited from being together, despite their intense love for each other. He nevertheless loved her very much and vowed to do whatever he could to change the laws of the village that he found ridiculous. However, he was later ambushed and killed as proof to show his lack of strength and unworthiness of being with Shizuka. Sagiri cared very much for Shizuk

Sai Yamanaka (山中サイ, Yamanaka Sai) is the Anbu Chief of Konohagakure's Yamanaka clan. Prior to this, he was a Root member. As per standard Root training, Sai was conditioned to remove all emotions and as such, had difficulty connecting with others. When he is added to Team Kakashi as a replacement for the rogue Sasuke Uchiha, Sai begins to learn more about people's feelings and tries to develop his personality and identity by forming genuine bonds and rediscovering the emotions he was taught to s

fields.en_description: Saisu Kamano (鎌野サイス, Kamano Saisu) is a chūnin of Konohagakure. In the anime, when Saisu was a student in the Academy, he was in the same class as Itachi Uchiha. During shuriken practice, he was shocked to see that Itachi's aim was perfect. Later, he challenged Itachi to spar with him, easily being defeated by the Uchiha. The next day, he was annoyed at the girls in his class fawning over Itachi, and on the way to confront him accidentally bumped into Dokan, an older student displeased by their

Saiken (犀犬), more commonly known as the Six-Tails (六尾, Rokubi), is one of the nine tailed beasts. It was last sealed within Utakata of Kirigakure. Saiken and the tailed beasts first came into being in the waning days of Hagoromo Ōtsutsuki, who used his Creation of All Things Technique to divide the Ten-Tails' chakra into nine separate bodies and giving each a name. Some time after being created, the Sage explained to the young tailed beasts that a link existed between them despite their separati

Sajin (砂仁) was a chūnin from Sunagakure. Sajin had only just become a Chūnin before being sent to attack Konohagakure and thus, had little mission experience. He had short brown hair and wore the standard attire of a Suna-nin which included flak jacket, forehead protector, a shuriken holster strapped to his right thigh along with shinobi sandals. During the Konoha Crush he was travelling with a team attacking Konoha. He later encountered Shikaku Nara and was killed by his Shadow Imitation Techni

Sajin (サジン, Sajin) is a genin-level shinobi from Sunagakure and a teammate of Mujin and Mijin. Sajin is rather disdainful, given his silent belittlement of the actions of the other potential chūnin. He also seems to hold a grudge against the Hyūga clan, being visibly annoyed by being in their presence and frequently scowling at them. He is shown to be very selfish and amoral, willing to go to great lengths to succeed in his goals. During the Chūnin Exams' first round, so eager to pass, he attemp

Sajō (サジョウ) is a Senior from Sunagakure. Normally squinting, Sajō has shoulder-length dark hair which is concealed underneath a ghutrah and wears the standard attire of the Sunagakure Seniors. As a member of the advisory council, he is most likely one of Sunagakure's wisest shinobi. He has devoted his life to the prosperity of Sunagakure for many years. He was looking forward to see the results of the Chūnin Exams held together with several other countries, however, he was soon preoccupied with

Sakanami (サカナミ) is a criminal from Land of Water. Sakanami was previously a miner, later leaving that life behind to become a criminal. When gold was discovered on Dotō Island in the Land of Water, he and his accomplice, Tatsunami went under the guise of helping mine to steal it. Sakanami is a rather greedy and cruel person who took advantage of the naive nature of his boss, who did not check his criminal past and allowed him to work. He was very concerned about the success of the gold theft ope

Sakumo Hatake (はたけサクモ, Hatake Sakumo), renowned across the shinobi world as Konoha's White Fang (木ノ葉の白い牙, Konoha no Shiroi Kiba, English TV: White Fang of the Leaf, literally meaning: Tree Leaf's White Fang), was a jōnin of Konohagakure's Hatake clan. Sakumo was a famous and powerful ninja of Konohagakure. His son, Kakashi, proved himself a genius like Sakumo and idolised him, desiring to become just as great a ninja as his father. His wife died when Kakashi was very young. Sakumo witnessed his

fields.en_description: Sakon (左近, Sakon) and his older brother Ukon (右近, Ukon) were twin brothers from Otogakure and the apparent leader(s) of the Sound Four. In the anime, the Sound Four were originally prisoners of Orochimaru, forced to fight other prisoners to the death in battle royales. By surviving their respective matches, they proved themselves to be the strongest of Orochimaru's prisoners and as such were made his bodyguards. The Sound Four were at some point forced to accept Kimimaro as their leader, who eas

en_general_infos.Occupation: De facto leader of sound four

fields.en_description: Sakuya (サクヤ) was a noble of the Land of Silence. Sakuya was very obsessed with how she looked and getting Hashirama Senju's cells in her incorrect belief that it can be used for rejuvenation. Sakuya was an old woman with long white hair. Her face is covered with wrinkles, she had a thick layer of red colored lipstick and purple eyeshadow. She was reputed in her youth to be exceptionally beautiful. Main article: Kara Actuation Arc Sakuya came into possession of the cell of Hashirama Senju. Hearin

Samidare (五月雨) is a genin from Amegakure. Samidare seemed to be an opportunistic and curious person, tailing other shinobi in order to discover their objective, as well as subsequently steal it if possible. Samidare has spiky brown hair with a ponytail and short spiky bangs hanging over his forehead protector. He wears a green scarf around his neck, a light grey jacket and an attire reminiscent of Team Shigure. Little is known about Samidare's overall abilities, but he was shown to be holding a

Samidare Amaashi (あまあしサミダレ, Amaashi Samidare) is a serial killer known as the Rain Killer (雨の殺人鬼, Ame no Satsujinki, English TV: Rainy Day Killer). Samidare worked as a shinobi for many years, always prioritising his missions over his family. When he heard news that his sister Mikazuki died in a Kaneki Corporation chemical plant accident, he investigated, finding her involvement in a dangerous project suspicious. He tracked down her superiors and discovered they pushed the project forward despit

Sakura Uchiha (うちはサクラ, Uchiha Sakura, née Haruno (春野)) is a kunoichi of Konohagakure. When assigned to Team 7, Sakura quickly finds herself ill-prepared for the duties of a shinobi. However, after training under the Sannin Tsunade, she overcomes this, and becomes recognised as one of the greatest medical-nin in the world. Sakura is the only child of a civilian family. She had an healthy childhood, raised by her parents without any serious tragedy or complications, unlike her team members. When s

fields.en_description: Samui (サムイ) is a kunoichi from Kumogakure, and the leader of Team Samui. As opposed to her too talkative and rather impulsive, one-time teammates and hot-headed younger brother, Samui is mature, calm, and generally silent, only speaking when needed. The word she has a tendency to say most is "cool" (クール, kūru). She has also shown a great level of self-control as she was able to refrain from using the word "cool" during her battle against the Gold and Silver Brothers — something both her brother,

fields.en_description: San (参) was an antagonist who appeared in Naruto Shippūden the Movie: The Will of Fire. He was one of Hiruko's three followers, along with Ichi and Ni. San, like his teammates, was extremely confident in his own abilities. He also didn't listen to reason even if it may have been in his favour. Like his comrades, he would not hesitate in using the Chimera Technique to merge with others, even if it meant distorting his own body. San had light-coloured eyes and brown hair. He almost perfectly resem

A personal summon of San that appears in Naruto Shippūden the Movie: The Will of Fire. The bird-like creature is a very large beast. It was large enough for San to be able to stand on top its head, and was even then dwarfed in comparison. It had a very large wingspan which had distinctive markings that combined near the middle. It also had two jet-like pistons near the end of its body, with two tails attached. It has an orange face, green feathers and white skin. It showed the ability to shoot e

Sana (サナ) is a kunoichi from Sunagakure and a teammate of Saya and Mamushi. Much like her teammates, Sana is an arrogant and sadistic kunoichi. At the same time, she is very submissive before Saya, referring to her as "Elder Sister" (お姉さま, Onē-sama). Sana has long, light violet hair, tied up in a braid with two green hair-bands, and grey eyes. She wears a lime green and blue kimono with a brown corset and fishnet pants. She also has two wristbands and bandages wrapped around her legs. Her forehe

Sandayū Asama (浅間三太夫, Asama Sandayū) was a personal assistant for Yukie Fujikaze, who appeared in Naruto the Movie: Ninja Clash in the Land of Snow. When he was young, he lived in the Kazahana Castle as a loyal subject of the daimyō, Sōsetsu Kazahana. When Dotō Kazahana revolted and burned down the castle, killing Sōsetsu in the process, Sandayū and Koyuki left the remnants of the place, and ever since then has become her personal assistant throughout her acting career. Sandayū was a very loyal

en_general_infos.Affiliation: Land of snow kazahana castle land of fire

fields.en_description: Sanshō (山椒) is the owner of the Curry of Life Shop. Little is known about Sanshō, only that she once saved Rock Lee's life by making an odd-looking and very spicy curry. Lee seems to enjoy the curry very much. Sanshō is a very kind and helpful person. She can be serious at times and will go to great lengths to help good people. Sanshō is an elderly woman with white hair and small black eyes. She wears a beige-coloured hat and two large strands of her hair hang down below each side of her face. S

Sangorō (サンゴロウ) is a miner from the Land of Rivers. Sangoro has a short crop of black hair and thick eyebrows. He has a very short beard that is grey in colour. This beard is very close to his skin. He also wears a bandanna on his head covering his hair and it is tied in the back. Sangorō and his friends left their village after Raiga Kurosuki took control of it. They were caught in a storm after leaving and eventually reached the Land of Fire, where they met Naruto Uzumaki. Sangorō returned to

Sansho (サンショ) is an academy student from Konohagakure. Sansho gets along well his classmates Tsukune and Mibuna. Like Naruto he is a troublemaker and likes to pull pranks. When Iruka initially questioned the group he feigned ignorance and stated they were only playing hide-in-seek. However, he appears to have some sense of right and wrong as he and Mibuna decided to run when Tsukune wanted to steal the Scroll of Seals. Sansho has short, greyish-brown hair and black eyes. His attire consists of a

Santa Yamanaka (山中サンタ, Yamanaka Santa) is a jōnin from Konohagakure's Yamanaka clan. Santa is a slim, fair-skinned man with slanted, dark eyes and very long, auburn hair which reaches well into his back. He ties it into a high ponytail. He wears the standard attire of a Konoha shinobi, inclusive of flak jacket as well as the Allied Shinobi Forces' forehead protector. He is proficient in his clan's technique's displayed when he used the Mind Body Switch Technique to exchange bodies instead of jus

Sanzui Unabara (海原サンズイ, Unabara Sanzui) is the daimyō of the Land of Water. Sanzui cares deeply for his country, having spent a lot of time helping develop new power stations. He believes in making things better for the future, pointing out to his son Awaji he would inherit it all one day. He is also vengeful, as he demanded that Kirigakure severely punish the Funato clan for his son's death. Main article: School Trip Arc Upon Mei Terumī learning of proof that Sanzui had been in secret negotiati

Sarai (サライ) is a citizen of Rōran. Along with many women and children in Rōran, her father and older brother were kidnapped by Mukade to work to assemble his puppet army. Sarai has shoulder length brown hair and wide dark eyes, similar to Rock Lee's. She also had two markings under each of her eyes as well as a prominent front tooth. She has a robust build and wore a simple outfit with a navy blue poncho. She and the others kidnapped Sāra in an effort to have her release all the men that were fo

Sari (サリ) is a genin from Sunagakure. She is close friends with Matsuri and like her, she has a strong admiration for the Kazekage, even going as far as to volunteer for the mission to save him. Sari has large brown eyes and long brown hair parted in a bang that falls in the middle of her face. Her attire consists of bandanna-style forehead protector, a beige-coloured, high-collared shirt and she has bandages wrapped around her waist, a purple-coloured skirt with slits in the side. She also wear

Sasame (ササメ) is a young kunoichi of the Fūma clan. Sasame was a member of the Fūma clan at the time when Orochimaru approached them to help restore their former glory. While Arashi, Kamikiri, Kagerō, and Kotohime were convinced, Hanzaki and the others were not. Ever since then, Sasame has been searching for Arashi. Little is known about Sasame's ninja abilities, but she is familiar with seals and her clan's secret techniques. Outside of that, her hat doubles as a mask and she appears to be very

Sasami (ササミ) is an unknown assailant, who is affiliated to the Land of Rivers. Sasami, like her brother, is a very sadistic person, delighting in the suffering of others and likewise will taunt them with equal joy. She is also obsessed with power, delighting in the feel of increased might from her cursed seal. At the same time, she is a very alert individual, able to see through deception based on the nature of her opponent's movements. Sasami has long green hair, light grey eyes with thick eyeb

Sarada Uchiha (うちはサラダ, Uchiha Sarada) is a chūnin-level kunoichi from Konohagakure's Uchiha clan. Because she was raised only by her mother without having her father around, Sarada initially struggles to understand who she is or what she's supposed to be. After meeting him with the help of Naruto Uzumaki, Sarada comes to believe that she is defined by the connections she has with others, and as a member of Team Konohamaru, she seeks to someday become Hokage so that she can connect with as many p

fields.en_description: Sasuke Sarutobi (猿飛サスケ, Sarutobi Sasuke) was a renowned shinobi from Konohagakure's Sarutobi clan. Sasuke was a member of the Sarutobi clan and became famous for his extraordinary talent. At some point, he became the father of Hiruzen Sarutobi, who inherited his father's aptitude for ninjutsu. During a conversation with Biwako Sarutobi and Kushina Uzumaki, Mikoto Uchiha noted that she named her son after Sasuke in the hopes that the boy would become a splendid ninja just like his namesake. Thoug

Sasuke Uchiha (うちはサスケ, Uchiha Sasuke) is one of the last surviving members of Konohagakure's Uchiha clan. After his older brother, Itachi, slaughtered their clan, Sasuke made it his mission in life to avenge them by killing Itachi. He is added to Team 7 upon becoming a ninja and, through competition with his rival and best friend, Naruto Uzumaki, Sasuke starts developing his skills. Dissatisfied with his progress, he defects from Konoha so that he can acquire the strength needed to exact his rev

fields.en_description: Satetsu (サテツ) is a jōnin of Sunagakure. He was stunned by the Fourth's death and held great resentment towards Orochimaru for falsely leading Sunagakure into the Konoha Crush. Satetsu is a bald man with dark eyes and a goatee. He wears the standard attire of the Sunagakure jōnin which consists of a flak jacket over a black suit and sandals. Satetsu was one of the many ninja to scour the Land of Wind in search of the Fourth Kazekage. Satetsu (砂鉄) means "iron sand".

Satō (砂糖) is a genin of Konohagakure, forming a team with Shio and Koshō. Main article: Ao Arc At the Training Hall, Satō watched Boruto Uzumaki fight the Seventh Hokage alongside other genin. Satō's name translates to "sugar", while her teammates' names translate to "salt" and "pepper", respectively. Satō and her team are fanmade original characters that won the Boruto: Naruto Next Generations Chapter #11 Borukura original character contest, created by Haruharu of Ibaraki Prefecture. She appear

Satori (サトリ) is a demonic, bird-like creature that appears in Naruto the Movie: Blood Prison. According to Gamabunta, the Box of Ultimate Bliss "brings forth", "actuates", and "ends" with Satori. Beyond that, like the Box, Satori's history is overall a mystery. Little is known about Satori except that it has been around since the time of the Sage of the Six Paths and that Satori is merely a puppet of the Box. A person who enters the box and comes back out will become the host of Satori, gaining

Saya (サヤ) is a kunoichi from Sunagakure and a teammate of Sana and Mamushi. Saya is a very arrogant and sadistic kunoichi, revelling in finding new prey; this also extends to her teammates if they displease her. She is also very domineering, making her teammates refer to her as "Lady" (お嬢さま, Ojō-sama) and follow all her orders. She has a strong superiority-complex, believing herself superior to her enemies and refuses to believe herself capable of ever losing. When people challenge that view, sh

fields.en_description: Sayū Jōge (上下サユウ, Jōge Sayū) is a citizen of Konohagakure. Main article: Academy Entrance Arc Upon enrolling into the Academy, Sayū was placed in Shino Aburame's homeroom. When his class was assigned to split into groups of three and partake in a local workplace, Sayū got work experience at the village's fire department with Metal Lee and Inojin Yamanaka. Main article: School Trip Arc Sayū and his class went to Kirigakure for a field trip, where they were greeted by their tour guide, Kagura Kara

Sazanami (サザナミ), formerly known as Tokichi (トキチ, Tokichi), is a former bladesmith turned bounty hunter. Tokichi was born and lived in a tiny village settled in an unknown small country between two large countries, where he was a bladesmith by trade living on poverty. During a festival night, however, Tokichi was on an errand to deliver a custom made sword for a customer before he met and clashed with the criminal Gosunkugi, after having killed his client and their family of three. It was there t

Sazanami Senka (撰歌細波, Senka Sazanami) is a genin from Kirigakure. Like his brothers, Sazanami sports blue hair and a standard, striped light blue Kirigakure uniform, with a sword attached to his back. Sazanami is able to produce two shadow clones. Main articles: Boruto: Naruto the Movie and Versus Momoshiki Arc Having travelled to Konohagakure to participate in the Chūnin Exams, Sazanami alongside his brothers raced towards the exam venue alongside the other participants of the exams before gett

Sazanka (サザンカ) was a former student samurai of Mifune and a mercenary. Sazanka was once the star pupil of Mifune. During this time, he grew close to Tsubaki Kurogane as a junior disciple. Valuing her friendship, they would train together regularly. They participated in a tournament where the rumoured prize was the right to bear Mifune's Kurosawa after his retirement. Sazanka wanted to win as proof of his growth. During the final round, he went against Tsubaki, and despite holding the advantage f

Saō (サオウ) is a chūnin of Konohagakure. Saō wears a bandanna-style forehead protector and a Konoha flak jacket. He also has a large nose, moustache and beard. Saō utilises Water Release in combat, and with it, he is able to restrict his enemies' movement. He also carries a Bō staff. Main article: Mitsuki's Disappearance Arc While on guard duty with Uō at Konoha's main entrance, the pair were attacked by two intruders and Mitsuki before dawn, leading to the guards going into a coma and being hospi

Seimei (セイメイ) was the founder of Takumi Village, known for creating weapons for other shinobi villages. During his short appearance, Seimei acted calm, cold and aloof, believing his opponents efforts to be in vain against his power, openly laughing at them, showing his arrogance and pride. It was only when his opponents managed to successfully strike back or elude his attacks that Seimei lost his cool. Seimei was also credited by Gaara as believing ninja to be nothing but weapons. As the founder

Scarlet Blaze (红莲之瞳) is a ninja of Konohagakure, and one of the playable characters in Naruto: Ultimate Ninja Online. He enjoys looking in the mirror and shows interest in the various forms of ninjutsu in the world. A hardworking and pragmatic person with a striking appearance. Calm and collected temperament, Scarlet Blaze is adept at analysing opponents' weaknesses. Prefers using Fire Release techniques and genjutsu. He is calm in battle and his forte lies in the analysis of the opponent's weak

Seiren Funato (舟戸青煉, Funato Seiren) was a pirate from the Funato clan. As a child, her father Araumi returned from another raid and also brought with him a young boy named Tenma who he decided to adopt. Seiren later watched nervously as her younger brother, Ikada, was forcibly put through a rite of passage ceremony to determine his inherited power. As Ikada was hurled into the ocean as raging storm took place, his Funato abilities manifested, causing a massive wave that saved him from drowning,

Seito (セイト) was once a member of the Twelve Guardian Ninja. While he was still alive he was part of the Twelve Guardian Ninja. Ten years before the start of the series, six of the members tried a coup d'etat. He, alongside Asuma Sarutobi, Chiriku, Kitane, Tōu, and Nauma fought against them, only to be killed by Kazuma when Seito and the three other survivors tried to use Limelight on him. As one of the Twelve Guardian Ninja, he was one of the strongest shinobi in the Land of Fire, powerful enoug

Sekiei (セキエイ) was a fabrication that was created to serve Kū and to lead the Akuta in order fulfil Ōnoki's desire to protect peace within Iwagakure and the shinobi world. Sekiei was a very childish individual. He showed a very light-hearted nature, as he enjoyed drawing randomly and was very open with his thoughts. Ironically, while looking down on humans as weaker, he was nonetheless very fascinated by their emotional nature and group interactions. Among all of the fabrications, Sekiei seemed t

He was one of the Kumo spectators who attended the Chūnin Exams' final round. He seems to be a very cruel and ruthless individual as he had no qualms kidnapping a child and then threatening to behead her. He was a very stout man with brown eyes, a bald head and a large nose. He wore the standard attire of the Kumo-nin at that time with the exception of his clothes and forehead protector cloth being a bit ragged, as well as his sleeves being very long. He is a rather strong man, as he withstood H

Sekka (セッカ) is a talented medical-nin of Sunagakure. Sekka has dark eyes and thick eyebrows. He wears what is seemingly the standard uniform for medical ninja in Sunagakure which entails a red tunic with a white poncho-like collar which he wears along with a ghutrah and white forehead protector. Sekka is a talented medical-nin who is said to have saved numerous lives in the past. When Kankurō was retrieved from the desert after having been poisoned by Sasori, he along with his pupil, Ryōkan atte

Sekiei (セキエイ, Sekiei) was one of the Kumo spectators who attended the Chūnin Exams' final round. Sekiei showed to be an opportunist, using the chaos created by the Konoha Crush to obtain the Byakugan. He had proposed to his partner that he should kill Hinata Hyūga in order to take her Byakugan back to Kumogakure, meaning that he had no moral qualms about killing the young genin. He also proved to be a cautious individual, not allowing his opponents the chance to catch him by laying a number of t

Sekki (セッキ) is a genin of Iwagakure. Sekki was raised by his elderly grandmother until her passing, during which he would regularly care for her by doing things like massaging her back. Sekki is a very boastful boy, constantly bragging about his abilities. This arrogance also tends to make him careless. Even more, he is shown to make excuses whenever things do not go his way. At the same time, he is in reality very self-conscious, yet very committed to his goals. He cares very much for his villa

Sen (セン) is a kunoichi of Sunagakure and a teammate of Shira and Yome. Sen used to play with Yome and Temari when they were little. While still in the Academy, Sen and Yome watched from afar as Shira was mocked and ridiculed by their peers. Despite being banned from joining the Academy because of his lack of skills in ninjutsu and genjutsu, Shira continued to train himself in taijutsu. Shishio has long dark violet hair that hangs over the front of his face in three parts, a short ponytail, brown-coloured slanted eyes, and hollow cheekbones. His outfit consists of a blue scarf, light green shirt and dark green pants. He also wears a dark blue Suna forehead protector. As a sensor type ninja, Shishio is able to produce a sensing seal on the ground that acts as a radar, letting him observe a large radius ar
