fields.en_description: Shisui Uchiha (うちはシスイ, Uchiha Shisui), renowned as "Shisui of the Body Flicker" (瞬身のシスイ, Shunshin no Shisui, English TV: Shisui the Teleporter), was an Anbu from Konohagakure's Uchiha clan. Graduating from the Academy during the Third Shinobi World War, Shisui was placed on a genin team alongside his best friend. Immediately after the war ended a year later, Shisui witnessed his friend die on a mission, consequently awakening the Mangekyō Sharingan as he felt responsible. A year later, he met a

en_general_infos.Height: Part ii: 180  cm1.8 m  5.906 ft  70.866 in

fields.en_description: Shitō Akimichi (秋道シトウ, Akimichi Shitō) is a jōnin of Konohagakure's Akimichi clan. Like other members of the Akimichi clan he is very robust, also, like most members of his clan he wears a samurai-like outfit with the kanji for "food" (食, shoku) on the front and has distinctive markings on his cheeks. He wears his short brown hair in a topknot ponytail style. He showed skills in his clan's secret techniques when he used the Partial Multi-Size Technique in his fight against Pain. He was also seen

Shizuka (シズカ) is a kunoichi and the current leader of the Nadeshiko Village. She was destined to marry a student of Jiraiya that can defeat her, because of a law from her village. While still training under her mentor, Shizuka developed a relationship with a merchant named Sagiri, despite the law of her village. While they hoped to one day change that law, Sagiri was one day killed, prompting Shizuka to live solely for her training and duties to the village, resigned to never love again. In the

en_general_infos.Height: Part ii: 168  cm1.68 m  5.512 ft  66.142 in

fields.en_description: Shizuku (シズク, Shizuku) is a citizen from Takigakure. Despite Shibuki's well-known cowardice, she did not lose faith in him, and sees him as a true hero and leader. Shizuku has short neck-length brown hair and has her bangs hang down over the left side of her face just above her left eye. She also has long sideburns and two pigtails. She has grey-coloured eyes. She wears a pink vest-like zip-up dress with a yellow outline on the bottom and a pair of black knee-length tights underneath it. She and

Shizuku (シズク) was a kunoichi who hailed from the Land of Demons and appeared in Naruto Shippūden the Movie. She, like her teammates, was very overconfident in her abilities and can get easily carried away, abusing the extra chakra with overly powerful techniques simply to show off. She would often mock and trick her enemies. She has been described as an embodiment of irresponsibility. She apparently held the same goals as Yomi. Shizuku had fair skin, orange shoulder-length hair, and black eyes o

en_general_infos.Height: Part ii: 161 cm1.61 m  5.282 ft  63.386 in

fields.en_description: Shizuma Hoshigaki (干柿屍澄真, Hoshigaki Shizuma) is a missing-nin of Kirigakure's Hoshigaki clan. Shizuma was once a teacher at the Kirigakure Academy. During a sparring match between Kagura Karatachi and another student, Kagura quickly went into a frenzy, nearly killing the student. Shizuma stepped in to take the blow, saving the student. While all the others quickly rejected Kagura, viewing him as a monster like his grandfather, the Fourth Mizukage, Shizuma secretly applauded Kagura's bloodthirsty

Shizune (シズネ) is a jōnin of Konohagakure. An apprentice of Tsunade, Shizune became a talented medical-nin under her tutelage. She accompanies Tsunade during her years-long sabbatical from active shinobi duty, only returning to Konoha once Tsunade becomes its Fifth Hokage. She assists Tsunade in the duties of Hokage, a role she has continued to serve for both the Sixth and Seventh Hokage as well. Shizune is the niece of Dan Katō, a renowned shinobi of Konoha. Some time after her uncle's death, Ts

en_general_infos.Team: Konoha special mission platoon orochimaru search team (anime only) logistical support and medical division
en_general_infos.Occupation: Hokage's assistantcaptain of the logistical support and medical division of the allied shinobi forces

fields.en_description: Shojoji (ショジョジ ), renowned as Shojoji of the Corpse Clone (屍分身のショジョジ, Shikabane Bunshin no Shojoji), is a missing-nin and the leader of the Mujina Bandits. At some point, Shojoji became a missing-nin, formed the Mujina Bandits and was listed toward the top of Konoha's Bingo Book though his identity remained largely unknown thanks to his kinjutsu. Sometime in the anime, he had infiltrated a secret facility in Amegakure with the intention of robbing it, only to have encountered members of Kara in

Shura (修羅) was the acting leader of the criminal group Shinobazu. Shura was a very greedy and cruel man. He would even beat a child if it meant he'd get what he wanted. Shura had long brown hair and small eyes. He has red markings on his face, one on his chin and the other going across his face over his nose. He also wore headgear, his standard clothing, and he is also seen with an umbrella on his back which he uses as a weapon. Shura's weapon of choice was an umbrella, which he was rather adept

Shukaku (守鶴), more commonly known as the One-Tail (一尾, Ichibi), is one of the nine tailed beasts. It was last sealed within Gaara of Sunagakure, after being sealed in two other jinchūriki before him. Shukaku and the tailed beasts first came into being in the waning days of Hagoromo Ōtsutsuki, who used his Creation of All Things Technique to divide the Ten-Tails' chakra into nine separate bodies and giving each a name. Some time after being created, the Sage explained to the young tailed beasts t

en_general_infos.Jinchūriki: Bunpuku gaara obito uchiha naruto uzumaki

fields.en_description: Shun (シュン) is a shinobi from Konohagakure. A prideful warrior, Shun seems earnest in proving his abilities on the battlefield. Shun had shoulder-length brown hair, with bangs that frame his face, he sports the standard Konoha flak jacket. He wears a black forehead protector with the Allied Shinobi Forces insignia. During the Fourth Shinobi World War, Shun was assigned to the Second Division under Kitsuchi's command. During the war, Shun was deployed to aid Naruto Uzumaki, Killer B, Kakashi Hatak

Shōseki (ショウセキ) is a citizen of Konohagakure and the apprentice of weapon maker Iō. He is an apprentice of Iō, and is helping him in his weapon-making job. He often complains about hard work. One time he mistakenly sold Gameru and Kusune two ninja weapons Iō created: Tsurukame and Dakō, in order to increase their budget. Shōseki is a bespectacled boy with dull, black hair, small dark eyes and a rather broad face. He dons a red, high-collared jacket over a blue kimono shirt along with a simple, b

Shū (シュウ) belongs to the owner of a motel where Naruto and Jiraiya stay during their search for Tsunade. Shū is a small cat with white fur and light-coloured eyes. He has a brown tail and a circular-shaped brown fur marking right above his right eye. When Naruto sees him playing with a water balloon, he gets the idea to use two hands to create the spinning motion for the Rasengan. Masashi Kishimoto may have named this cat after his own cat, Shu.

Shū (シュウ, Shū) is the son of the daimyō of the Land of That, a country near the Land of Fire. Shū attended an eating contest alongside Chiyo and her father, the daimyō of the Land of This. During the contest, Tatewaki told Shū that it was time to train, so they went practising kendō with two wooden swords. The samurai's experience was higher when compared to Shū's, and he was therefore having lot of trouble fighting back, until Chiyo appeared and stopped Tatewaki by telling him that he shouldn't

Sora (ソラ, Sora) is a young girl from the Tonika Village. Sora was a child in Tonika Village before it was attacked. During its destruction, she was rescued by Dokku along with two other children before leaving their home and meeting up with Leo and Miina along the way to Hachō Village. Sora appears to be a well mannered and considerate girl, thanking the stall owner on behalf of their group and later being seen washing Miina's back in the open air bath. She shows great love towards her new famil

Seiten Taisei Son Gokū (斉天大聖孫悟空, literally meaning: Great Sage Equalling Heaven Son Gokū), more commonly known as Son Gokū (孫悟空) or simply the Four-Tails (四尾, Yonbi), is one of the nine tailed beasts. It was last sealed within Rōshi of Iwagakure. Son Gokū and the tailed beasts first came into being in the waning days of Hagoromo Ōtsutsuki, who used his Creation of All Things Technique to divide the Ten-Tails' chakra into nine separate bodies and giving each a name. Some time after being created,

Sora (ソラ) is a monk in training from the Land of Fire's Fire Temple. He is also a pseudo-jinchūriki of Kurama. During the Nine-Tails' attack on Konohagakure, some of its chakra was scattered throughout the village. Sora's father, Kazuma, collected the chakra, and sealed it into Sora's body, five years after the attack, to produce a partial copy of the Nine-Tails, turning Sora into a pseudo-jinchūriki. As a child, Sora's only known family was his father Kazuma, who he looked up to greatly and wan

en_general_infos.Height: Part ii: 164  cm1.64 m  5.381 ft  64.567 in

fields.en_description: He was the Sky Ninja Executive (空忍幹部, Sora-nin Kanbu) from the Land of the Sky. From what little was seen, he was the only Sky ninja that didn't underestimate his opponent and did not laugh when Konoha gave the illusion of only sending Sai to counter attack their assault. He proved to be decisive, as he ordered an immediate attack on the assaulting Konoha shinobi. He had grey-brown eyes, flat brown hair, bushy brown eyebrows, and a mole near his left eye. He wore the standard Sky shinobi outfit

Soul Tao (ソウル・タオ, Sōru Tao) is an Academy student of Konohagakure. Soul is a rather energetic girl who tries to follow everything that happens in the life of the class. She is also short-tempered and unable to reconcile for a long time, going so far as to refuse to study with Ehō Norimaki when they were at odds, but after her teacher helped her understand the pointlessness of the conflict, she accepted it. Soul has an incredible admiration for Might Guy, keeping his picture in her locket. Soul i

He is the daimyō of the Land of Rice Fields, otherwise known as the Land of Sound. In a bid to gain power and increase his status, he began changing the policies of his country leading Orochimaru to set up a hidden shinobi village in the otherwise peaceful land. He would do whatever it took to gain power and a higher status. He has a short crop of black hair and dark-coloured eyes. He has thick eyebrows and a moustache.

The Spirit Beast was an ancient demon that was sealed away long ago. Genshō Ryūdōin attempted to revive this beast. The Spirit Beast was once a normal giant catfish that had the ability to mould chakra. At some point, it was sealed away within the Valley of Evil. The Spirit Beast took the form of a gigantic purple catfish with arms and many crab-like legs. It had yellow eyes and long barbels. It wore a large green beaded necklace around its neck and had markings on its body. One of its most dist

He is the mason who carves the faces of Hokage on the Hokage Rock. He seems to be dedicated to his occupation, as he goes to great lengths to carve a perfect replica of his subjects' by studying their face and even dreaming about them. Further dedication to his work is shown, as he became furious when Danzō Shimura had died in battle before he could even begin carving his face into the monument. He has a short crop of black hair forming side burns that connect into a very short beard. He also ha

He is the assistant of a stone carver. He has short brown hair and black eyes. His bangs hang in-between and down the sides of his eyes. He wears a yellow helmet with a tannish-coloured strap holding it on his head. Before the stone carver could carve the Sixth Hokage Candidate's face into the monument, he informs the stone carver that Danzō is dead. Before Kakashi Hatake could attend an emergency meeting with the Fire Daimyō, he helps the stone carver to make preparations for his stone carving

Suguro (スグロ) is a thief that was part of Jako's gang. He is a rather cruel person who respects Jako and follows his orders. Suguro has short, somewhat spiky, dull, black hair and wore a green, v-neck shirt, emblazoned with his group's symbol, a simple obi around his waist, brown pants and sandals. He also carried his manriki-gusari strapped to his sides. Surguro has shown himself to be extremely proficient in the use of manriki-gusari, even wielding two at once with great dexterity. He seemed to

Suien (水煙) was a jōnin-level missing-nin from Takigakure. Suien was a power-hungry shinobi that would even hurt and kill people from his former village to gain power and get what he wants. He describes himself as being a very impatient man. Suien was also very condescending and brutal towards his opponents, even if they were once his students. Suien had long spiky hair, small dark eyes, and a goatee. He wore a dark blue jacket, grey pants, sandals, and a bandanna that held his hair out of his fa

Suigetsu Hōzuki (鬼灯水月, Hōzuki Suigetsu) is a shinobi from Kirigakure's Hōzuki clan. Heralded as the Second Coming of the Demon (鬼人の再来, Kijin no Sairai), Suigetsu dreams of gathering all the swords of the Seven Ninja Swordsmen of the Mist. This dream was cut short when he was captured by Orochimaru, but by joining forces with Sasuke Uchiha he finds an opportunity to resume his pursuit. Suigetsu was born in Kirigakure and was reputed alongside his brother, Mangetsu, to be the incarnation of the de

Suika Kannonji (観音寺スイカ, Kannonji Suika) is a kunoichi of Konohagakure who works at the Mission Assignment Desk. Suika has shoulder length pink hair and black pupiless eyes with brown eyebrows. She has ribbons shaped into a flower on the left side of her head. She wears a lavender blouse with puffed sleeves and a violet skirt. Main article: Genin Mission Arc Suika appears in this arc. Main article: Versus Momoshiki Arc Suika appears in this arc. Main article: Jūgo Arc Suika appears in this arc. M

en_general_infos.Height: Boruto movie: 170  cm1.7 m  5.577 ft  66.929 in

fields.en_description: Suiko (水虎) was a shinobi from the Takumi Village and a member of the Four Celestial Symbols Men. Like many minor villains in Part I, Suiko was overconfident about the power his shield provided, and believed nothing could breach its defences. This presumption led to his death at the hands of Gaara who managed to tear through it. Like all members in his team, Suiko was single-minded about his goals, using any method he thought necessary to achieve them. Suiko was by far the largest of his group. A

Suika (スイカ) was a jōnin of Takigakure who defected and became a bandit. Suika was a very apathetic individual showing little or no interest in the fact that he was being pursued or even his pursuers. He had also displayed a brutal side, willing to kill the young shinobi after they tracked him down. Suika had a head of short green hair, black, heavy-lidded eyes and no eyebrows. He wore a sleeveless black shirt, an obi around his waist, a pair of pants, sandals and a sleeveless, high-collared, blu

Suiren (スイレン) is a kunoichi from Amegakure and a teammate of Ajisai and Fuyō. Suiren, if need be, would help ninja from other villages if it meant that her and her teammates would survive. Suiren has long, dark green hair emerging from beneath her forehead protector, which is worn in a bandanna style. She has a slim face, which she mostly covers with a black mask. Her attire is completed by a light purple poncho worn over a violet kimono with a brown orange sash, and bandages around her arms and

Suiren (スイレン, Suiren) was a kunoichi of Kirigakure. Ten years prior to the formation of the Allied Shinobi Forces, Suiren was part of Ganryū's team that was tasked with retrieving a scroll along with a team from Iwagakure taken by Kumogakure shinobi. After retrieving the document, Suiren was excited for the prospects of peace that a mission like this would bring. She was, however, wrong as Iwagakure betrayed them. After Junsai was killed, Suiren sacrificed herself in order to protect Ganryū. Thi

Suiu (翠雨) is a genin from Amegakure. Suiu has spiky black hair and black eyes. He wears a green scarf around his neck, a light grey jacket. He wears a black Amegakure forehead protector and the symbol is on the left side of his head. Suiu showed skill with Water Release, being capable of, in cooperation with his comrades, using the Grudge Rain technique against many foes at once. He also proved capable of deceptive manoeuvres, having created a rock slide and following in the shadow of the rocks

Sukune (スクネ) was a villager of the Genjutsu Tree Village. Sukune was a brave man who never gave up hope of defending his village against Kandachi. He died trying to defend his village. His son Tanishi at first detested him, but when he saw the meaning of his death, began to love him. He was buried in the village's graveyard. He is known to be respected in his village. He was a brave individual who died defending his village. Jiraiya noted that Sukune was a kind man. Sukune had long black hair an

Sukeza (スケザ) is a miner from Katabami Gold Mine. Sukeza lived in fear of Raiga and his men. He hated being helped by anyone because of what Raiga would do to him. He was so afraid of them that he would go as far as to beat himself up to make it look like he was attacked. Sukeza is an gaunt old man with the top of his head being bald and long neck length grey hair coming from the sides of his head and the back. He has small black eyes. He wears a tannish-coloured v-neck shirt. When Naruto and Tea

Sukima (スキマ) is a genin of Konohagakure. Sukima seemed to be afraid of powerful shinobi as seen when he was expelled from the test for cheating five times. Sukima has long brown hair that hangs over to the right side of his face. He wears a green, high-collared shirt and matching pants along with sandals and bandages strapped to his left leg. Sukima takes part in the first phase of the Chūnin Exams. He is the first person to be caught cheating five times, causing him and the rest of his team to

Sumaru (スマル) is a genin from Hoshigakure. Like the other ninja of Hoshigakure, Sumaru takes part in star training, a technique which allow incredible chakra control, at the expense of severe physical health damage. He appears to be one of their more prodigious practitioners, being able to perform some of the more advanced techniques of star training at such an early age. Sumaru is told that his parents, Natsuhi and Hotarubi, were killed in battle guarding the fallen star, when in reality, they s

Sukui (スクイ) is a medical-nin from Konohagakure. Sukui is a kind, serious and pragmatic individual. While not cruel, she demanded that Yūgao pursue Hayate, even though they were lovers in the past, believing that the recovering of the KIA scroll is more important for the outcome of the war. Sukui is of short build and has a head of short, brown hair, and violet eyes. She wears a pair of red, ¾-frame glasses along with the standard attire of the Konoha-nin and the Alliance's forehead protector whi

Sumashi (スマシ) was a tokubetsu jōnin of Iwagakure. He and his group attacked Team Minato during the Third Great Shinobi War after they broke into Iwagakure territory. Congratulating the young shinobi for achieving this feat, he then attacked Kakashi after he and his teammate, Rin Nohara had managed to escape the landscape that had killed their team member, Obito Uchiha. Sumashi was; however, presumably killed after Minato Namikaze teleported to his team's side after being alerted that the kunai h

Sumire (スミレ, Sumire) is a wife and mother of two. Sumire has short neck-length blue hair. Main article: Tenchi Bridge Reconnaissance Mission She visits the same hot spring as the new Team 7 to alleviate the fatigue of childcare. She laughs at Naruto Uzumaki's argument with Sai. "Sumire" (すみれ) means "foundation".

Sumure (スムレ) is a resident of Nagare Village in the Land of Redaku. Main article: Kakashi Retsuden: The Sixth Hokage and the Failure Boy Sumure acts out a legend of the Sixth Hokage with Nanara: Sumure plays the Hokage and Nanara plays Zabuza Momochi. Sumure does not fully understand how all of the Hokage's jutsu are supposed to work, leading him to incorrectly try using Earth-Style Wall as an attack and then confusing kunai for ninken. Nanara, a personal fan of the Sixth Hokage, is appalled tha

Sumire Kakei (筧スミレ, Kakei Sumire), born Sumire Shigaraki (信楽スミレ, Shigaraki Sumire), is a kunoichi of Konohagakure's Scientific Ninja Weapons Team and a former member of Team 15. After Danzō Shimura died and the existence of Root and its actions were made public knowledge, all its members became ostracised by the village, including Sumire's family. This contributed to Sumire's mother growing ill and later dying. The loss affected Sumire deeply, as one of the few joys she experienced was spending

Suname (スナメ) was a chūnin of Sunagakure. He had short brown hair that was mostly concealed under a ghutrah. He wore the standard attire of the Suna-nin, which included its flak jacket and its forehead protector. He also had small dark-coloured eyes. Suname served as a scout who watched the skies above Sunagakure. He was killed by one of Deidara's explosive clay spiders during the course of his watch.

He is the captain of the assassination squad from Sunagakure who were ordered to assassinate Gaara. He is a rather violent person who hates Gaara, believing that such a force should not exist. Therefore, he did not hesitate to accept a mission to assassinate him from the elders of Sunagakure, who adhere to the same direction. He also showed aggression towards the Konohagakure shinobi, although he and his comrades declared that they would not interfere in the mission of friendly countries. The ca

Susuki (ススキ) works in Tanzaku Quarters. She works with the equally beautiful Momiji, but she believes herself to be more beautiful. Susuki has long brown hair and brownish-coloured eyes. She wears a light purple and white kimono and black stockings. She also wears a white belt around her kimono. She and Momiji both keep Jiraiya company while he is spending Naruto Uzumaki's money.

Suzaku (スザク , Suzaku) was a minister in the Land of That, ages before the establishment of ninja. Suzaku visited the Land of Ancestors to confer with its lord, Tenji. The Land of That claimed to have discovered an ancient document that determined a lake in the Land of Ancestors' territory near their border actually belonged to the Land of That. Suzaku wished to have control of it turned over to him, and would return in a few days for Tenji's answer. He also mentions having heard of Kaguya. A few

Susuki (ススキ, Susuki) was one of Shion's bodyguards. Susuki was highly devoted and loyal to Shion, as he forced himself to stay awake for three days for guard duty, and only went to rest when ordered to. As with the many guards, he was willing to give his life for the priestess' sake, despite being forewarned of his impending death, and even jumped in front of a barrage of projectiles to protect Shion. Susuki was a stocky man with a wide face, beady eyes, and neck-length brown hair that thickly c

en_general_infos.Height: Part ii: 175 cm1.75 m  5.741 ft  68.898 in

fields.en_description: Suzaku Nara (奈良スザク, Nara Suzaku) is a shinobi from Konohagakure's Nara clan. He wears his hair in a high ponytail with the ends styled into what resembles horns. He also has a small goatee, faint lines around his mouth and wears the standard uniform of a Konoha shinobi. Like all members of the Nara clan, he is able to manipulate shadows. He demonstrated aptitude with the Shadow Imitation Technique, able to bind Naruto before he was able to get any further after escaping the Falls of Truth. Main

Suzume (スズメ) is a chūnin from Konohagakure. She primarily serves as a teacher at the Academy. When Ino and Sakura were in the Academy, Suzume taught their kunoichi class, wherein they learned how to pass themselves off as normal women when undercover. Though not much has been seen of her personality, Suzume has been described as a crybaby and a germaphobe. Suzume has long, curly, black hair and wears oval glasses along with makeup, wearing red lipstick. Her outfit consists of a simple pink kimon

Suzu Sōgi (双儀すず, Sōgi Suzu) is an Academy student of Konohagakure. She is the twin sister of Ran. She is a rather curious girl, any news about his classmates picking up her interest. She also acts in sync with her brother, simultaneously and with the same facial expressions, surprised by another rumour. She and Ran are competitive with one another, and yet still close to each other as they are apprehensive about spending time apart. Suzu is a short girl with purple eyes and shoulder-length red h

Suzumebachi (スズメバチ) was an Iwagakure kunoichi and the leader of the Kamizuru Clan. The Kamizuru clan fell from grace due to conflict with the Aburame Clan of Konohagakure in the past. Like the Aburame clan, the Kamizuru focused on the utilisation of bugs in their techniques. They sought the legendary bikōchū in the hopes it would help in the revitalisation of their clan. Suzumebachi's grandfather, the First Tsuchikage, then hid away his forbidden secrets so they couldn't be used against the clan

Suzuran (スズラン) is a shinobi, in contract with the Himeyuri Company, that fought in the Coliseum. Suzuran is a young, light-skinned individual with long violet hair, a small part of which is tied in a ponytail at the back of his head, and dark green eyes. His outfit consists of a white tunic, over which he wears a red robe, with a yellow belt tied around his waist. Suzuran also wears a pair of white gloves, dark blue pants, and dons shinobi sandals, with his ankles being wrapped in cloth. Main ar

en_general_infos.Affiliation: Himeyuri company"himeyuri company" is not in the list (allied shinobi forces, akatsuki, root, kara, pale blue valley, daidai village, aburame clan, academy, advanced technology research institute, akagahara, ...) of allowed values for the "affiliation" property.

fields.en_description: Sāra (サーラ) was the former queen of Rōran before it was destroyed. Sāra was born to Sēramu, the Queen of Rōran. When she was a child, her mother was approached by a man called Anrokuzan who convinced her to use the power of the Ryūmyaku, an ancient chakra flow deep underground Rōran, to build huge towers in the kingdom. When Sēramu found out that Anrokuzan was only using her for his own purposes, he murdered her secretly by stabbing her in the back. Sāra became the Queen in her deceased mother's

She is the daughter of the last queen of Rōran, Sāra, before it was destroyed and therefore in extension, making her the granddaughter of Sēramu. She is a kind young girl. She would kindly talk to suspicious looking strangers. She bears a striking resemblance to her mother, but her hair is lighter in colour. She wears an orange robe with a navy blue outline, violet irises, and a tan and green bandanna around her forehead. After Team 7 leaves Rōran's ruins, she appears before them, saying that sh

Sēramu (セーラム) was the mother and predecessor of Sāra as the Queen of Rōran. Sēramu lived a happy life with her daughter as the Queen of Rōran. They usually sang together while she played her harp. One day, a man who introduced himself as Anrokuzan convinced her to use the power of the Ryūmyaku and his technology to make Rōran grow with thousands of towers for the sake of the people. However, Sēramu realised she was being used by Anrokuzan. Refusing to help him any further in his ambitions, she w

Sōma (走馬) is a demon that consumes memories from its victims. Four-hundred years ago, Sōma almost destroyed the Daidai village, leading them to waste away. It was confronted by a shrine maiden named Kuen. She managed to seal the demon inside of her body. However, with the rapidly draining memories in her, Kuen failed to slice off both emerging horns to complete the seal. Instead, it was sealed in a nearby rock with a portion of it staying within Kuen. Sōma's curse left Kuen forever purged of her

Sōsetsu Kazahana (風花早雪, Kazahana Sōsetsu) was the previous daimyō of the Land of Snow and the father of Koyuki Kazahana. Sōsetsu used to tell his daughter about the beauty of the spring season, and that she would one day see it in the Land of Snow, where it was forever winter. To this end, he created a generator to warm the climate and bring Spring to the Land of Snow. This generator is considered to be the Kazahana treasure, and is activated by a hexagonal crystal, which is considered the key.

Sōsha Amino (網野ソウシャ, Amino Sōsha) is an Academy student of Konohagakure. A very upbeat and talkative girl, Sōsha is quite gossipy, frequently updating others on recent developments. She is a rather informed person, readily telling her class-mates what she knows about their higher profile members. She has great interest in uncovering mysteries, but is likewise easily scared into running away from the challenge. As a writer for the Academy paper, she takes her job on it very seriously, acting as a

Sōzu (ソウズ) is a gambler from Tanzaku Quarters in the Land of Fire. His den is one of the many visited by Tsunade off of whom he made a fortune. He normally proceeds to spend it all around Tanzaku Quarters. On another of her visits he and his cohorts could barely contain themselves and were very grateful for the money that Tsunade had lost to them. It would appear that Sōzu likes gambling greatly and even more so when he wins. He was overjoyed that the Legendary Sucker had entered his gambling de

Sōta (ソウ太) is a young citizen of Konohagakure. During Pain's assault on Konoha, Sōta's leg got trapped under some rubble and one of the Animal Path's Giant Centipede was bearing down on him. He was saved by Moegi who reunited him with his mother. Sōta has a head of short brown hair and dark eyes. He wears a simple blue kimono with a yellow sash around his waist.

Taiko Uchiha (うちはタイコ, Uchiha Taiko) was a character in Jiraiya's novel within Tsunade's Infinite Tsukuyomi dream. Taiko believes that by harshly punishing criminals and villagers, the motivation for further crimes gets prevented early, thus justifying his ruthless behaviour towards thieves, but also defenceless villagers. Like a lot of his comrades, he thinks that Fugaku Uchiha's policies are too soft and favours his admired lieutnant Sasuke Uchiha's harsh methods. His loyalty to his clan led hi

Tadaichi (タダイチ) was a retired Konohagakure Anbu. Tadaichi lost his wife early in his life, leading to him visiting Yamanaka Flowers regularly to buy flowers to place at her grave. Tadaichi appeared to be a kind man. He referred to himself as being an impatient individual. Ino Yamanaka stated he would never betray his village implying he was a very loyal person. Tadaichi was an older man. He had short grey hair that was balding and ran into a full beard and moustache. He has small dark-coloured e

Tagitsuhime (タギツヒメ) is an inhabitant of the Ryūchi Cave. Tagitsuhime appears to be more ruthless than her cohorts, as she attacks Boruto abruptly and without warning. However, like the other two, she shows respect to those who pass the three trials. Although appearing to be one, Tagitsuhime is not a human. When disguised as one, she has fair skin and dark hair that is tied into a single bun on top of her head, which then transitions into a ponytail reaching her back. She wears a long, loose-fitt

Taiki (タイキ) was a citizen of the Land of Water. Having not been born on land, Taiki had lived most of his life in open waters. During his years of sailing, he would occasionally encounter pirates, but managed to get by, from either evading or bribing them. Taiki was a middle-aged man of tan complexion and grey hair. He wore a typical fisherman's attire. Taiki was a carefree man with a passion for boating. He was apparently somewhat of a drunk from his constantly flushed face. Despite this, he wa

Tagorihime (タゴリヒメ) is an inhabitant of the Ryūchi Cave. Although initially presenting herself as a kind host, Tagorihime is, in fact, an individual who seeks to eat the chakra of those who wander into the Ryūchi Cave. However, she still shows respect towards those who may pass all the trials. Although appearing to be one, Tagorihime is not a human. When posing as one, she has fair skin and dark hair that is tied into three buns, with one on the front of her head and two on the back. She wears a

Taiseki (タイセキ) was a jōnin from Iwagakure. During the Third Shinobi World War, he led a team with Kakkō and Mahiru, using their superb diversionary tactics to attack the enemy. With his Hiding with Camouflage Technique he was able to approach his enemies from their blind spot, easily killing them with a single strike. They confronted Team Minato, led by Kakashi Hatake, during the Third Shinobi World War, managing to take Rin Nohara hostage. Using his Hiding With Camouflage Technique, he was able

Taisa Amagiri (天霧タイサ, Amagiri Taisa) is a ninja from Yumegakure's Amagiri clan and the son of Gensui Amagiri that appears in Naruto Shippūden: Kizuna Drive. A loyal and proud shinobi of Yumegakure, Taisa was dedicated to avenging his comrades after the attack of the Fake-Nine-tails and supposed death of his father. He is headstrong and confident, shown by his willingness to rush into battle alone, and is also a highly skilled shinobi for his age, as he is able to use advanced techniques. Taisa w

Taji (タジ) was an Anbu and medical-nin of Konohagakure. As Biwako Sarutobi's disciple, Taji was assigned to aid her with delivering Kushina Uzumaki's baby, making Taji one of the few people to know of the special conditions surrounding the delivery. However, shortly after the delivery, both women were killed by Obito Uchiha. Taji had shoulder-length brown hair and eyes. When she assisted with Naruto's birth she was seen wearing a standard medical outfit, which consisted of a high-collared outfit

Tajiki (タジキ) was a shinobi from Kumogakure. Tajiki admired the Fourth Raikage and worked hard with weight training. He was focused during battle, and it appeared as though he was somewhat overconfident in his abilities. Tajiki has thick black eyebrows and small black eyes. He had a large physique and towered over many other shinobi. He wore the standard attire of a Kumogakure shinobi, including flak jacket and leg guards. He also wore the forehead protector of the Alliance in a bandanna style. T

Taizō (タイゾウ) was an inhabitant of the Land of Ancestors and a close friend of Asura Ōtsutsuki. Taizō, Asura and their friends often met to play around their village. One time, Taizō initiated a hunt for a giant boar roaming around their village, but the group got surprised by the animal's size and decided to flee. Having climbed up a tree, Taizō urged Asura to defend himself with ninshū, but Asura was unable to do so. After his dog Shiro sacrificed itself, Asura's older brother Indra Ōtsutsuki c

Tajima Uchiha (うちはタジマ, Uchiha Tajima) was a member of the famed Uchiha clan during the war-torn era, preceding the era of hidden villages. Initially a father of five sons, Tajima lost three of them in battle against the Senju, and was left with Izuna and Madara at the time of his introduction. He made an appearance on the battlefield alongside his son Izuna after finding out that his other son Madara was meeting with Hashirama Senju on a regular basis. Thinking along the same basis as his nemesi

Takajō is saddened when he receives the news that Danzō Shimura would be the sixth Hokage. Takajō has shoulder-length blond hair over which he wears a bandanna-style forehead protector. He wears the standard attire of the Konoha-shinobi without the flak jacket. He also has small black eyes. In the aftermath of Pain's assault on Konoha, he and his teammates collect and distribute communications to and fr

Takanami Senka (撰歌高波, Senka Takanami) is a genin from Kirigakure. Like his brothers, Takanami sports blue hair and a standard, striped light blue Kirigakure uniform, with a sword attached to his back. Takanami is able to produce two shadow clones. Main articles: Boruto: Naruto the Movie and Versus Momoshiki Arc Having travelled to Konohagakure to participate in the Chūnin Exams, Takanami alongside his younger brother and Makinami raced towards the exam venue alongside the other participants. Byp

Takamaru (タカ丸) is a messenger hawk for Sunagakure. Takamaru looks like a normal hawk with brown plumage and brown eyes. The inside of his wings is beige, and both his beak and his legs are a dull yellow. He is seen wearing a grey message bag on his back held by a strap around his neck. Takamaru is stated as being Sunagakure's fastest messenger bird — only rivalled by his son Tobimaru. Main article: Kazekage Rescue Mission He's first seen when carrying a message to Konohagakure, saying that Gaara

Takishi (タキシ) was a prisoner at Orochimaru's Northern Hideout. Takishi was very arrogant and hated to lose. Even when fatally injured, he would continue to mock his enemies. Takishi wore the typical attire of all Orochimaru's prisoners which consisted of a white T-shirt and a matching pair of pants. He also had short messy black hair and black eyes. After being defeated by Hebi, he mockingly warned Suigetsu Hōzuki of the dangers involved in releasing Jūgo. Even though Suigetsu claimed that they

Taku (タク) is a young Konoha citizen. Taku has a crop of brownish-coloured hair and black eyes. He wore a light green shirt under an orange vest, shorts and sandals. While watching a group of ants making their way through the village with some food, Taku was unable to hold his urine any more and relieved himself. This caused the ants to scatter.

Tamae (たまえ) is a citizen of Konohagakure. Tamae is a very caring individual as seen when she ceased running from the Akatsuki's Giant Centipede summon to help her grand-child. Tamae is a short, older woman with neck-length, light-brown hair with part of it held in a small bun towards the back. She has black eyes and wears a white apron-dress with a long-sleeved shirt underneath it. Tamao (タマオ) is a woman who took place in the eating contest organised in the Land of This. Tamao was one of the Chōji's opponents during the eating contest in the Land of This. Tamao passed the first two rounds of the contest and went to the final round, in a duel with Isono and Chōji. The duel consisted in eating barbecue. She decided to eat as fast as possible and used the technique "Double Chopsticks" that allowed her eat with two chopstick with both her hands. Finally, she was in third place

Tamaki (タマキ) is a young girl who works at a shop in an abandoned city along with her grandmother, Nekobaa. They live with a lot of cats, including talking ninneko such as Denka and Hina. She would later move to Konohagakure to settle with several cats. In the anime, it was shown that Team 7 was assigned to collect the last paw print for the Paw Encyclopaedia which she brought to her grandmother. Also, she and her grandmother helped Team 7 by lending them cat ears to sneak into the Cat Fortress o

Tami (たみ) is a young citizen of Konohagakure. Tami is a sweet, young girl that was very thankful to Sakura Haruno for healing her abrasion. She has short, brown hair that mostly hangs around her face with the rest tied into a bun on top of her head, covered by a hair-cloth. She wears a short, green and blue dress with shorts and a pair of sandals. Tami was seen telling her grandmother to hurry as she ran through the streets of Konoha. When Pain's assault began, a giant centipede summoned by the

Tanishi (タニシ) is a young boy from the Genjutsu Tree Village. Kandachi, a missing-nin from Amegakure, attacks and takes over the village. Tanashi's father Sukune stands up to protect everyone, but Kandachi uses Conch Whip and kills Sukune. Tanishi yells out to his father and tries to stop Kandachi but is restrained by Kandachi's followers. Before meeting Naruto, Tanishi didn't seem to believe in himself, but this changes after Kandachi is defeated. Tanishi has purple hair and light brown eyes. He

Tango (タンゴ) is a Kumogakure shinobi. Tango has somewhat slanted eyes and a fairly flat nose along with dull-black hair concealed underneath his forehead protector which he wears like a bandanna. He wears the standard outfit of the Kumogakure shinobi inclusive of the one-strap-over flak jacket. During the Fourth Shinobi World War, he was assigned to the Surprise Attack Division. After his division mobilises and finds a good location, Kankurō instructs Tango to set up a chakra transmission antenna

Tanuki Shigaraki (信楽タヌキ, Shigaraki Tanuki) was a researcher of Root. Sometime after joining Root, Tanuki eventually became one of Danzō Shimura's most trusted followers. For one of his projects, he was put in charge of researching Hashirama Senju's cells to create Gozu Tennō — an ultimate weapon to further Root's own form of peace and order. Years later, when Danzō was killed, this resulted in Root being fully disbanded. The subsequent investigation of the division forced Tanuki to abandon his w

Taruho (足穂) was Shion's assistant and bodyguard. Taruho was very loyal to Shion, being willing to die for her and waiting on her hand and foot, while taking her constant complaints and apparent ungratefulness obediently and without resentment, such as apologising when she threw away good food that she demanded in the first place for the most trivial matters. Taruho's loyalty was based on Shion's best interest at heart, and would not such he would blindly follow orders completely, as when she att

fields.en_description: Tanzō (タンゾウ) is a genin from Konohagakure. He was seen to be generally worried about his comrades, as well as of losing. Tanzō has short black hair and wears his forehead protector around his neck, covering his chin. He also wears a high collared shirt that was half black and half grey along with a pair of grey pants. Tarui (タルイ) is a kunoichi of Kumogakure. With her appearance and sharp gaze, Tarui overwhelms everyone around her with a different atmosphere and contends with a clear state of mind. Tarui has dark skin (light in the manga), yellow eyes and considerably long blonde hair which reaches to her ankles, with two long bangs framing her face. Her attire is typical of a Kumogakure ninja, with white flak jacket and dark-coloured undershirt and pants. Her sleeves are mismatched, with the left sleeve being

Taruto (タルト) is a pastry chef in Konohagakure. A citizen of the new city in Konohagakure, Taruto had a longtime friendship with old town resident Ohagi, taking part in the old town's festival fireworks display, and going on trips with them. As they were also both chefs, they developed a dango shortcake, which drew from their areas of expertise. When the new city decided to put on their own fireworks display, they put Taruto in charge of it, creating a rift between Taruto and Ohagi. When Taruto a

Tarō (タロウ) is a Konohagakure genin and a student failed by Kakashi Hatake. Put in a team with his brothers led by Kakashi, Tarō is assured by his restrained older brother to eat the lunches their teacher left out. Having exactly followed his orders, Kakashi fails Tarō and his brothers. Sometime later, Tarō and his brothers thank Kakashi for sending them back to the Academy, as they realise what he was trying to teach them, much to his surprise. Tarō did not like any of Kakashi's training methods

Tasuki (タスキ) is a shinobi of Konohagakure. Tasuki is a square-faced man with a large nose. He wears the standard Konohagakure shinobi outfit, including a green flak jacket and a bandana. Tasuki is able to perform cooperation ninjutsu to use barrier ninjutsu. Main article: Kawaki Arc Upon Shikamaru Nara being notified that an enemy appeared in Konoha and disappeared with the Naruto Uzumaki, the Hokage's assistant had Tasuki and other shinobi come with him to the Hokage's residence. After Shikamar

Tatewaki (タテワキ) was a former samurai from the Land of Iron who later served as a retainer to the daimyō of the Land of This. Tatewaki left his homeland at some point, becoming a rōnin, and took up a lifestyle as a hired mercenary. He later went to work for a small nation known as the Land of This as a bodyguard to its daimyō and his daughter Chiyo. During the nations annual food-eating contest, he was assigned to guard the kidnapped son of another daimyō named Shū. He would regularly train Shū i

fields.en_description: Tatsuma Aburame (油女タツマ, Aburame Tatsuma) is a former member of Konohagakure's Anbu faction Root, and a member of the Aburame clan. Tatsuma was with Danzō Shimura and Orochimaru while they were talking to Nonō Yakushi about protecting the orphanage. Tatsuma is regularly seen sporting the same style as the rest of his clan, consisting of dark sunglasses. His most distinguishing feature is the blue marking on his right cheek. He also wears the standard Konohagakure forehead protector on his forehea

Tatsuji (達治) was an Anbu working in Konohagakure until the day he was lost on a mission. At some point in the past, he was seen by Yamato as an Anbu member. Later, he was sent on a mission in which he pretended to go missing, so he could infiltrate Amegakure to gather information for Danzō Shimura and the village elders. Though working for Danzō, he was visibly afraid when Tsunade gave Ibiki Morino the orders to torture him for intel. Tatsuji has long chin length grey-coloured hair with bangs ha

Tatsumi (タツミ) is a young traveller that Mirai Sarutobi meets in the Land of Hot Water. After the death of her mother - her only remaining relative - Tatsumi began visiting hot springs that her mother had spoken well of when she was alive. While travelling between hotsprings she met Ryūki, who offered to help her see her mother's spirit if she brought him new followers. Tayuya (多由也) was a kunoichi of Otogakure and a member of the Sound Four. In the anime, the Sound Four were originally prisoners of Orochimaru, forced to fight other prisoners to the death in battle royales. By surviving their respective matches, they proved themselves to be the strongest of Orochimaru's prisoners and as such were made his bodyguards. The Sound Four were at some point forced to accept Kimimaro as their leader, who easily defeated them all in battle and, because of his Shikotsumya

Tatsunami (タツナミ) is a criminal from Land of Water. Tatsunami was previously a miner, later leaving that life behind to become a criminal. When gold was discovered on Dotō Island in the Land of Water, he and his accomplice, Sakanami went under the guise of helping mine to steal it. Tatsunami is a rather greedy and cruel person who took advantage of the naive nature of his boss, who did not check his criminal past and allowed him to work. He was very concerned about the success of the gold theft o

Tayori Kuroyagi (クロヤギタヨリ, Kuroyagi Tayori) is a postman of Konohagakure's Central Post Office. Tayori is a kind and hardworking individual who is dedicated to his profession. Tayori has short, spiky brown hair and green eyes. He wears the uniform of the Konohagakure Central Post Office. Tazuna (タズナ) is a master bridge builder from the Land of Waves. Blunt and sometimes harsh, Tazuna has been described as a diligent man. He is also a drinker. Despite deceiving Konoha into believing the mission was less dangerous that it actually was, Tazuna was willing to guilt-trip the shinobi into carrying it through. Even knowing how risky it was to defy Gatō, he was willing to build a bridge that would free his village from his influence and was moved when his grandson also came to defy Gatō

He is the daimyō of the Land of Tea. He is a good man who doesn't hesitate to punish bad people. This is proven when he caught Kyūroku and the minister red-handed for cheating. He has a short crop of black hair and black eyes. He also has a black moustache, goatee, and large ears. Main article: Land of Tea Escort Mission He presided over the Todoroki Shrine Race where the Wagarashi family (mostly Kyūroku Wagarashi) and the daimyō's minister challenged Idate Morino of the Wasabi family led by Jir

fields.en_description: Tekka Uchiha (うちはテッカ, Uchiha Tekka) was a Konohagakure shinobi from the Uchiha clan and an officer of the Konoha Military Police Force. He, Inabi, and Yashiro questioned Itachi about the suicide note that was found with Shisui Uchiha. After presenting Itachi with the alleged suicide note that Shisui had written asking him to request that the Anbu investigate the matter as well. This shinobi is a genin from Sunagakure. He is a proud individual, as is evident from the fact that he doesn't like the idea of being ordered around by Shira. He refuses to accept hand-outs. At the same time, he is willing to admit defeat gracefully and push on soon afterwards to accomplish his goals. He is also very sensible and soberly evaluates his chances, realising that even six against six stronger opponents they cannot cope. He does not have good feelings for Gaara and once again reminds

Tekuno Kanden (感電テクノ, Kanden Tekuno) is a jōnin of Konohagakure. He was assigned to a squad along with Hayama Shirakumo, Kosuke Maruboshi and Naruto Uzumaki to protect the northern boundaries of the village after Suna and Otogakure's invasion of the village. During their mission he was assigned to set traps around the area. Not long after they were ambushed by a battalion of ninja from Iwagakure. Tekuno's traps proved useful in hindering the progress of the ninja but when they had breached these

Teguse (テグセ) is a poor man living in the Land of Waves. Teguse wasn't above stealing from strangers. Teguse has a bald head and small black eyes. He wears a green-coloured hat and what appears to be a black unzipped trench coat. He also has a black moustache. Main article: Prologue — Land of Waves He tried to steal Sakura Haruno's purse, but she mistook him for a pervert and kicked him in the face. Teguse (手癖, also written as "Tekuse") translates into "having sticky fingers" or "compulsive thiev

Tekkan (テッカン) is the current daimyō of the Land of Lightning. Main article: Shikamaru Shinden: A Cloud Dancing in Forlorn Falling Petals Tekkan attended the Five Great Countries Summit, convened in response to the looming invasion of the Land of Flowers by the Land of Earth. Because the Land of Lightning has an alliance with Flowers, Tekkan was opposed to the invasion and believed the justification offered by the Earth's daimyō, Danjō, was insufficient. Danjō retorted that the Land of Flowers wa

Temui (テムイ) is a Konohagakure shinobi. Temui has short spiky, sandy-brown hair. He wears the standard attire of a Konohagakure shinobi and the forehead protector of the Allied Shinobi Forces. Temui, along with a team of Konoha shinobi, were assigned to watch Naruto Uzumaki while he was confined on the Island Turtle. When Naruto escaped from them, Shibi ordered Temui to alert the barrier squad to the direction that Naruto was headed to.

Temujin (テムジン) is a supporting protagonist that appeared in Naruto the Movie: Legend of the Stone of Gelel. Born as the heir of the main branch of his clan, Temujin has the ability to create and seal away the Stone of Gelel. When he was still a child, Temujin's entire village was destroyed by Haido and his followers, as they hoped to find the Gelel Vein, which they thought was in the village. Temujin's parents were killed, but Haido, their killer, spared Temujin due to seeing potential in him, a

Temari Nara (奈良テマリ, Nara Temari) is a former kunoichi of Sunagakure's Kazekage clan. After marrying Shikamaru Nara, she becomes a member of the Nara clan and emigrates to Konohagakure, where she works as a kunoichi for the village. Temari was born the eldest child of Karura and the Fourth Kazekage: Rasa. While it was customary for close relations to a Kage to be a jinchūriki, neither she nor her younger brother Kankurō were compatible with the One-Tail, so Gaara was chosen. In the anime, growing

fields.en_description: This Ten-Tails (十尾, Jūbi) is a juvenile tailed beast in Kara's possession, that is kept immobilised in a dimension only accessible via space–time ninjutsu. The beast largely resembles Earth's Ten-Tails in its first form. While considerably smaller, it is still massive, comparable in size to the nine tailed beasts. It has a large, egg-shaped head with small spikes protruding from the top alongside a single spike on its chin, as well as a large mouth containing human-like teeth and a single eye wi

This Ten-Tails (十尾, Jūbi) is the combined form of Kaguya Ōtsutsuki and the God Tree, created to reclaim the chakra inherited by her sons, Hagoromo and Hamura. It is regarded as the progenitor of chakra, and is tied to the legend of the Sage of Six Paths and the birth of shinobi. To end the beast's rampage, the Sage became the Ten-Tails' jinchūriki and later split its chakra into the nine tailed beasts to prevent it from causing further harm. Centuries later, its revival became the objective of M

fields.en_description: Tenma Funato (舟戸テンマ, Funato Tenma) was a pirate from the Land of Water. He was also the fleet commander for the Funato Clan's Tenma Unit. Tenma was abandoned by his birth parents at a young age. Forced to fend for himself, he would often steal crops from the island he lived on, ostracised by the inhabitants. One day, Araumi Funato and the Funato Clan came to the island to raid it. Tenma was amazed at Araumi's strength when he easily defeated several men at once. He charged Araumi to see his stre

Tenji (テンジ) was an emperor of the Land of Ancestors. Tenji lived before the establishment of shinobi. He served as an emperor from the Land of Ancestors. At the time of his first encounter with Kaguya Ōtsutsuki, his land was at war with the Land of That over disputed land ownership. Unlike his followers and the residents of the Land of That, Tenji desired for peace and tried to avoid direct confrontation with his opponents in order to avoid a war being waged, and wanted peaceful negotiations and

Tenma Kodon (虎呑テンマ, Kodon Tenma) was the leader of the Kodon clan. After the invention of blue fire powder, the Howling Wolf Village wanted to end its status as a hidden village by discontinuing shinobi services. Tenma disagreed with this, as he believed death and violence would always exist and as such it was necessary to have shinobi, who were best-suited to understand that. Tenga (天画) comes from a small country and is a member of the Daimyō's intelligence bureau. Tenga always seems to have a sunny disposition. He is easily excitable and takes great pride in his job and was shown to hold Inoichi Yamanaka in very high regard; visibly flustered when he got to meet him. Tenga has short, black hair that he wears a headband with circular markings around, along with a cream coloured outfit with a blue hood, trimmings and the kanji "tsū" (通) on the back. He also wears a ne

Tenten (テンテン) is a kunoichi from Konohagakure and a member of Team Guy. While initially wanting to be like the legendary Sannin Tsunade, she realised that she did not have the necessary chakra control to be a medical-nin. However, she did not give up on being a powerful kunoichi, putting her all into perfecting her weaponry and fūinjutsu skills. Since her time as a student in the Academy, Tenten had a goal to become a legendary kunoichi like Tsunade, one of the Sannin, which she openly shared to

Because of what seems to be a lavish upbringing, he tends to find certain things beneath his status such as inexpensive tea. He also has issues with being told he's unable to do something and will simply throw money at any obstacles. He speaks to others with respect and generally has a pleasant disposition even when dispar

He was the bodyguard of Tenzen Daikoku and he wielded Zabuza Momochi's Kubikiribōchō. He has spiky grey-coloured hair and small black eyes. He wears white bandages around his forehead. He appeared to be very overconfident in his abilities thinking that he could defeat someone who just took out a small army of armed men. He was skilled in kenjutsu and strong enough to handle the Kubikiribōchō with ease, cutting Suigetsu down with one slash. He could also break through a wall with sheer power. Sui

Tenzen Daikoku (大黒天善, Daikoku Tenzen) was a crime boss who lost many men to the blade of Zabuza Momochi during the latter's attempted coup d'etat of Kirigakure. Looking for revenge years later, he sought out Zabuza Momochi to capture him, but when he discovered that Zabuza was dead he instead plundered Zabuza's blade from his grave in the Land of Waves. He was an aide to the daimyō of the Land of Water and a politician. After being warned by Sasuke Uchiha (under the impression that Sasuke is, in

en_general_infos.Affiliation: Land of water land of waves

fields.en_description: Tenzō (テンゾウ, Tenzō) was a member of the Iburi clan and the younger brother of Yukimi. Tenzō was born into the Iburi clan which was able to transform into smoke. However, their own ability was the biggest threat to the clan as they were unable to fully control it. Due to the danger wind posed to them, they were forced to live in caves. Nevertheless, Tenzō and his older sister Yukimi had to witness many clan members disappear in agony right under their eyes while they were unable to help them. One

Tera (テラ) is a former member of Konohagakure's Anbu faction Root. As a member of Root, Tera was likely trained to lose emotions in order to better accomplish missions. As the Root members each use a codename, it is unknown what Tera's real name is, if Tera even has one. Even though the organisation has been officially disbanded, Tera remains loyal to its head, Danzō Shimura. Tera is extremely loyal to Danzō and follows any and all orders given to him. Even if it means he would have to kill other

Teru (テル) is an underling of Aniki. Teru and Oppo failed to pass the exams at the academy and become genin. They went to different jobs, but each time they were fired, and in the end, when they had absolutely nothing to eat, they joined Aniki. Teru is a rather weak person, obeying Aniki because he took him under his wing, despite being constantly belittled by him, and considers himself a failure. He was scared of retribution when he realised he had also kidnapped the Hokage's daughter. Despite t

Terai (テライ) is a former member of Konohagakure's Anbu faction Root. As a member of Root, Terai was likely trained to lose emotions in order to better accomplish missions. As Root members each uses a codename, it is unknown what Terai's real name is, if he even has one. Even though the organisation has been officially disbanded, Terai remains loyal to its head, Danzō Shimura. Terai is a very loyal shinobi that follows any and all orders given to him by Danzō. Terai wears a light-coloured hooded j

Teo (テオー) is a thief. He is a rather violent yet cowardly person who immediately gave up when they were surrounded by stronger opponents. Like his leader, Teo is greedy and eager to find the Gekkōran flower due to its high black market value. Teo is a man of average height with short brown hair and black eyes. He wears a brown sweater with a lighter brown patch on his belly, pants and sandals, and glasses. Teo and his comrades use traps that have knives in them, with which they even managed to i

Terubō (テルボウ) was one of the orphans at the Konoha Orphanage. Terubō was seen with the other kids at the Konoha orphanage. He was present when Nonō Yakushi was thinking of a name for Kabuto. Terubō wasn't impressed by Nonō Yakushi's idea to name Kabuto after a helmet. He also likes clothing that resembles paper dolls. Terubō has long brown hair and his bangs frame his face. He also has dark-coloured eyes. Masashi Kishimoto named Terubō based on paper dolls.

Tetsuru (テツル) was a prisoner at Orochimaru's Southern Hideout. Tetsuru was stated to have had a great fear of Orochimaru and thus never hoped to escape. He has also been described as being pessimistic about the the future with no hope in his eyes. Tetsuru had short, light brown hair and dark eyes. His head was bandaged and he wore the standard attire of Orochimaru's prisoners which consisted of a plain white T-shirt and a pair of pants. His face was also unshaven, with unkempt stubble. After bei

Tessa (テッサ) is a chūnin of Sunagakure. She finds the speech given by the Fifth Kazekage prior to the mobilisation of the Allied Shinobi Forces very inspirational and shows a great deal of affection towards him. Tessa has shoulder-long, blonde hair that frames her face. She wears the standard Sunagakure flak jacket alongside the Allied Shinobi Forces' forehead protector. She also has black eyes. Tessa, assigned to the Fourth Division, was among all the other shinobi while Gaara gave his speech to

Tessen Togeito (棘糸テッセン, Togeito Tessen) is a tokubetsu jōnin of Konohagakure. Tessen has a short crop of brown hair and dark eyes, under which he sports red triangular markings. He also wears the standard Konohagakure attire complete with flak jacket, forehead protector and bandages around his lower arms and wrists. Additionally, he wields a special shuriken launcher, which is stored in a scroll. Tessen uses ninja tools as his main fighting style. He makes use of a special shuriken launcher, bom

Tetsu (テツ) is a shinobi of Kirigakure. Tetsu had medium-length, slicked-back, brown hair and brown eyes. He wears the standard Kirigakure attire along with the forehead protector of the Allied Shinobi Forces. He wore a black pair of pants with white bandages wrapped around his upper right thigh and a weapons pouch on his lower back. He also wore a normal pair of black shinobi sandals. During the Fourth Shinobi World War, Tetsu had his chakra drained by a White Zetsu Army clone, which allowed it

Teuchi (テウチ) is a citizen of Konohagakure and the owner of Ramen Ichiraku. As a teenager 34 years before the Fourth Shinobi World War, Teuchi devoted his life to making ramen. More than a decade later, he had a daughter called Ayame. Teuchi is a very kind and jovial man. Often seen smiling, he and Ayame have always treated Naruto Uzumaki well, considering him their best customer, sometimes even giving him free ramen on special occasions. He also cares for Naruto as he often asks Naruto what was

Teyaki Uchiha (うちはテヤキ, Uchiha Teyaki) was a citizen of Konohagakure and a member of the Uchiha clan. Teyaki, along with his wife Uruchi were the owners of the Uchiha Senbei shop, a renowned shop within the Uchiha Compound. His shop had been in the family since the rise of Konoha. The recipe of the senbei that gave the shop its fame was a secret passed down through the generations and was closely guarded by Teyaki. He encouraged Sasuke to be a great shinobi on his own, instead of telling him to e

Tezutsu Mikawa (三河テヅツ, Mikawa Tezutsu) is a shinobi from Kumogakure. Tezutsu has fair skin, spiky brown hair, brown eyebrows, and a green teardrop marking tattoo on his left cheek. His outfit consists of a white, rope tied headband with red markings on it, a blue kimono with white trimmings, underneath it is a mesh armoured shirt with a visible red trimming on the top, white bandages on his legs, white shorts with red triangle patterns on them. Tezutsu also has a cannon strapped to his back. Not

Tezuna (手綱) is a hostess at Make-Out Club Battle in Amegakure and Ryūsui's wife. Tezuna seems to be fond of cows given her chosen attire. She appeared to be a kind individual, helping strangers and referring to Ryūsui as her "hubby". She thought of Ryūsui as a bit of a cheapskate, seen when he said he got her a gift and she thought it was another cheap thing from Shibuki Bridge. She, like many others in Amegakure, would attempt to never speak of Hanzō. She has long blonde hair and grey-coloured

He was the Third Hoshikage (三代目星影, Sandaime Hoshikage, literally meaning: Third Star Shadow) of Hoshigakure. When the Third learned of the side effects of the star training after Natsuhi and Hotarubi were caught trying to steal the meteor, he banished the two for their attempted burglary but promised to forbid the star training. Before they left, they asked the Third to tell their son, Sumaru, that they died for their country and not to mourn for their loss. A while later, Akahoshi, Shisō, and Y

The Third Kazekage (三代目風影, Sandaime Kazekage, literally meaning: Third Wind Shadow) was the leader of Sunagakure, and is hailed as the village's strongest Kazekage of his time. After studying the jinchūriki of Shukaku of the time, he recreated its sand-manipulating powers by combining his own magnetic chakra and iron powder, which produced the Iron Sand technique. At some point, Sasori kidnapped and killed the Third Kazekage in order to turn him into a human puppet. According to Sasori, the effo

The Third Mizukage (三代目水影, Sandaime Mizukage, literally meaning: Third Water Shadow) was the leader of Kirigakure. He accompanied the First Mizukage to the first ever Five Kage Summit. There he stood behind the First watching diligently as the proceedings unfolded. He was a tall man with black sclerae, no visible pupils, and long, black hair which reached down to his back with what appeared to be pearl-shaped objects encircling his head. He wore the standard Kirigakure attire complete with pinst

The Three Haimaru Brothers (灰丸三兄弟, Haimaru Sankyōdai, Viz: Haimaru Littermate Trio) are triplet canines from Konohagakure's Inuzuka clan and the companions of Hana Inuzuka. Normally, they are friendly and calm, but their combative spirits arise when a battle breaks out. Being triplets, all three dogs have the same grey fur with white undersides and short pointed ears and mostly resemble Huskies. They have also seemingly grown much larger in Part II since their Part I appearance. As Inuzuka ninke

He was the daimyō of the Land of This. The daimyō was an eating contest's viewer alongside his daughter and Shū. He was in charge to give the prizes to the winners of the contest. During Akatsuki's invasion of his country, he was killed during Sasori's puppet assault. He was a somewhat impressionable man as demonstrated during the food competition. While little was shown of his personality, the daimyō showed a distaste for foods which lost its consistency and turned soft after his tasters were d

These three giant snakes were summoned during the Konoha Crush. The snakes were brown in colour with darker tomoe-like patches all over their bodies. They towered over several structures in Konohagakure including the boundary wall of the village. Each snake wore a red scarf around the base of their heads. In the anime, these snakes are merged together towards their tails. They have yellow green-coloured eyes with a black outlining. These three snakes are huge and very powerful being able to dest

Tobi (トビ, Tobi), nicknamed Guruguru (グルグル, Guruguru, English TV: Swirly) by Obito Uchiha for the swirl pattern of his face, was one of the first victims of the Infinite Tsukuyomi, and eventually was pulled from the Demonic Statue of the Outer Path by Black Zetsu. He was originally a human victim of Kaguya Ōtsutsuki's Infinite Tsukuyomi, who was tethered to the God Tree over the course of years until transforming. He was ultimately stored within the Demonic Statue of the Outer Path, where he rema

fields.en_description: The Three-Headed Guardian Beast, commonly called Three-Heads, is a creature sealed in Yumegakure that appears in Naruto Shippūden: Kizuna Drive. Initially, the Three-Heads appeared as a giant monster with a body similar to that of a lion and three heads. Its skin is mostly white and has dark purple on several places, including the underbelly. It has beige-coloured armour above the main head on which there are several small, red markings and a row of spikes. The other two heads come out of each s

He is an Anbu from Konohagakure. In the anime, he, Kakashi and four other Anbu were tasked with protecting the Third Hokage while he left the village to meet with the Fire Daimyō. En route, his group was attacked by disguised Root members with the intention of killing Hiruzen. During the attack, he fought Kanoto and Kanoe for some time. As their group gained the upper hand, the disguised root members retreated after their failed assassination, but managed to separate the group from Hiruzen. He h

Tobio (トビオ) is a genin of Konohagakure. Tobio appears to be somewhat clumsy as seen when he knocked Naruto into Sasuke on two different occasions. He also seems to not notice the things he does right away but is quick to apologise. He has spiky, black hair that he wears in a ponytail and dark eyes. He wore a grey shirt with blue trimmings on the sleeves and a flap of sorts on the back, a pair of pants along with a Konoha forehead protector. Main article: Prologue — Land of Waves Tobio was in the

Tobimaru (飛丸) is a messenger hawk of Sunagakure. Tobimaru is a hawk with brown eyes and dark-brown feathers, except of those on his chest, face and a rhombus-shaped spot on his forehead, which are coloured white. He wears a grey backpack that features the kanji of his name (飛丸) on the front. Tobimaru, although being merely a rookie, exceeds all expectations in his displayed speed, which is said to be equal to or be even greater than that of his father Takamaru — hitherto Sunagakure's fastest mes

Tobirama Senju (千手扉間, Senju Tobirama) was a member of the renowned Senju clan, who, together with his elder brother and the Uchiha clan, founded the first shinobi village: Konohagakure. Throughout his lifetime, Tobirama would work tirelessly to achieve political stability and implement the institutions that made the village system work, thus ensuring Konoha's continuity and prosperity. After his brother's death, he would earn the title of Second Hokage (二代目火影, Nidaime Hokage, literally meaning:

Todoroki (トドロキ) was the captain of the guards on the ship that was transporting Gantetsu. Years before Naruto Uzumaki, Sakura Haruno and Rock Lee had accepted the mission, the Shinobazu had attacked his home, resulting in the deaths of his parents. Todoroki had seen Gantetsu with his hand over his brother Akio's mouth before flaming debris had fallen into the room the two were in. Believing his brother to be dead, Todoroki had trained hard to prepare for the opportunity to avenge him. Todoroki w

Tofu (斗風) was the village head of Green Banks, as well as the father of Kiri. While the village head, he eventually had a single child in Kiri. His efforts would regularly protect the village from attacks and likewise lead them to prosperity. Eventually he oversaw the building of a bridge that would bring better business. Sometime later, Iori poisoned Tofu as part of a plan to acquire the bridge's deed for the Pale Blue Village, leading to Tofu's daughter taking her father's place as village hea

Tokara (トカラ) is a genin of Konohagakure. During the Chūnin Exams, Tokara and his teammates, Hayate and Ibiki, fought against Team Orochimaru during the second stage. Tokara had short brown hair and black eyes. He wore a simple black outfit along with arm guards and his bandanna-styled forehead protector. He also carried a large gourd strapped to his back.

Tokiwa (トキワ) is a kunoichi and the attendant of Shizuka, the current leader of the Nadeshiko Village. She seems to have a calm and level-headed personality. Tokiwa praises shinobi who are strong and who impress her, as shown when she praised Naruto for being able to dodge Shizuka's attack. She is also very respectful of and to powerful shinobi as she addressed both Jiraiya and Naruto, as well as Shizuka, using honourifics. She is also quite humble, as she knelt before Naruto to ask him to duel S

Toki (トキ) is the daughter of the late daimyō Ōwashi, younger twin sister of Sagi, and the current daimyō of the Land of Birds. Toki grew up with alongside Sagi and Chishima during childhood, where the two siblings often played together by a lake populated with egrets and with Chishima serving as their attendant. She would later stay by Sagi's side following his passing shortly after their father's assassination. Full of grief, Toki nearly committed suicide only for her brother's spirit stopping

Toki (土岐, Toki) was a member of Shinobazu. Toki happened to be rather arrogant and is prone to making jokes while in combat. He, however, was very strategic, managing to lure his bait into a large crater. It was presumed that he had some knowledge in geography, considering he created a man-made canal with his drilling device that caused a current. Toki had a short crop of brown spiky hair and small black eyes, and wears a white-clothed headband. The drilling device he used to perform his Crimson

Tokuma Hyūga (日向トクマ, Hyūga Tokuma) is a shinobi from Konohagakure's Hyūga clan. He was part of the revised Infiltration and Reconnaissance Party. Tokuma is a calm and level-headed person from all indications. He is also selfless, as witnessed in his willingness to sacrifice himself so that his teammates could escape from Akatsuki's Surprise Attack and Diversion Platoon. Tokuma has shoulder-length, spiky brown hair with two long bangs framing either side of his face and the featureless white eyes

Tomari (トマリ) is a former academy student of Sunagakure. In his youth, Tomari used to play with Abiru, Tsuchino, and Kashike around the village. One time, while Tomari was playing football with his friends, they were visited by Gaara who accidentally attacked them while they were trying to run away from him. However, Tomari and his horrified friends were saved by Yashamaru. Still during his time at the academy, Tomari and his friends threw rocks at Shira since he couldn't use ninjutsu and genjuts

Tomaru Minakura (皆蔵トマル, Minakura Tomaru) is a former academy student of Konohagakure. He has long admired ninja and strives to become the next Hokage. Tomaru has a head of short, black hair which juts out at the back. He also has black eyes under which he has two dark markings. Attire-wise, he wears a short-sleeved light-purple kimono shirt which is pleated at the bottom. Around his waist he wears a purple obi along with a black pair of pants, and sandals on his feet. Main article: Kazekage Resc

Tomaru (トマル) is an actor in a soap opera Romy and Jule. While Tomaru outwardly appears to be a kind, humble, polite person, underneath he is extremely petty and superficial. With his coworker Ashina leaving the show, he politely mocks her to her face to rub it in that she's a "has been". Not only that, he has a high attraction to Chōchō Akimichi but only when she's in her Butterfly Mode. When he sees her true form, he can't see that they are the same person and tells her that with a body like he

Tonbee (遁兵衛, English TV: Tonbei) is a member of the Tsuchigumo clan who was left to guard the sacred fortress of his clan. Tonbee is a very calm and collected man with a great sense of duty as well as respect. This was witnessed in his willingness to sacrifice himself to allow Hotaru to escape to safety as well as his unwillingness to abandon the fortress where he was stationed. He is an elderly man with short grey hair, a bristling moustache and dark eyes. He wears a simple, v-neck, long-sleeve

Tonbo Tobitake (飛竹トンボ, Tobitake Tonbo) is a chūnin of Konohagakure and a member of the Analysis Team in the village's Intelligence Division. Tonbo, at first glance, gives off a very collected and cool personality. He is described as being very confident in his abilities, although not haughty enough to not acknowledge someone else's talent. He is also somewhat rash and quick-tempered by nature as witnessed when he roughed up Komaza to get his point across. The upper half of his face is completely

Toneri Ōtsutsuki (大筒木トネリ, Ōtsutsuki Toneri) is a descendant of Hamura Ōtsutsuki and the sole survivor of the Ōtsutsuki clan's branch family on the Moon. Toneri was born into the Ōtsutsuki clan's Branch family, leading to his eyes being sealed within the Energy Vessel at birth; in place of vision, he learned to sense the world around him instead. Growing up with his father on the Moon, Toneri desired human friends, unlike the puppet servants that served his family. On multiple occasions, the two
