fields.en_description: Tonsuke (トンスケ) is a pig. Tonsuke is a rather arrogant pig who knows that he is one of a kind, and takes advantage of this, being ready to climb a person's head without hesitation. He eats only special food, and at a certain time, and completely refuses to help someone if he is not fed. Tonsuke is also cowardly, as he fled in fear after the appearance of the wolves and the transformation of Wasabi Izuno. Tonsuke is a pink pig with salmon pink cheeks. He has a birthmark of his snort on his stomach

Tonton (トントン) is Tsunade's ninja pig (忍豚, Ninton), often kept in the care of Shizune. Above all else, Tonton is a highly devoted, and dutiful pet pig. Her devotion to Tsunade was noted during her master's battle with the other Sannin, which she watched in earnest as Gamakichi and Gamatatsu bickered. This even surfaced during the Fourth Shinobi World War, where, in her earnest to aid the Logistical Support and Medical Division, Tonton carried around several large sized crates around the camp grou

Tora (トラ, Tora) was a member of the Anbu, working directly under the supervision of the Second Hokage. He was one of the Anbu ordered to watch the Uchiha clan to keep them from rebelling again. Tora is likely not his real name, but a codename. Tora wears a black Anbu cloak with what appears to be cat-like ear spots on the top of it and a white cat-like Anbu mask. He was said to be very skilled. Endowed with tiger-like strength and walking ability; any target he aimed for had no hopes of escape.

Tora (トラ) is the cat owned by Madam Shijimi, the wife of the Fire Daimyō. Due to the huge amount of affection Madam Shijimi shows to her, which includes nearly squeezing the life out of the cat, Tora constantly tries to run away. Tora is recognised both times by the red ribbon on her right ear. She has brown fur, with a line running down her forehead with two lines (three in the anime) going across it, and amber-coloured eyes. Main article: Prologue — Land of Waves Team Kakashi was to be sent to

He was the leader of Tonika Village. He appeared to have been very kind, having spent time with his grandchildren and finding joy in hearing about the things they loved. He could also be very strict and authoritarian at times, as he stopped Leo from teasing his sister with one dispraising word. He also seemed to have been very brave and loyal towards his homeland, willingly fighting anyone who threatened it. He was a tall, stately-looking elderly man with white hair and a beard that almost cover

Toroi (トロイ) was a famed Kumogakure shinobi. In the anime, it was stated that Toroi was partnered with Osoi. On one of their missions, Osoi died, but it was reported that he fought to the end. At some point after his death, Orochimaru desired to reincarnate Toroi but ended up reincarnating Osoi instead. Toroi is described as being cautious, careful and discreet. Toroi had tan skin, a rather broad face with chiselled features, characterised by a strong cleft chin and a pair of prominent sideburns

Torifu Akimichi (秋道トリフ, Akimichi Torifu) was a jōnin of Konohagakure's Akimichi clan. Along with his teammates, Kagami Uchiha and Danzō Shimura, he was a direct subordinate of the Second Hokage. In the anime, shortly after the founding of the village, he was shown to be part of a class alongside Koharu Utatane and Homura Mitokado. Later he watched on as Hiruzen Sarutobi and Danzō Shimura were about to spar, along with Koharu and Kagami Uchiha. During the First Shinobi World War he was part of To

Torune Aburame (油女トルネ, Aburame Torune, Viz: Toruné) was a shinobi from Konohagakure's Aburame clan, as well as a high-ranking member of the disbanded Anbu faction Root. Torune's father, Shikuro Aburame, died while he was still young. With no other close family members left, he was taken in by Shino Aburame's family. Due to the unique nature of Torune's insects and his lack of control over them, Torune could not attend the Academy without risking the well-being of his peers. Despite their differe

en_general_infos.Team: Impure world reincarnation allied forces (anime only)

fields.en_description: Toroi (トロイ, Toroi) is a shinobi of Kumogakure. Toroi is an individual that is overconfident in his abilities, proclaiming that he would crush Mitsuki in his match and lost. Toroi is a young bespectacled shinobi with short brown hair over which he wears a bandanna-style forehead protector, and maroon-coloured eyes. Like many of the shinobi from his generation that look up to Killer B, he has a blue tattoo of bull's horn on his left cheek. He wears the standard attire of the Kumo-nin: trademark wh

Tosaka (トサカ) is a researcher who specialises in creating Juinjutsu-based Scientific Ninja Tools. Originally, Tosaka was portrayed as a very eccentric yet friendly man, who shows great passion and effort in his work, even climbing up a tree to return a nest with its young. He feels the best way to understand something is to apply all five senses to it, even going as far as to lick the crudest of things. Later, however, this nature was revealed to be a façade. He has little regard to life, taking

Towa (トワ) is a Konohagakure Anbu operative and a partner to Komachi. He appears exclusively in the video games. Towa always follows orders and he wishes to protect Konohagakure. He also mocks his opponents during combat. He seemed to enjoy fighting. Towa wears the standard attire of a Root member though he isn't of Root. He wears a white Anbu mask with a short bird-like beak and two holes in it for seeing. The mask also has a red flame marking starting from the top left side of the mask going ju

Tsubaki (椿, Tsubaki) is a kunoichi from Konohagakure. Tsubaki was the fiancée of Mizuki. She was well aware of him having met up with Orochimaru, and that he intended to steal the Scroll of Seals as a present to Orochimaru. However, Tsubaki understood the severity of the crime and the potential consequences Mizuki would reap upon himself, especially the intention behind it; she withheld this knowledge from the village, hoping that her fiancé would come to his senses. When Mizuki was defeated by

fields.en_description: Toshi is an academy student of Konohagakure who appears in Naruto Shippūden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 4. Toshi looks up to real shinobi and takes a liking to Shino Aburame. Toshi is a young boy with short brown hair and orange markings on his cheeks. He wears a green hat, a grey long-sleeved shirt and a pair of short pants. While practising jutsu with Yuki, Mabo and Hana, Toshi loses track of time while practising his Cloak of Invisibility Technique. Naruto Uzumaki and Shino Aburame find him and hav

Tsubaki (椿, Tsubaki) is Aoi's mother. She cares very much for her daughter, Aoi, and about the lives of others. Despite losing her husband, Tsubaki still manages to maintain a cheerful outlook on life and is willing to give others advice if they seek it. Tsubaki is also sad that she never got a chance to connect with the Tree of Life like her ancestors had, but overcomes it when she hears of the Tree Revival Village growing the Tree back. She has long pale blonde hair and green eyes. When ill, h

Tsubaki (ツバキ, Tsubaki) is the mother of one of the students in Naruto's class at the Ninja Academy. Tsubaki has long brown hair, with her bangs hanging over her forehead. She also has brown eyes. She wears a long-sleeved white shirt with a black tank-top like shirt over it. Tsubaki seems to hate Naruto and the fact that he has the Nine-Tails inside of him. Main article: Prologue — Land of Waves Tsubaki was glad to see that Naruto, the jinchūriki of the Nine-Tailed Demon Fox, did not graduate wit

Tsubusa (ツブサ) was a chūnin from Sunagakure. Tsubusa had short, black hair and most of his face was concealed by a mask. He wore the standard attire of the Suna-nin inclusive of forehead protector and flak jacket and turban along with a metal face guard. He was said to have excellent eyes and could discover enemy forces several miles away. It was due to this ability that he was tasked to patrol at Sunagakure's gate and was indeed the first one to discover the approaching Akatsuki members, even wh

Tsubaki Kurogane (鉄ツバキ, Kurogane Tsubaki) is a young samurai from the Land of Iron and Mifune's most recent disciple. She is currently an exchange-student in Konohagakure, serving as a member of genin squad, Team 15. When Tsubaki became a student to Mifune, she befriended fellow disciple Sazanka, looking up to his commitment to honing his skills. The frequently trained together and discussed their goals. During a tournament, it was rumoured the winner's prize was the right to claim Kurosawa when

Tsubute Futaba (ふたばツブテ, Futaba Tsubute) is a shinobi from Iwagakure. Tsubute has black hair and eyes, and wears a grey hooded jumper and blue shorts. He also carries his weapon strapped to his back. Not much is known of Tsubute's abilities other than that he wields what appears to be a battering ram. Main article: Chūnin Exam on Fire! Naruto vs. Konohamaru! Tsubute made it to the final stages of the Chūnin Exams, however, it is unknown who he fought during the exam, and what the outcome of that

He is the chief of the hidden village of the Tsuchigumo clan. From what has been seen, he is a very unaccepting person when afraid of something. He has long chin length black hair and dark-coloured eyes. He wears a red vest and a dark shirt under. He also has two grey necklaces around his neck. Main article: Six-Tails Unleashed When Team 7 bring Hotaru back to the Tsuchigumo village, the people of the village aren't pleased to see her again. The chief approaches them seemingly happy to see Hotar

Tsuchino (ツチノ) is a former academy student of Sunagakure. He was the leader of his group of friends, which consisted of Abiru, Kashike, and Tomari. When Gaara tried to play with them one day, they ran away in fear. Gaara accidentally attacked them while trying to stop them with his sand, breaking Tsuchino's leg. Only the sudden appearance of Yashamaru saved Tsuchino and his friends from being completely crushed by Gaara's sand. Another time, Tsuchino and his friends threw rocks at Shira and made

Tsuchinoto (己) is a former member of Konohagakure's Anbu faction Root. To prevent Hiruzen from being reinstated as Hokage, Danzō gave Tsuchinoto and nine other Root members a mission to assassinate him. Disguised as a foreign shinobi, he fought the Anbu accompanying his target, who turned out to be a disguised Kakashi, resulting in the mission's failure. Tsuchinoto would always listen and do what Danzō wanted him to do. Tsuchinoto has long, greyish-brown hair that he wears in a high ponytail. He

Tsuchinoe (戊) is a former member of Konohagakure's Anbu faction Root. To prevent Hiruzen from being reinstated as Hokage, Danzō gave Tsuchinoe and nine other Root members a mission to assassinate him. Disguised as a foreign kunoichi, she fought the Anbu accompanying her target, who turned out to be a disguised Kakashi, resulting in the mission's failure. Tsuchinoe would always listen and do what Danzō wanted her to do. Tsuchinoe has shoulder length purple hair. She wears a standard Anbu attire,

Tsukado (ツカド) is a master swordsmen of an unnamed clan who had a vendetta against a man that killed a relative of his, Shikazo. Tsukado is a rather persistent person who tried to take revenge thirty-four times without deviating from this path, but at the same time he was tired of revenge, just wanting to return home to his mother and father, being ready to deceive other people that he did take revenge. Tsukado is also a very kind and perceptive man, but sometimes he does not understand the words

Tsukiko Kagetsu (花月月子, Kagetsu Tsukiko) is the daughter of Tōbei Kagetsu. She had left the Kagetsu Family residence five years before the funeral. At the beginning she was very greedy and only returned to her clan when she thought she could get a portion of her father's money because of his fake death. At the end of the funeral ceremony when Tōbei revealed that he faked his death so that his kids could find humour in life, she understood and found her humorous side. Tsukiko has oddly shaped purp

Tsukino (月野), also known as the Masked Kunoichi (仮面のくノ一, Kamen no Kunoichi), is a kunoichi as well as the current head of Tsukigakure who appears in the story mode of Naruto Shippūden: Ultimate Ninja Heroes 3 and was controlled by Shinga. Naruto explains his relationship with Tsukino to Kakashi Hatake, Sakura Haruno, and Sai when Sai remarks that Sakura acts like a sister to him. During Naruto's training with Jiraiya, he was left in the care of Tsukino for a period of time, in which they grew cl

Tsukiyo (ツキヨ) was the lieutenant and the second-in-command of the Mujina Bandits. Tsukiyo became a member of the Mujina Bandits, working his way up to second-in-command. At some point however, when both Tsukiyo and his boss, Shojoji, were cornered by a group of shinobi, Shojoji consumed Tsukiyo's brain through the Corpse Clone Technique to take his form in order to preserve the gang's reputation by preventing the boss' capture from being publicised. While unknown personally, based on Shojoji's p

Tsukune (ツクネ) is an academy student from Konohagakure. Tsukune is a troublemaker playing pranks on his instructors along with his fellow classmates, Sansho and Mibuna. Like Naruto in his youth he pulls pranks so that he can be acknowledged to the point he even stole what he thought to be the Scroll of Seals. He appears to be a bit of an airhead as he easily fell for Iruka's taunt and admitted to the vandalism. Later, because of Iruka, Tsukune wants to become the Hokage and surpass Naruto. Tsukun

He was Tsukino's father and the former village head of Tsukigakure. In Naruto's flashback, he told Tsukino to get rid of the bandits that were lurking around the village. But instead, Naruto got rid of the bandits for Tsukino. After his death from an incurable illness, Tsukino succeeded him as the village head. He was an older man with long white hair. He has dark-coloured skin and light-coloured eyes.

Tsukushi (ツクシ) was a prisoner at Orochimaru's Northern Hideout. Tsukushi was a very daring man being extremely confident in his abilities to the point where he would fight anyone no matter how strong they may be. Tsukushi had long green hair with small black eyes that have a dark yellow-coloured outlining and wore the common attire of the inmates at the Northern Hideout. He, like many others, received a cursed seal in the course of Orochimaru's experiments. When activated, the seal spreaded acro

Tsume Inuzuka (犬塚ツメ, Inuzuka Tsume) is a tokubetsu jōnin of Konohagakure, and a member of the Inuzuka clan. Her canine companion is Kuromaru. At some point, she apparently scared off her lover and was left to raise her children alone. When her son Kiba was a little boy, she gave him Akamaru as his canine companion. Tsume is a very tough woman often seen scolding Kiba for his actions, such as not taking his training seriously when he was younger as well as telling him not to underestimate the ene

Tsunami (ツナミ) is a citizen of the Land of Waves. Her husband died shortly after Inari's birth, and when Kaiza entered her life as a father figure for Inari, she couldn't help but invite him into her home. Like everyone else in the city, Kaiza's death broke her spirit. In the following years, she tried to protect Inari from the painful memories of losing his stepfather. She has been described as obliging. She also loves "prettiness". Tsunami also seems to be a very loving mother. Tsunami is a wom

Tsuru Itoi (糸井つる, Itoi Tsuru) is a genin of Konohagakure. She is a member of Team 40. Tsuru is a calm and responsible girl. At the same time, she has an interest for attractive boys and a fondness for cute animals. Tsuru has long black hair, pulled back in a high ponytail with a lavender ribbon, and dark-coloured eyes. She wears a black crop top, complete with a black skirt, and a yellow jacket over it. After becoming a genin, her attire changes to a collared yellow jacket with a black bodysuit

Tsunade (綱手) is a descendant of the Senju and Uzumaki Clan, and is one of Konohagakure's Sannin. She is famed as the world's strongest kunoichi and its greatest medical-nin. The repeated loss of her loved ones caused Tsunade to later abandon the life of a shinobi for many years. She is eventually persuaded to return to Konoha and take on the mantle of Fifth Hokage (五代目火影, Godaime Hokage, literally meaning: Fifth Fire Shadow), where her skills prove invaluable to the village. Tsunade is the grand

fields.en_description: Tsurugi (ツルギ) was the head of Kirigakure's hunter-nin. He was a calm and level-headed man as seen when he readily and rationally decided to speak to Utakata and Yamato in private. He even tried, albeit unsuccessfully, to convince Utakata to return to Kirigakure. He had long black hair and beard and bore a scar over his left eye. He wore the standard attire of the Kirigakure ninja which included a flak jacket, shinobi sandals, a black Kirigakure forehead protector and a mask as he was a hunter-ni

Tsuyu is a fictional character in service to Shuku Village from The Tale of the Utterly Gutsy Shinobi novel written by Jiraiya. She is featured as the novel's main heroine and main supporting character to Naruto Musasabi. She also appears to be written as Naruto's love interest for the novel. At age six, Tsuyu graduated from Shuku Academy and was placed on Team Shū under Shū's leadership alongside Naruto and Renge Momoashi. Naruto almost immediately developed romantic feelings for her, but she w

en_general_infos.Affiliation: Shuku village"shuku village" is not in the list (allied shinobi forces, akatsuki, root, kara, pale blue valley, daidai village, aburame clan, academy, advanced technology research institute, akagahara, ...) of allowed values for the "affiliation" property.

fields.en_description: Tsurushi Hachiya (蜂谷釣糸, Hachiya Tsurushi) is a genin of Kirigakure and was a follower of Shizuma Hoshigaki. During his time in the Academy, he was one of the few people who befriended Kagura Karatachi. Whereas most people dreaded his blood-ties to the infamous Fourth Mizukage, Tsurushi came to treat Kagura as an equal. After graduating and becoming a genin, he learned of and came to admire the "Bloody Mist Village" era. From this, he fell into a bad group, becoming a delinquent himself. Tsurushi

Tsuzumi (ツヅミ) is a police captain from the Land of Forests. Tsuzumi has short black hair and violet eyes. He also has small circular eyebrows and a small circular moustache. Tsuzumi carried a sword, hinting at some skill in kenjutsu. Tsuzumi oversaw the delivery of Gantetsu back to the Land of Forests' capital for trial because of his crimes. The "Tsuzumi" (鼓) is a Japanese drum of Chinese and Indian origin.

Tsuzumi (ツヅミ, Tsuzumi) was a follower of an Ōtsutsuki Cult. Tsuzumi was a faithful follower of Boro, and grew worried upon hearing of his death. He was aware of some of the cult's secrets, such as the usage of viruses to deceptively recruit more followers. However, he claimed to know nothing of Kara. Tsuzumi was an elderly man with grey eyebrows and a beard that split apart at the bottom. He wore all white robes and a matching pointed hood. Main article: Kawaki Arc Konohamaru Sarutobi and Sai in

Tsuzumi Sarugaku (申楽ツヅミ, Sarugaku Tsuzumi) is a chūnin of Konohagakure. Not much is known about Tsuzumi's past. The anime revealed that he entered the Academy at the same time as Kakashi Hatake and others. Tsuzumi has a happy demeanour and is usually seen smiling. He enjoys hearing and watching the going-ons in the Chūnin Exams. Tsuzumi has spiky brown hair and small black eyes. He wears the standard Konoha shinobi outfit complete with flak jacket and forehead protector. During the final rounds

Tsuzura Shitakiri (舌切ツヅラ, Shitakiri Tsuzura) is an apprentice caretaker to the famed Senri Hawks. Being raised solely by his business-obsessed mother, Tsuzura spent all his time in her establishment, unable to make friends. Instead of going to school, Mozu decided to teach him personally to groom him as the successor to her business, despite refusing to teach him things like reading and writing. At some point, Tsuzura found a rare, white hawk chick that was injured. He cared for and raised it as

Tōbei Kagetsu (花月藤平, Kagetsu Tōbei) is a medicinal herb salesman from Motoyoshi Village who faked his own death. He and his family were poor and he often joked to bring some happiness to their lives. One day, he found some medical herbs on their mountain which he used to make a fortune in wealth. The clan prospered, but he became dissatisfied with the way the clan became focused on wealth. Because of this, Tōbei, with the help of his youngest daughter Mai Kagetsu, faked his own death to unite th

Tōfu (トウフウ, Tōfu) is a self-proclaimed ex-bandit. Tōfu was very self-confident and would call himself an ex-bandit to try and strike fear into others. He has brown hair that normally spiky above the forehead, long sideburns, a uni-brow, and big ears. He is also seen to always be squinting. Tōfu's appearance strongly resembles a monkey. Although claiming to be an ex-bandit, he was actually a spy working for a gang leader, as his double agent in the village. His major work involved gathering infor

Tōka Senju (千手桃華, Senju Tōka) was a kunoichi of the Senju clan prior to the founding of the hidden villages. She was a close and trusted associate of Hashirama during the time before Konohagakure was founded. Tōka had light-coloured eyes, an oval face, and wore a very stoic expression. Her dark hair was tied in an elaborate and intricate top-knot, and a dark shade of lipstick, with a long bang covering the left side of her face. She also wore a dark suit with the standard armour of that time ove

Tōjūrō (トウジュウロウ) is a senior of Sunagakure, holding the number two position of the Suna Council. In his youth, Tōjūrō was a talented shinobi, but, in his waning years, he retired to a seat on the Suna Council a few years before the start of the series, eventually earning the number two position. In Ebizō's declining health and eventual retirement as head of the council, Tōjūrō has made it clear that he desires to become the new head. Tōjūrō is highly ambitious, desiring to become the head of the

Tōu (トウウ) was once a member of the Twelve Guardian Ninja, appearing to be the only female member of the guard. When she was still alive, she was part of the Twelve Guardian Ninja. Ten years before the start of the series, six of the members tried a coup d'etat. She, alongside Asuma Sarutobi, Chiriku, Kitane, Seito, and Nauma, fought against them, only to be killed by Kazuma when she and the three other survivors tried to use Limelight on him. Tōu has black hair and yellowish eyes. She wore a pai

Ugatsu (ウガツ) was a shinobi from Amegakure. As a remnant of the former Amegakure loyal to Hanzō, he and two other Amegakure remnants snuck back into the village to try and kill Pain. He was presumably killed during the failed attempt. Before Pain overthrew Hanzō, Ugatsu was a loyal shinobi of his. Ugatsu attempted to assassinate Pain out of revenge for Hanzō's death. Ugatsu had short spiky dark-coloured hair and dark-coloured eyes. He wore an Amegakure forehead protector that came down in the bac

Udon Ise (伊勢ウドン, Ise Udon) is a shinobi of Konohagakure, and the leader of Team 5. As a child, Udon was an easy-going and quiet individual. He usually looks very sleepy, and is always seen with a drip of snot hanging from his nose. Udon has stated many times that he loves math, as he is sometimes seen writing math problems during class. As an adult, he is a very collected and straight-forward man who is shown to be keen minded and perceptive. As a teacher, he has a strict but fair teaching style

The Ultimate Summoning Beast (究極の口寄せ獣, Kyūkyoku no Kuchiyosejū) was a mixture of different summoning animals that inhabited the animal summoning facility. It was created to be a perfect counter against other shinobi. The researchers of the facility created the creature to be the ultimate summoning. When Honoka tried to seal it, the creature started devouring the researchers and killed Honoka. The creature afterwards started absorbing the other summoning animals on the island and went into a chry

Ubau (ウバウ) is a pirate and the leader of the Sea Route of Silence Gang. Ubau is a deceptive man witnessed by his posing as a harmless farmer in the town Naruto and his bodyguards stopped and offering the young man produce which contained a deadly mushroom. This also displayed the fact that Ubau is also quite intelligent as he was able to carry out this plan under the nose of several of Konoha's top-brass ninja. Ubau has dull purple hair which is combed back and brown eyes. When first introduced,

Ugai (ウガイ) is a medical-nin of Konohagakure. Ugai has been described as both serious and methodical. Ugai is a young man with dark, brown hair and dark eyes. He wears the standard uniform of the hospital medical ninja which consists of a high-collared cream-coloured outfit and what appears to be a medical hat. Noted as an inexperienced, yet knowledgeable, medical-nin, Ugai has basic knowledge of medical treatments and medical ninjutsu, as well as good chakra control in general. He helped Might G

Unagi (ウナギ) is a former academy student of Konohagakure. He was a very close friend of Hibachi's and despite thinking that his insults and tricks on Naruto were mean he found them funny. He was a bespectacled boy with long brown hair. He wore a blue track suit, with a yellow collar and a white shirt underneath, a pair of pants, sandals and a green band around his forehead. When Hibachi tricked Naruto into going in the hills for an item from a corpse, Hibachi tells him that there were still ninja

Unkai Kurama (鞍馬雲海, Kurama Unkai) is a shinobi from Konohagakure and a member of the Kurama clan's branch family. Overall, he cared about his clan above all other things, even his niece Yakumo's life. After the death of her parents, he petitioned with fellow clan members to have Yakumo killed. The Third Hokage denied their requests, and it seems they have given up on them. Unkai has been shown to be a decisive man, willing to take lethal action against threats towards the Kurama clan, even if th

Unmo Samidare (五月雨ウンモ, Samidare Unmo) was a jōnin from Kirigakure. Unmo was known for his animosity against Konohagakure, and therefore, Root deemed him a potential threat to the village. As such, Sai was dispatched to assassinate Unmo. Unmo was known for his strong feelings against Konohagakure. Unmo was a man with round eyes and dark markings around his eyes (in the anime, they were more like wide, snake-like eyes). He wears the standard attire of the Kirigakure shinobi inclusive of the villag

Umibōzu (海坊主, literally meaning: sea bonze) was a creature used by Amachi to terrorise the Land of the Sea. Umibōzu looked pretty much like a giant water formation with spots that looked like two eyes and a mouth. It was light blue in colour and translucent. Umibōzu itself is nothing more than a gigantic mass of water, that has been gathered, and held together by the summoner's chakra. Being made completely of water, it is virtually indestructible unless it is completely evaporated. The creature

Urakaku (ウラカク) is a samurai from the Land of Iron and one of Mifune's right-hand-men alongside Okisuke. Urakaku can be described as a very solemn and dutiful individual as see from him carrying out his assigned tasks to the letter without hesitation. He has black hair which he wears in a traditional chonmage style, thick, black eyebrows and similarly coloured eyes. He also has a prominent scar located just above his right eyebrow. His attire during the Kage Summit consisted of a simple grey kimo

Urashiki Ōtsutsuki (大筒木ウラシキ, Ōtsutsuki Urashiki) was a low-ranking member of the Ōtsutsuki clan's main family, sent to assist Momoshiki and Kinshiki on their mission to investigate Kaguya's whereabouts and gather the chakra of the God Tree on Earth. Compared to his comrades, Urashiki had been shown to have a rather laid-back and jovial personality. He was quite willing to joke along with Momoshiki and Kinshiki, and disparaged on how serious they are. However, Urashiki was nevertheless loyal to h

Uroko Kurama (鞍馬ウロコ, Kurama Uroko) was a member of the main branch of the Kurama clan. She was also the wife of Murakumo Kurama and the mother of Yakumo Kurama. Uroko's daughter and only child, Yakumo, was born with the full scope of the Kurama Clan's Kekkei Genkai, but also with a weak and frail body. As the Kurama clan had produced few ninja where once they were one of the more prominent clans in Konohagakure, Uroko's husband Murakumo was eager to remedy this predicament sought to change the c

Uruchi Uchiha (うちはウルチ, Uchiha Uruchi) was a citizen of Konohagakure and a member of the Uchiha clan. She and her husband Teyaki were renown as small bakery owners located in the Uchiha compound. She was one of the many people in the Uchiha clan who encouraged Sasuke to be like his big brother, Itachi. She and her husband were later killed during the Uchiha Clan Downfall. She had black hair, tied in a knot on top of her head. She also had small black eyes. She wore a brown full body dress. The ow

Urushi (ウルシ) is a former shinobi of Konohagakure, and a caretaker at the village's orphanage. At some point in time, Urushi along with some other children and Nonō Yakushi from an orphanage, found a young boy under a tree wounded. After she had healed him, Urushi assisted the young boy in getting back to the orphanage with them. The next day, he stated that it was odd for someone to have no name, and as such the nun decided to call him Kabuto after the helmet Urushi put on Kabuto's head. Over th

en_general_infos.Affiliation: Konohagakure konoha orphanage allied shinobi forces

fields.en_description: Urushi (ウルシ, Urushi) is a ninken and a personal summon of Kakashi Hatake. In the anime, after they made a contract with Kakashi, Urushi and the other ninken aided him to search for the abducted Rin Nohara by the Kirigakure shinobi and acted as a diversion in order to allow them to flee. They also helped searching for the fleeing Orochimaru. Urushi has white and light-brown fur, along with long spiky tufts of hair on his head. His eyes greatly resemble traditional Japanese angry eyes. Being one o

Utakata (ウタカタ) was a missing-nin from Kirigakure and the jinchūriki of the Six-Tails. At some point, Utakata became the jinchūriki of the Six-Tails, Saiken. At first a loyal shinobi of Kirigakure, he left the village during the "Bloody Mist" era, and in the manga at some unspecified time either before Gaara's capture by Deidara, or some time in between Gaara's capture and the capture of Yugito Nii by Kakuzu and Hidan, Utakata was captured by the Akatsuki, as after Yugito was sealed, according to

fields.en_description: Ushi (ウシ) was an Anbu member of Konohagakure who served under the Second Hokage. He was one of the Anbu ordered to watch the Uchiha clan to keep them from rebelling again and he did so vigilantly. Ushi was vigilant in his duties. Ushi wore a black Anbu cloak and a white Anbu mask over his face with a big triangular purple mark on the mask's forehead area. As an Anbu, he was one of Konohagakure's strongest shinobi. The fact that he was tasked with the very important and difficult mission to obser

Uō (ウオウ) is a chūnin of Konohagakure. Uō has short, brown hair and dark-coloured eyes. He wears a black forehead protector and a Konoha flak jacket. Uō is able to send a gust of sharp wind at his enemies using Wind Release. He carried a Bō staff and is able to duplicate the weapon. Main article: Mitsuki's Disappearance Arc While on guard duty with Saō at Konoha's main entrance, the pair were attacked by two and took Mitsuki with them before dawn, leading to the guards going into a coma and being

This woman was the secretary to Victor at his medical manufacturing company and an Outer of Kara. She was very loyal to Kara and content with her place in the organisation, reprimanding a doctor for asking too many questions. In battle, she was shown to be very sadistic, mocking her foes anguish and relishing the idea of causing more harm. At the same time, she was shown to be reckless, often underestimating her opponent. She was a young woman with dark skin, red and black hair and purple eyes.

Victor (ヴィクタ, Vikuta) was an Inner from the secret organisation Kara. Formerly a shinobi, he became the president of a huge medical care manufacturing company in the Land of Valleys. In the anime, Victor took part in the Fourth Shinobi World War, costing him his right leg and right eye. After the Allied Shinobi Forces's victory in the war, Victor secretly harvested some fragments of the dead God Tree. Afterwards, Victor returned to the Land of Valleys, where he spent years establishing a new med

en_general_infos.Affiliation: Kara allied shinobi forces (anime only) land of valleys (anime only)

fields.en_description: He is the daimyō of the Land of Valleys. He is a person who wants the best for his country, being willing to put his trust in Victor and his company for this. However, he was disgusted when Victor's human experimentation was revealed to him, showing he has a sense of morality. The Valleys Daimyō is an elderly lord, he has grayish hair combed back and a large mustache of the same colour. He usually wears a blue-toned tunic. Main article: Kara Actuation Arc The daimyō arrived at Victor's company w

He is the headman of an unknown village that was being terrorised by Baji and his gang of bandits. He seemed to generally care about his family no matter how far apart in relation they may be. He is an older man with neck length grey hair and he wears a pair of circular glasses. He called the assistance of Team 7 and Team 10 to help him stop Baji and his gang after his granddaughter was kidnapped. In the end, the combined teams saved his granddaughter and stopped Baji.

The White Snake Sage (白蛇仙人, Hakuja Sennin) is the leader of the snakes of Ryūchi Cave. At some point, Orochimaru discovered the location of Ryūchi Cave through his study of Jūgo's unique powers, and began studying there to master Senjutsu under the White Snake Sage. Unable to attain Sage Mode, he instead developed an alternate method of harnessing his senjutsu chakra through cursed seals. Sometime after injecting himself with Orochimaru's remains, Kabuto Yakushi discovered Ryūchi Cave and receiv

Waraji (ワラジ) is a samurai from the Land of Waves. He and his partner Zōri were mercenaries hired by Gatō to be his personal bodyguards. Waraji is an individual that seemingly lives for the rush of killing others or simply fighting and has been stated to desire to fight anyone that gets his blood rushing. He seems like a belligerent and cruel person who kills out of sheer boredom. On his way to Tazuna's house, he cut several trees and animals, and expressed wishing to skin Tsunami. Waraji is of t

Watase (ワタセ) is a genin from Konohagakure. Watase is a somewhat stubborn individual, seen from his wanting to participate in the Fourth Shinobi World War despite being too young. He is also very ambitious, and believed that connections no longer made an individual a hero, or Hokage-worthy but it was in fact, their contributions on the battlefield, citing Naruto as an example. After his encounter with Konohamaru, he now believes in the Will of Fire. He is popular as his peers apparently find him

He is the former daimyō of the Land of Water. He seems to be very cautious as he was hesitant to give his approval for the Allied Shinobi Forces, fearing that it would give the shinobi too much power. He wears a light-yellow kimono along with the traditional daimyō headgear. He has small black eyes. Main article: Five Kage Summit During a meeting of the Five Great Shinobi Countries' daimyō he was cautious that the alliance would give shinobi too much power. This prompted the Earth Daimyō to sugg

Wasabi Izuno (伊豆野ワサビ, Izuno Wasabi) is a kunoichi from Konohagakure's Izuno Clan and a chūnin from Team 15. Growing up, Wasabi often heard stories from her grandmother about their clan and their most powerful secret technique. While initially impressed by them, she came to notice that each time her grandmother told them, she would make their jutsu sound grander, and came to believe it was only a made-up story. Wasabi is a direct person who is not afraid to speak her mind, she is motivated and hy

White Zetsu (白ゼツ, Shiro Zetsu) was half of the Akatsuki member Zetsu (ゼツ, Zetsu), the other being Black Zetsu. He was one of the first victims of Kaguya Ōtsutsuki's Infinite Tsukuyomi, and was eventually pulled from the Demonic Statue of the Outer Path by Black Zetsu, and infused with the DNA of Hashirama Senju by Madara Uchiha. White Zetsu was originally one of the victims of Kaguya Ōtsutsuki's Infinite Tsukuyomi, who was transformed after being tethered to the God Tree over the course of years

fields.en_description: He is the current daimyō of the Land of Wind, replacing the former wind daimyō. He is a large man, with squinty eyes. In comparison to his face, his nose is rather small and inconspicuous. He has a thin moustache and a small pointed chin-beard. He also wears a necklace with a white sphere-shaped charm on it. Main article: Five Kage Summit During a meeting of the Five Great Shinobi Countries' daimyō he was the third daimyō out of the five, who consented to allow the Allied Shinobi Forces to offic

He is the former daimyō of the Land of Wind (風の国の大名, Kaze no Kuni no Daimyō). The former daimyō of the Land of Wind has been described as being deeply religious and hedonistic. He is also quite frugal, as he reduced funding for Sunagakure, the village of his land, and outsourced many jobs to the less expensive Konohagakure; this led him to be highly unpopular with Suna's citizens, leaving them to believe he was trying to get rid of them and attempted a revolution to induce fear into the daimyō b

Ōga (オウガ) is a former Inner from the organisation Kara. Ōga was initially created as the eighth Inner to serve as a research partner for Amado Sanzu's experiments. When his research on the human heart hit a dead end, Amado augmented Ōga's brain so she could assist him in unlocking its mysteries. When she attempted to research Jigen's heart, he considered it an act of treason, destroying part of her brain before she could flee. This injury caused her to no longer have a will to live, and her body

Ōnoki (オオノキ, Viz: Ohnoki), renowned as "Ōnoki of Both Scales" (両天秤のオオノキ, Ryōtenbin no Ōnoki, English TV: Ohnoki the Fence-Sitter), was the Third Tsuchikage (三代目土影, Sandaime Tsuchikage, literally meaning: Third Earth Shadow) of Iwagakure. When he was an adolescent, Ōnoki was tasked with cleaning his village's Stone Monument. As he did so, his grandfather, the First Tsuchikage, came and spoke with him. Ōnoki, who believed that the First was just a cheap old man to have such a simple thing as the s

fields.en_description: Ūhei (ウーヘイ) is a ninken and a personal summon of Kakashi Hatake. In the anime, after they made a contract with Kakashi, Ūhei and the other ninken aided him to search the abducted Rin Nohara by the Kirigakure shinobi and acted as a diversion in order to allow them to flee. They also helped searching for the fleeing Orochimaru. Ūhei greatly resembles a greyhound. He is auburn in colour with a white underside and snout. Along with the standard blue vest with the heno-heno-moheji seal, and a Konoha

Yajirobee (ヤジロベエ) is a chūnin of Konohagakure. Yajirobee displayed outward contempt for Naruto Uzumaki in lieu of the Nine-Tailed Fox as many did in those days; voicing his desire for Naruto to be captured and punished for stealing the Scroll of Seals from the Hokage Residence. His attire consists of a helmet, oversized glasses and the older version of the Konoha flak jacket without the scroll pouches. Underneath this he wears a high-collared outfit. He also wears the village's forehead protecto

Yagura (ヤグラ, Yagura) was a genin from Konohagakure that Might Guy was going to train. Before he was able to get to Konoha, he was attacked and captured by the Three Ryūdōin Brothers. The eldest brother, Genshō Ryūdōin, took Yagura's appearance, and tried to get revenge on Guy for killing their father, but they failed. Yagura was later found by his fellow Konoha ninja. He has ice blue eyes and long, pale brown hair. The word "Yagura" (櫓 or 楼) means "tower" or "turret". It could also refer to the

Ya (ヤ) is a member of the Moya Triad. While they do have some ninja skills, Ya and his team prefer doing peculiar things to attract women. Aniki once tried to seduce a woman, who didn't like it, and Kakashi Hatake saved her. This angered Aniki and his teammates, making them want to kill Kakashi. Ya wears a Moyagakure ninja uniform. Ya uses different types of poisons to attack his opponents. Although he and his teammates claim to be Ninja he has virtually no ninja skills. While trying to exact re

Yagura Karatachi (枸橘やぐら, Karatachi Yagura) was the jinchūriki of the Three-Tails, Isobu and the Fourth Mizukage (四代目水影, Yondaime Mizukage, literally meaning: Fourth Water Shadow) of Kirigakure. Yagura is chiefly remembered for a bloody, despotic reign that contributed to Kirigakure being well known as the "Bloody Mist". As a child, Yagura took part in the village's barbaric ritual where Academy students would be forced to kill each other in order to graduate. Following the Three-Tails' revival a

fields.en_description: Yahiko (弥彦) was a shinobi from Amegakure. Alongside his fellow war orphans, Nagato and Konan, he founded and led the Akatsuki in an attempt to bring peace. Following Yahiko's death, Nagato would turn his body into the Deva Path of his Six Paths of Pain, which he used as the continued public image of Akatsuki's leadership. Yahiko was orphaned during the Second Shinobi World War, forcing him to steal food in order to survive prior to teaming up with a fellow war orphan named Konan. Soon after they

Yakumi Uchiha (うちはヤクミ, Uchiha Yakumi) was a member of Konohagakure's Uchiha clan and the Konoha Military Police Force. As a member of the Police Force, he assisted Fugaku Uchiha in his duties. Though much is not known of him, the databook noted that he felt a strong affection towards the Uchiha clan and was fiercely loyal to it. Yakumi had dark hair which he wore in a topknot and dark eyes with pronounced tear troughs. He wore the standard attire of the Konoha shinobi which included a flak jacke

Yakumo Kurama (鞍馬八雲, Kurama Yakumo) is one of the last surviving members of the main branch of the Kurama clan, as well as the heiress to the clan. Born with a weak body, she was unable to perform the physical activities required of a ninja. Worried about this development, her father petitioned the Third Hokage to grant Yakumo a special tutor to allow her to become a proper ninja. This tutor was Kurenai Yūhi, who was a genjutsu user like Yakumo. Inspired by the example of Rock Lee, who was unabl

Yamame (ヤマメ, Yamame) is a citizen of the Land of Water. During his childhood, Yamame was close friends with Iwana. When Kagura Karatachi had moved to their village, Yamame had noticed he isolated himself from the other children, so he and Iwana approached the boy and befriended him. He is a kind, friendly and positive guy. Yamame treats shinobi with respect and, realising that they are the hope for saving the village, refuses his food in their favour. He also keeps the memory of the deceased Kag

Yakku (ヤック) is a genin from Sunagakure. He has short, brown hair and dark eyes. He wears a dark-coloured, long-sleeved outfit underneath a brown flak jacket, and his village's forehead protector which he wears like a bandanna along with a pair of arm-guards. Yakku met with Temari and Team 7 when they arrived in Sunagakure. He gave them the latest information concerning Gaara's abduction as he escorted them to Kankurō's hospital room.

Yamame (ヤマメ) was a shinobi assisting Orochimaru that appeared in Naruto: The Cross Roads. Yamame like other minor villains thought of herself as being very powerful while she really wasn't. She was very loyal to Orochimaru. Yamame had long brown hair that was styled in multiple big spikes all around her head. She had black eyes and wore a black mask that only covered her mouth and nose and there was a small thin black marking coming out of each side of her mask near her mouth. She wore a female

Yaoki (ヤオキ) is a shinobi from Sunagakure. He is shown to be cowardly and wimpy around Gaara, due to him formerly being a murderous maniac. They later left Gaara behind when Anbu from Sunagakure tried to kill Gaara but later regretted the decision and with encouragement from Naruto, vowed to give Gaara a chance to redeem himself from his past actions. He later befriends Gaara, forming one of Gaara's very first friendships. Yaoki has cheek length black hair and black eyes. He dons the standard att

Yamaoka (ヤマオカ) was a vassal of the Land of Fire's daimyō, Ikkyū Madoka. From what had been seen, Yamaoka was a dutiful and respectful vassal of the daimyō. Yamaoka was an elderly man with short, light-coloured hair which he wore in a pompadour style while keeping the sides short. He also had dark-coloured eyes framed by half-frame glasses and sports a bushy, well-groomed moustache. He wore a white shirt with an upturned collar and a string being used as a bow-tie, with a dark-coloured tuxedo jac

Yashiro Uchiha (うちはヤシロ, Uchiha Yashiro) was a member of the Uchiha clan and the Konoha Military Police Force. Yashiro, alongside Tekka and Inabi, went to question Itachi about his absence from the clan meeting that was kept the night before. He then told Itachi that they had no intention of treating him any different because he was an Anbu and his father, Fugaku had stated that he would watch over him. As Yashiro questioned Itachi about Shisui Uchiha's death, presenting Itachi with Shisui's alle

Yashamaru (夜叉丸) was an Anbu from Sunagakure. He was also the right-hand-man of the Fourth Kazekage. Yashamaru's elder sister, Karura, died shortly after giving birth to her youngest son Gaara, within whom the One-Tailed Shukaku had been sealed. After her death, Yashamaru was appointed as Gaara's caretaker by the Fourth Kazekage. Unlike his fellow villagers, he attempted to understand his nephew's plight as a jinchūriki, and believed that the sand that flew to Gaara's aid in moments of danger was

Yatogo Ryūgen (りゅうげんヤトゴ, Ryūgen Yatogo) is a chūnin of Konohagakure. When he heard that Sasuke Uchiha killed the notorious criminal Itachi Uchiha, he wondered if Sasuke would receive a reward. Sasuke, who was secretly listening nearby, nearly killed Yatogo and his friends for this remark only to be stopped by Tobi. He is a curious shinobi, and is predisposed to easily believing rumours, no matter how baseless they are. Yatogo has short black hair that frames either side of his face and small bla

Yamato (ヤマト), also known as "Tenzō" (テンゾウ, Tenzō), are both code names for this Anbu-turned-jōnin of Konohagakure. As his Wood Release would allow him to be able to keep the Nine-Tails sealed within Naruto Uzumaki in check, he was re-assigned from Anbu to the regular forces, joining Team Kakashi as a temporary replacement for their jōnin-sensei, Kakashi Hatake. While Kakashi eventually returns to the team, Yamato stays on to provide assistance as needed. Yamato graduated from the Academy at the

fields.en_description: Yodo (ヨド) is a chūnin-level kunoichi of Sunagakure. She is a member of a team along with Araya and Shinki. Yodo is described to be extremely confident with a keen gleam in her eyes. She also has no problem showing the extent of her true abilities. Yodo is a fair-skinned girl with blonde hair. While shoulder-length and unruly in the manga, it is straight and reaches her thighs in the anime, which is mostly covered by the hood of her jacket. She has a large bang that partially covers her forehead

Yokaze (ヨカゼ) is a medical-nin from Konohagakure. Yokaze always wanted to become a member of the Anbu of his village and therefore admires those who hail from the unit. He is very sacrificial, protecting Yūgao from a serious attack under the cost of his own good health. Yokaze has long, wavy brown hair tied in a low ponytail, and black eyes. He wears the Allied Shinobi Forces' forehead protector, and a medical gown over his flak jacket. During the pursuit to retrieve the KIA scroll, he wears a st

fields.en_description: Yokozuna (ヨコズナ) is the leader of the Sumo Wrestlers. Yokozuna is a bit of a braggart as well as a coward. He loudly announced his presence to the area he was invading but hastily retreated when he was greeted with hostile resistance. Yokozuna is a rotund man, and wears his black hair in the modern chonmage style known as "oicho". He wears no top and a traditional sumo bottom. Yokozuna and his team attacked Konohagakure during the Fourth Shinobi World War. He and his men however, were stopped by

Yomi (黄泉) was an evil medical-nin and the secondary antagonist in Naruto Shippūden the Movie. Yomi came from a long line of followers of Mōryō who had spent generations perfecting a dark form of medical ninjutsu. A very long time ago, there was a member of his clan that made an attempt to utilise Mōryō to take over the world, but was stopped by Miroku after she sealed Mōryō away. Yomi was an extremely dedicated individual going to almost any lengths to further his goals. He wasn't one to state h

fields.en_description: Yomito Hirasaka (比良坂ヨミト, Hirasaka Yomito) is a shinobi from Yumegakure's Hirasaka clan that appears in Naruto Shippūden: Kizuna Drive. Yomito is generally a calm and gloomy person, often referencing the dead, their souls and feelings. He, like his friends, Ryuka and Taisa, wanted revenge on Naruto Uzumaki after he was framed by Gensui for the destruction of his village, and referred to him as a beast. During battle Yomito is quiet but once he activates his transformation he becomes more into the

Yome (ヨメ) is a kunoichi of Sunagakure and a teammate of Sen and Shira. Yome used to play with Sen and Temari when they were little. While still in the Academy, Yome and Sen watched from afar as Shira was mocked and ridiculed by their peers. Despite being banned from joining the Academy because of his lack in ninjutsu and genjutsu, Shira continued to train himself in taijutsu. Sen and Yome ultimately came to admire the young man and were happy for him when Gaara, the new Fifth Kazekage, revoked t

Yone (ヨネ) is a villager of the Genjutsu Tree Village. Jiraiya stated that she and her husband Sukune were very kind to him when he first visited that village. Yone has long brown hair with her bangs going down the left side of her face. She has bright brownish greyish-coloured eyes and she wears a purple headband. Her bangs reach over her headband. Yone, along with the other women and children, was held hostage by Kandachi and his men when they killed Sukune and took over their village. She was

Yoroi Akadō (赤胴ヨロイ, Akadō Yoroi) is a Konohagakure shinobi and a teammate of Kabuto Yakushi and Misumi Tsurugi, who later defected and joined Orochimaru and Otogakure. Yoroi was previously a shinobi of Konohagakure. For unknown reasons, he defected to Otogakure with his teammate, Misumi Tsurugi. He and his team were able to keep their defection a secret, and at some point, Orochimaru had them participate in the Chūnin Exams to spy on the other participants. Yoroi was a brash and strong-willed ni

Despite it being a smaller and impoverished country, they enjoyed having decent meals. They would also often spend their time playing under a large peach tree. Like his brothers, Yoguga was an extremely committed man. He would willingly sacrifice himself for his brothers and his mission. This came from the hardships of his childhood. fields.en_description: Yoshiteru (ヨシテル) is a samurai of the Land of Iron. Yoshiteru has been described as being reliable. Yoshiteru wears the standard samurai attire. To show his rank, his helmet is equipped with horns. As a high-ranking officer of the samurai, Yoshiteru is presumably an experienced fighter and proficient in kenjutsu, preferring the two-sword style. To boost the reach and the cutting ability of his swords, he can channel chakra through them. Furthermore, he can use said chakra for a long-range attack.

Yoshino Nara (奈良ヨシノ, Nara Yoshino) is the wife of the former head of Konohagakure's Nara clan: Shikaku. Usually a very strict, and overbearing woman, she can also be very warm and gentle at times. Due to the passive nature of the Nara men, it's not surprising that she and Shikaku got married. He appears to have accepted the fact that she's the dominant of the two of them and avoids doing anything to provoke her. This has resulted in their son Shikamaru not taking his father seriously — especiall

Yotaka (ヨタカ) is a Hoshigakure shinobi who worked under Akahoshi. After the Third Hoshikage cancelled the star training because its risk was far too great, Yotaka and his partner Shisō led by Akahoshi, came to request the Third to resume the training. After the Hoshikage refused, he along with his partner assisted Akahoshi in assassinating the Third. Though questioning if it was going to far, they were silenced by Akahoshi. After this event, they claimed that the Third suddenly grew ill and died

Yota (ヨタ) was a young child from an unknown clan with mysterious powers of weather manipulation. Yota was born into a travelling clan who could manipulate weather and use their skills to make a living. Five years before the start of the series, Yota died at a young age of natural causes due to his frailty yet was later reincarnated by Orochimaru as a test subject in his research on Impure World Reincarnation. Sent to Konohagakure on Orochimaru's command, Yota met Chōji Akimichi, Shikamaru Nara,

fields.en_description: Yubeshi (ユベシ) is a dango shop waitress in Konohagakure. A citizen of the old town in Konohagakure, Yubeshi fell in love with Sabure, the grandson of her grandfather's friend Taruto from the new city. However, a rift began growing between their grandfathers and the residents of the old town and new city over a festival's firework display, to the point Yubeshi and Sabure felt they couldn't tell their grandfathers about their relationship, despite already having picked a wedding date. When Ohagi an

Yubina (ユビナ) is a former kunoichi now operating as a doctor in a small facility in the outskirts of the Land of Valleys. Yubina was once a medical-nin. Due to her sadistic nature making her methods excessive, she ultimately resigned from ninja work. Yubina is a very eccentric woman, almost constantly having a sadistic smile on her face. While committed to saving lives, in a paradox nature, she relishes in watching people endure pain. She tends to make her treatment as painful as possible, just t

Yui (ユイ) is a citizen from the Land of Fire. Yui has neck-length brown hair. She also has long bangs that she keeps parted. Yui visits the same hot spring as the new Team 7, hoping to relieve the stiffness of her shoulders and back. When she overhears Naruto's argument with Sai, she laughs. "Yui" (ゆい) means "pioneering".

Yugito Nii (二位ユギト, Nii Yugito) was a jōnin from Kumogakure and the jinchūriki of the Two-Tails, Matatabi. Yugito was made the Two-Tails' jinchūriki at the age of two and, at the end of a detestable training programme that was imposed on her, she was able to control her transformation into her tailed beast at will. At some point in the anime, Yugito agreed to give Nekobaa a paw print of the Two-Tails for the Paw Encyclopaedia. Yugito gained confidence in herself through hard work, making her a co

Yuina Itomaki (糸巻ユイナ, Itomaki Yuina) is an Academy student of Konohagakure. Yuina is a quiet and shy young girl. She's also very polite, always addressing people with proper honourifics. While not very out-spoken, she is firm in her decision of wanting to become a shinobi. In the presence of more out-spoken peers, she will follow them if they take an initiative, even when Yuina herself disagrees with their methods and viewpoints. Yuina is dedicated to becoming a shinobi, so she took up studying

Yukai (ユカイ) is a young shinobi from Kumogakure and the leader of the Thundercloud Unit. Yukai was a young prodigy from Kumogakure, well versed in kenjutsu and assigned to be the Thundercloud Unit's leader in the Fourth Shinobi World War. Despite his young age, Yukai showed great courage and leadership skills, managing to keep calm and focused while facing certain death when he and his unit were cornered by nearly two thousand White Zetsu clones. He also greatly respects Omoi, referring to the ol

Yukata (ユカタ) is a young kunoichi from Sunagakure. She is part of a genin group alongside Matsuri and Mikoshi. Yukata, alongside Matsuri and Mikoshi, is shown to have been set to take part in the Chūnin Exams, which would be held in Konohagakure and Sunagakure. Once entering the exams, Matsuri and her teammates were randomly split into different rooms to take the written test. On a monitor, Shikamaru Nara explained that everyone only needs to answer one question on the test, but their team's comb

fields.en_description: Yuki is an academy student of Konohagakure who appears in Naruto Shippūden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 4. Yuki is a kind-hearted girl who cares about her friends at the academy. She takes a liking to Shino Aburame. Yuki is a young girl with long black hair that frames her face and black eyes. Naruto Uzumaki runs into Iruka Umino and Yuki near the residential area. Yuki's crying because Mabo's group went missing while they were practising their jutsu. Earlier, thinking that someone evil may have kidnap

Yukimi (ユキミ) is a young girl and the last living member of the Iburi clan. Like the rest of her clan, Yukimi's underdeveloped ability to become smoke made her vulnerable to wind, forcing them to live underground. She and her brother, Tenzō, would regularly go as close to the surface as possible to listen to it. One day, her clan was found by Orochimaru. Taking an interest in their abilities, he was able to partially stabilise their power by branding them with his cursed seal. Telling them that h

fields.en_description: Yuki (ユキ, Yuki) is a messenger hawk owned by Tsuzura Shitakiri. While still a chick, Yuki fell out of her nest. She was found by Tsuzura, who cared for and raised her as his pet. Having been raised by Tsuzura, Yuki is very fond of and loyal to the boy. Yuki is a pure white hawk. Yuki is trained to be a messenger, carrying notes to locations. Main article: Labyrinth Game Arc As Tsuzura continued his efforts to help Yuki become better adjusted to living in the wilderness, they were approached by B

Yurika (ユリカ) is a Konohagakure kunoichi and a member of the Konoha Cryptology Team. She has short, straight brown hair and eyes of the same colour. She wears a shade of pink lipstick along with a short dress with the kanji for "number" (号, gō), which itself comes from the word "cypher" (暗号, angō) on the back of it, a white belt around her waist and a pair of low-heeled sandals. Yurika is a highly skilled decoder and has been called the best in Konohagakure. After being called to the Konoha Aviar

Yurinojō (百合之丞) is a ninja from the Land of Vegetables. He is skilled in the use of his clan's secret flower-oriented techniques. He grew up and trained alongside his friend Kikunojō, with whom he shared a friendly rivalry. When still kids, he and Kikunojō developed a huge crush on Tsunade and fought for her affection (at least according to Tsunade). Yurinojō is a more insecure person than Kikunojō, but at the same time he is not afraid to contradict Haruna, with equal respect to his comrade. Re

Yurito (ユリト) is a shinobi of Konohagakure. Yurito is a kind and dutiful individual. He looks up to Shikamaru Nara. Yurito has short blond hair and blue eyes. He also wears a standard Konoha uniform. After Yurito was injured by Sekiei, he began wearing a large black cloth over the right side of his face, covering his damaged eye and ear. He showed noticeable speed and likewise was proficient in close-range combat, being able to fend off a double-team assault from Metal Lee and Iwabee Yuino, both

Yurui (ユルイ) is a shinobi of Kumogakure. Yurui has an arrogant personality as he looks down on Konohagakure shinobi and boasts the superiority of Kumo. He openly taunts those who he believes are inferior to him. He jumps to conclusions, calling Boruto weak, even though he had not seen him fight and being the Hokage's son. He also appears to be rather controlling, trying to remove Boruto and Sarada from their booth even though they were already sitting there. He admires Killer B. Yurui has fair sk

Yurui (ユルイ, Yurui) was a Kumogakure shinobi. Yurui was a dark-skinned man with dark eyes, shoulder-length dull-purple hair, thin dull-purple eyebrows two sets of loop earrings in each earlobe and a labret piercing as well. He wore the standard attire of the Kumo-nin. Although his abilities were never shown, being a leader of a team implies that he was quite capable. According to Nurui, he was a great strategist and also skilled in laying traps, as he prepared a clever trap using the preexisting

Yōji Aburame (油女ヨウジ, Aburame Yōji) was a member of Konohagakure's Aburame clan. After joining Root, he sometimes went by the name Sugaru (スガル, Sugaru). Yōji was raised by an abusive father who was jealous of Yōji's natural talent. When Yōji accidentally spilled juice on his father on his fifth birthday, his father slit his throat to punish him. Yōji retaliated by killing his father. Orphaned, Yōji was soon recruited into Root, a faction of the Anbu led by Danzō Shimura. Because he'd lost the abi

Yōrō (ヨウロウ) is a jōnin from Takigakure. He has short spiky black hair and small black eyes. His outfit consists of a dark violet vest, with two scrolls attached to it, a light violet turtleneck, and dark green-coloured pants. He wears a blue forehead protector. Yōrō is capable of launching a barrage of shuriken shadow clones at opponents. The fact that he seemingly does not require hand seals to perform this technique, suggests that he has excellent chakra control. Yōrō and Kegon were instructed

Yūdachi (ユウダチ) is a genin from Amegakure. He and Ryūsui were the ones delivering corpses to the highest tower in Amegakure, where Pain allegedly resides. Their most recent delivery was the corpse of what would be the second Animal Path. Yūdachi has short messy brown hair and dark-coloured eyes. He wears a black forehead protector on his forehead. He has a scratch through the village symbol on his forehead protector to indicate his loyalty to Pain. He also has a scar on his right cheek. According

Yūga (ユウガ) was a shinobi from the Land of Haze. Yūga and his brothers were orphans who found a home in the Land of Haze's orphanage. Despite it being a smaller and impoverished country, they enjoyed having decent meals. They would also often spend their time playing under a large peach tree. Like his brothers, Yūga was an extremely committed man. He would willingly sacrifice himself for his brothers and his mission. This came from the hardships of his childhood. fields.en_description: Yūgao Uzuki (卯月夕顔, Uzuki Yūgao) is an Anbu of Konohagakure. In the anime, during her childhood, Yūgao was selected to join the Anbu due to her skill in kenjutsu and sensory abilities. During her early years as an Anbu, Yūgao served under Kakashi Hatake, looking up to him as a role model. Four years after the Nine-Tailed Demon Fox's Attack, Kakashi was ordered to investigate one of the secret labs belonging to Orochimaru. Upon returning, Kakashi informed the Third Hokage of a Root member who save

fields.en_description: She was Yūkimaru's mother. Yūkimaru lived with his mother in a village that was attacked by Orochimaru during his childhood. Guren was one of the ninja raiding the village, killing everyone she came across. When she collapsed, it was Yūkimaru's mother who tended her. When Guren woke up, she said she would close her eyes and let her escape as an act of gratefulness towards the kind woman. However, Guren still had to follow Orochimaru's orders, and when they met again Guren had to kill her to keep

Yūki Minazuki (水無月ユウキ, Minazuki Yūki) is a jōnin from Konohagakure and the leader of Team 2. According to Danzō Shimura, Yūki had been placed in charge of a number of different genin teams over the years. Every time one of his students proved to be more talented than he was, he would find some reason to send them back to the Academy; Danzō believed Yūki did this out of jealousy. When Yūki was first placed in charge of Team 2, it consisted of Itachi Uchiha, Tenma Izumo, and Shinko Inari, all rece

Yūkimaru (幽鬼丸) is a young orphan who became one of Orochimaru's test subjects, due to his ability to partially control the Three-Tails. Yūkimaru lived with his mother in a village that was attacked by Orochimaru's followers when Yūkimaru was a child. Guren was one of the ninja raiding the village for Orochimaru, killing everyone she came across. When she collapsed, it was Yūkimaru's mother who tended her. When Guren woke up, she said she would spare her as an act of gratefulness towards the kind

Yūra (由良) was a jōnin from Sunagakure. He was also a sleeper agent of Sasori. As a Suna ninja, he served as a trusted member of the Kazekage advisory council of Suna for four years. At some point in the past, he became a sleeper agent for Sasori, under the influence of his Memory-Concealing Manipulative Sand Technique. When it was agreed between the Fifth Hokage and Gaara, the newly appointed Fifth Kazekage, to host an early Chūnin Exams, Yūra explained the details to the Suna Council. While man
